results.name: Bilateral Optic Nerve Meningioma
match: Bilateral Meningioma of the Optic Nerve
search: Bilateral Meningioma of the Optic Nerve
results.definition: Meningiomas that affects both optic nerves.
synonyms: Bilateral Meningioma of the Optic Nerve

results.name: Incontinentia Pigmenti
results.definition: A rare disorder caused by mutations in the IKBKG gene. It is characterized by skin abnormalities, alopecia, dystrophic nails, and abnormal tooth shape. The skin changes evolve from an initial blistering rash, to wart-like lesions, and eventually to hypopigmentation.

results.name: Pleural Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that involves the serous membrane that lines the lungs and thoracic cavity. Most pleural neoplasms are metastatic. Diffuse malignant mesothelioma is the most common primary malignant neoplasm of the pleura.
results.glossary_definition: Neoplasms of the thin serous membrane that envelopes the lungs and lines the thoracic cavity. Pleural neoplasms are exceedingly rare and are usually not diagnosed until they are advanced because in the early stages they produce no symptoms.

results.name: Megaesophagus
results.definition: An abnormal dilation of the esophagus not due to obstruction.

results.name: Spinal Chordoma
results.definition: A slow-growing malignant bone tumor arising from the remnants of the notochord and occurring in the spine. It is characterized by a lobulated growth pattern, myxoid stroma formation, and the presence of physaliphorous cells.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Balanitis Xerotica Obliterans
results.definition: A chronic and progressive inflammatory process that affects the glans penis and the foreskin. It presents with white atrophic patches in the glans of penis and foreskin and it is often associated with the development of a sclerotic, whitish ring in the tip of the foreskin that may lead to phimosis. It is also known as lichen sclerosus of the penis.

results.name: Uterine Corpus Intravenous Leiomyomatosis
results.definition: A rare benign neoplasm characterized by the presence of smooth muscle cells growing within the veins of the uterine corpus. The intravascular neoplasm growth occurs outside the confines of an adjacent leiomyoma.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Splenic Manifestation of Leukemia
children: Splenic Manifestation of Hairy Cell Leukemia

results.name: Endometrial Transitional Cell Carcinoma
results.definition: A rare primary carcinoma of the endometrium characterized by the presence of malignant epithelial cells resembling urothelial transitional cells. The malignant transitional cells constitute at least 90% of the tumor cells.

results.name: Ovarian Sarcoma
results.definition: A rare, aggressive malignant mesenchymal neoplasm that arises from the ovary. The prognosis is poor.
children: Ovarian Low Grade Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma

results.name: Cysticercosis
results.definition: A parasitic infection caused by the larval form of Taenia solium. It is a disseminated infection affecting the central nervous system, subcutaneous tissues, lungs, heart and liver. The most serious complications result from infection of the brain parenchyma. Patients may develop seizures, hydrocephalus, encephalopathy and meningoencephalitis.
results.glossary_definition: Infection with CYSTICERCUS, a larval form of the various tapeworms of the genus Taenia (usually T. solium in man). In humans they penetrate the intestinal wall and invade subcutaneous tissue, brain, eye, muscle, heart, liver, lung, and peritoneum. Brain involvement results in NEUROCYSTICERCOSIS. (From Dorland, 28th ed)

results.name: Ovarian Mucinous Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: An invasive adenocarcinoma that arises from the ovary and is characterized by the presence of malignant epithelial cells that contain intracytoplasmic mucin. There is cellular atypia, increased layering of cells, complexity of glands, and papillary formations.

results.name: Vulvar Melanoma
results.definition: A usually pigmented, nodular or polypoid malignant neoplasm that originates from melanocytes and arises from the vulva. It presents with bleeding and dysuria.

results.name: Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma
results.definition: A usually aggressive, poorly differentiated invasive adenocarcinoma characterized by the presence of malignant glandular cells in which the nucleus is pressed to one side by the presence of intracytoplasmic mucus. It may arise from the stomach, small and large intestine, ampulla of Vater, appendix, gallbladder, pancreas, lung, bladder, breast, and prostate gland.
results.glossary_definition: A highly malignant type of cancer typically found in glandular cells that line the digestive organs. The cells resemble signet rings when examined under a microscope.
children: Acinar Prostate Adenocarcinoma, Signet Ring Variant
Ampulla of Vater Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma
Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Signet Ring Cell Variant
Extrahepatic Bile Duct Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma

results.name: Testicular Seminoma, Pseudoglandular Variant
results.definition: A morphologic variant of testicular seminoma characterized by the presence of seminoma cells arranged in pseudoglandular patterns and few lymphocytes.

results.name: Non-Functional Pancreatic Delta Cell Neuroendocrine Tumor
results.name_text: Non-Functional Pancreatic Delta Cell Neuroendocrine Tumor
match: Non-Functional Pancreatic Delta Cell Neuroendocrine Tumor
Non-Functional Pancreatic Delta Cell Neuroendocrine Tumor
search: Non-Functional Pancreatic Delta Cell Neuroendocrine Tumor
Non-Functional Pancreatic Delta Cell Neuroendocrine Tumor
results.definition: A usually malignant neuroendocrine tumor arising from the delta cells of the pancreas. It is not associated with a hormonal syndrome.
synonyms: Non-Functional Pancreatic Delta Cell Neuroendocrine Tumor

results.name: Phimosis
results.definition: A condition in which there is constriction in the tip of the foreskin resulting in inability to fully retract the foreskin over the glans penis. Causes include balanoposthitis, balanitis xerotica obliterans, and untreated diabetes.
results.glossary_definition: The inability to retract the foreskin over the glans penis due to tightness of the prepuce.

results.name: Esophageal Atresia
results.definition: A congenital abnormality of the esophagus in which the upper esophagus ends as a blind pouch and does not connect with the lower esophagus; it is often accompanied by a tracheoesophageal fistula. Signs and symptoms in a newborn with this abnormality include excessive salivation, choking, coughing, and the development of cyanosis and respiratory distress when fed.

results.name: Aortic Valve Regurgitation
results.definition: The backward flow of blood from the aorta into the left ventricle, owing to insufficiency of the aortic semilunar valve; it may be chronic or acute.
results.glossary_definition: The backward flow of blood from the aorta into the left ventricle, owing to insufficiency of the aortic semilunar valve; it may be chronic or acute.

results.name: Conduct Disorder
results.definition: A disorder diagnosed in childhood or adolescence age group characterized by aggressive behavior, deceitfulness, destruction of property or violation of rules that is persistent and repetitive, and within a one year period.

results.name: Kidney Cyst
results.definition: Abnormal fluid filled sac within the kidney, either acquired or congenital.

results.name: Cervical Basaloid Carcinoma
results.definition: An aggressive variant of cervical squamous cell carcinoma characterized by the presence of nests of malignant basaloid squamous cells with scant amount of cytoplasm.

results.name: Lacrimal System Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the lacrimal apparatus.
results.glossary_definition: Diseases of the lacrimal apparatus.

results.name: Bladder Leiomyoma
results.definition: A well-circumscribed benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising from the bladder. It is characterized by the presence of spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, interlacing fascicles, and a whorled pattern.

results.name: Cutaneous Melanoma
match: Malignant Melanoma of Skin Stage Unspecified
search: Malignant Melanoma of Skin Stage Unspecified
results.definition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin. Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi. Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.
synonyms: Malignant Melanoma of Skin Stage Unspecified

results.name: Inner Ear Neoplasm
results.definition: A rare neoplasm that arises from the inner ear. Representative examples include lipoma and acoustic schwannoma.

results.name: Malignant Testicular Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor
results.name_text: Malignant Testicular Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor
match: Malignant Testicular Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor

Malignant Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor of Testis

Malignant Testicular Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor

Malignant Testicular Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor
Testicular Non-Seminomatous Malignant Germ Cell Neoplasm
Testicular nonseminomatous germ cell tumor, NOS
results.definition: A classification of testicular cancers that arise in specialized sex cells called germ cells. Nonseminomas include embryonal carcinoma, teratoma, choriocarcinoma, and yolk sac tumor.
synonyms: Malignant Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Cancer of Testis
Malignant Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Cancer of the Testis

Malignant Testicular Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor
Testicular Non-Seminomatous Malignant Germ Cell Neoplasm
Testicular nonseminomatous germ cell tumor, NOS

results.name: Localized Chondrosarcoma
results.definition: A non-disseminated skeletal or extraskeletal chondrosarcoma.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Clear Cell Acanthoma
results.definition: An acanthoma characterized by the presence of psoriasiform epidermal acanthosis and basal cells with pale cytoplasm.

results.name: Ciliary Body Melanoma
match: Malignant Melanoma of the Ciliary Body
search: Malignant Melanoma of the Ciliary Body
results.definition: A rare uveal melanoma that arises from the ciliary body. Patients may present with blurred vision, visual field loss, floaters, and ocular pain. The prognosis is usually poor.
synonyms: Malignant Melanoma of the Ciliary Body
children: Intermediate Cell Type Ciliary Body Melanoma

results.name: Ureter Squamous Cell Carcinoma
match: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Ureter
search: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Ureter
results.definition: A rare squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the ureter.
synonyms: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Ureter

results.name: Blindness
results.definition: The lack of vision. It is caused by neurological or physiological factors.
results.glossary_definition: Profound visual impairment despite optimal refractive correction.

results.name: Ovarian Yolk Sac Tumor, Polyvesicular Vitelline Pattern
results.name_text: Ovarian Yolk Sac Tumor, Polyvesicular Vitelline Pattern
match: Ovarian Yolk Sac Tumor, Polyvesicular Vitelline Pattern
Ovarian Yolk Sac Tumor, Polyvesicular Vitelline Pattern
search: Ovarian Yolk Sac Tumor, Polyvesicular Vitelline Pattern
Ovarian Yolk Sac Tumor, Polyvesicular Vitelline Pattern
results.definition: A yolk sac tumor that arises from the ovary and is characterized by the presence of multiple dilated spaces lined by cells that resemble mesothelial cells. The dilated spaces coexist with columnar epithelial tissues.
synonyms: Ovarian Yolk Sac Tumor, Polyvesicular Vitelline Pattern

results.name: Hereditary Meningioma
results.definition: A meningioma that is transmitted from the parents to an offspring.

results.name: Esophageal Mucoepidermoid Carcinoma
results.definition: A rare carcinoma of the esophagus which contains squamous cells, mucus secreting cells, and cells of an intermediate type. (WHO)

results.name: Dandy-Walker Malformation
results.definition: A rare congenital brain malformation disorder characterized by agenesis or hypoplasia of the cerebellar vermis, cystic dilatation of the fourth ventricle, and enlargement of the posterior fossa.

results.name: Neurofibromatosis
results.definition: An autosomal dominant hereditary neoplastic syndrome. Two distinct clinicopathological entities are recognized: neurofibromatosis type 1 and neurofibromatosis type 2. Neurofibromatosis type 1 is associated with the presence of cafe-au-lait cutaneous lesions, multiple neurofibromas, malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors, optic nerve gliomas, and bone lesions. Neurofibromatosis type 2 is associated with the presence of schwannomas, meningiomas, and gliomas.
results.glossary_definition: A group of disorders characterized by an autosomal dominant pattern of inheritance with high rates of spontaneous mutation and multiple neurofibromas or neurilemmomas. NEUROFIBROMATOSIS 1 (generalized neurofibromatosis) accounts for approximately 95% of cases, although multiple additional subtypes (e.g., NEUROFIBROMATOSIS 2, neurofibromatosis 3, etc.) have been described. (From Neurochirurgie 1998 Nov;44(4):267-72)

results.name: Alcohol Dependence
results.definition: Physical and psychological dependence on alcohol.
results.glossary_definition: A chronic disease in which a person craves drinks that contain alcohol and is unable to control his or her drinking. A person with this disease also needs to drink greater amounts to get the same effect and has withdrawal symptoms after stopping alcohol use. Alcoholism affects physical and mental health, and can cause problems with family, friends, and work.

results.name: Dacryocystitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the lacrimal sac.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the lacrimal sac. (Dorland, 27th ed)

results.name: Hereditary Mucosal Leukokeratosis
results.definition: An autosomal dominant inherited disorder characterized by thickened and spongy oral mucosa with a white tint. It may affect other anatomic sites as well.

results.name: Mixed Receptive-Expressive Language Disorder
results.definition: A disorder characterized by an impairment in the development of an individual's expressive and receptive language capabilities which is in contrast to his/her nonverbal intellect. The impairment may be acquired (i.e., due to a brain lesion or head trauma) or developmental (i.e., no known neurological insult).

results.name: Esophageal Achalasia
results.definition: A finding indicating the lack of adequate relaxation of the lower esophageal sphincter resulting in difficulty swallowing food.

results.name: Penile Sarcoma
results.definition: A malignant soft tissue neoplasm that arises from the penis. Representative examples include Kaposi sarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, and angiosarcoma.

results.name: Cecum Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the cecum. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include lipoma and leiomyoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma. Cecal adenomas always exhibit epithelial dysplasia and are considered premalignant neoplasms.

results.name: Chondrosarcoma
results.definition: A malignant cartilaginous matrix-producing mesenchymal neoplasm arising from the bone and soft tissue. It usually affects middle-aged to elderly adults. The pelvic bones, ribs, shoulder girdle, and long bones are the most common sites of involvement. Most chondrosarcomas arise de novo, but some may develop in a preexisting benign cartilaginous lesion.
results.glossary_definition: A type of cancer that forms in bone cartilage. It usually starts in the pelvis (between the hip bones), the shoulder, the ribs, or at the ends of the long bones of the arms and legs. A rare type of chondrosarcoma called extraskeletal chondrosarcoma does not form in bone cartilage. Instead, it forms in the soft tissues of the upper part of the arms and legs. Chondrosarcoma can occur at any age but is more common in people older than 40 years. It is a type of bone cancer.
parents: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Benign Migratory Glossitis
results.definition: A benign condition characterized by the development of irregular patches in the surface of the tongue resulting in a map-like appearance. The patches migrate from day to day and usually resolve without treatment.

results.name: Parathyroid Gland Chief Cell Adenoma
match: Chief Cell Adenoma of Parathyroid Gland
Chief Cell Adenoma of the Parathyroid Gland
Chief Cell Adenoma of the Parathyroid
search: Chief Cell Adenoma of Parathyroid Gland
Chief Cell Adenoma of the Parathyroid Gland
Chief Cell Adenoma of the Parathyroid
results.definition: A parathyroid gland adenoma composed predominantly of neoplastic chief cells. These cells have either slightly eosinophilic or vacuolated cytoplasm, and round nuclei.
synonyms: Chief Cell Adenoma of Parathyroid Gland
Chief Cell Adenoma of the Parathyroid Gland
Chief Cell Adenoma of the Parathyroid

results.name: Urothelial Carcinoma
match: Transitional Cell Carcinoma of the Urinary Tract
Transitional cell carcinoma of the urothelial tract
search: Transitional Cell Carcinoma of the Urinary Tract
Transitional cell carcinoma of the urothelial tract
results.definition: A malignant neoplasm derived from the transitional epithelium of the urinary tract (urinary bladder, ureter, urethra, or renal pelvis). It is frequently papillary.
synonyms: Transitional Cell Carcinoma of the Urinary Tract
Transitional cell carcinoma of the urothelial tract
children: Renal Pelvis and Ureter Urothelial Carcinoma

results.name: Pancreatic Lymphoma
results.definition: A lymphoma that arises from the pancreas with the bulk of the tumor localized to this organ. The vast majority of cases are non-Hodgkin lymphomas of B-cell phenotype and include mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue lymphomas, follicular lymphomas, and diffuse large B-cell lymphomas.

results.name: Malignant Ovarian Epithelial Tumor
results.definition: An invasive malignant tumor that originates from the surface epithelium of the ovary. It is composed of malignant epithelial cells and stroma. Representative examples include serous adenocarcinoma, mucinous adenocarcinoma, endometrioid adenocarcinoma, clear cell adenocarcinoma, and malignant Brenner tumor.

results.name: Adrenal Cortex Carcinoma
results.definition: A rare, usually large (greater than 5cm), malignant epithelial tumor arising from the adrenal cortical cells. Symptoms are usually related to the excessive production of hormones, and include Cushing's syndrome and virilism in women. Common sites of metastasis include liver, lung, bone, and retroperitoneal lymph nodes. Advanced radiologic procedures have enabled the detection of small tumors, resulting in the improvement of the 5-year survival.
results.glossary_definition: A rare cancer that forms in the outer layer of tissue of the adrenal gland (a small organ on top of each kidney that makes steroid hormones, adrenaline, and noradrenaline to control heart rate, blood pressure, and other body functions).

results.name: Cystinosis
results.definition: An autosomal recessive hereditary disorder characterized by defective transportation of cystine across the lysosomal membranes and systemic deposition of cystine crystals in the body. It is associated with slight increase of the plasma cystine, cystinuria, aminoaciduria, glycosuria, polyuria, hypophosphatemia, rickets, and renal tubular dysfunction.
results.glossary_definition: Lysosomal storage disorders of unknown molecular defect, characterized by widespread deposition of cystine crystals in reticuloendothelial cells. (From Dorland, 27th ed)

results.name: Papillary Serous Cystadenocarcinoma
results.definition: A malignant cystic serous epithelial neoplasm characterized by the presence of malignant glandular epithelial cells forming papillary structures. Stromal invasion is present.
results.glossary_definition: An aggressive cancer that usually affects the uterus/endometrium, peritoneum, or ovary.

results.name: Nonspecific Interstitial Pneumonia
results.definition: Idiopathic interstitial pneumonia characterized by chronic inflammation and fibrosis in the interstitial lung tissue. It includes cases that cannot be classified into one of the other types of idiopathic interstitial pneumonia.

results.name: Penile Leukoplakia
results.definition: A precancerous condition characterized by the presence of abnormal whitish areas on the glans or prepuce of the penis. Risk factors include chronic irritation, inflammation, and infection of the penis, and poor genital hygiene.

results.name: Status Asthmaticus
results.definition: An acute exacerbation of asthma, characterized by inadequate response to initial bronchodilators.
results.glossary_definition: An acute exacerbation of asthma, characterized by an inadequate response to the initial use of bronchodilators and the progressive worsening of bronchial obstruction and shortness of breath, which can result in the need for mechanical ventilation and/or possibly death.

results.name: Vaginal Carcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma arising from the vaginal epithelium. The majority of vaginal carcinomas are squamous cell carcinomas.
results.glossary_definition: Cancer that forms in the tissues of the vagina (birth canal). The vagina leads from the cervix (the opening of the uterus) to the outside of the body. The most common type of vaginal cancer is squamous cell carcinoma, which starts in the thin, flat cells lining the vagina. Another type of vaginal cancer is adenocarcinoma, cancer that begins in glandular cells in the lining of the vagina.

results.name: Fallopian Tube Leiomyosarcoma
results.definition: An aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, arising from the fallopian tube. It is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic spindle cells.

results.name: Neck Carcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the anatomic structures of the neck region.

match: Oat Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of Lung
Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Lung
search: Oat Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of Lung
Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Lung
synonyms: Oat Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of Lung
Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Lung
results.definition: A highly aggressive subtype of lung carcinoma characterized by the presence of malignant small cells and necrosis. Metastatic disease is usually present at the time of diagnosis.
results.glossary_definition: An aggressive (fast-growing) cancer that forms in tissues of the lung and can spread to other parts of the body. The cancer cells look small and oval-shaped when looked at under a microscope.
results.name: Small Cell Lung Carcinoma
Endometriosis
results.definition: The growth of functional endometrial tissue in anatomic sites outside the uterine body. It most often occurs in the pelvic organs.
results.glossary_definition: A benign condition in which tissue that looks like endometrial tissue grows in abnormal places in the abdomen.

results.name: Mixed Epithelial and Mesenchymal Hepatoblastoma
results.definition: A hepatoblastoma characterized by the presence of fetal and embryonal epithelial components and a mesenchymal component.
ancestors: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Neoplasm

results.name: Intraocular Retinoblastoma
results.definition: Retinoblastoma restricted to local involvement.

results.name: Pleomorphic Xanthoastrocytoma
results.definition: A WHO grade ll astrocytic tumor with a relatively favorable prognosis. It is characterized by pleomorphic and lipidized cells expressing GFAP often surrounded by a reticulin network and eosinophilic granular bodies. It presents in the superficial cerebral hemispheres and involves the meninges. It typically affects children and young adults.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Actinic (Solar) Keratosis
results.definition: A precancerous lesion of the skin composed of atypical keratinocytes. It is characterized by the presence of thick, scaly patches of skin. Several histologic variants have been described, including atrophic, acantholytic, and hyperkeratotic variants.
results.glossary_definition: A thick, scaly patch of skin that may become cancer. It usually forms on areas exposed to the sun, such as the face, scalp, back of the hands, or chest. It is most common in people with fair skin.

results.name: Conventional Fibrosarcoma
results.definition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm composed of fibroblasts, and characterized by collagen production and usually a herringbone architectural pattern.

results.name: Meningeal Melanocytoma
results.definition: A usually well differentiated melanocytic neoplasm arising from the meninges. It is characterized by the presence of epithelioid, fusiform, polyhedral, and spindle melanocytes without evidence of hemorrhage, necrosis, or high mitotic activity. Presenting symptoms include headache, vomiting, and neurological manifestations. Complete excision is usually curative.

results.name: Obstructive Jaundice
results.definition: A finding indicating increased bilirubin levels in the blood and urine, due to intrahepatic or extrahepatic obstruction of the biliary system.

results.name: Esophageal Leiomyoma
results.definition: A benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising from the lower part of the esophagus. It is the most common mesenchymal neoplasm of the esophagus. Dysphagia is a frequent clinical symptom.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Germinoma
results.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor arising in the central nervous system. It is characterized by the presence of primitive, large malignant germ cells and lymphocytes.

results.name: Testicular Yolk Sac Tumor, Papillary Pattern
results.name_text: Testicular Yolk Sac Tumor, Papillary Pattern
match: Testicular Yolk Sac Tumor, Papillary Pattern
Testicular Yolk Sac Tumor, Papillary Pattern
search: Testicular Yolk Sac Tumor, Papillary Pattern
Testicular Yolk Sac Tumor, Papillary Pattern
results.definition: A yolk sac tumor that arises from the testis and is characterized by the presence of numerous papillary structures that are lined by cells with prominent nucleoli.
synonyms: Testicular Yolk Sac Tumor, Papillary Pattern
ancestors: Malignant Testicular Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor

results.name: Testicular Leukemia
results.definition: A myeloid or more commonly lymphoid leukemia (acute or chronic) affecting the testis. Microscopically, there is interstitial infiltration of the testis by leukemic cells. Acute lymphoblastic leukemia with testicular involvement is not uncommon in boys. Sometimes (up to 10% of the cases), testicular involvement may be the initial manifestation of relapsed acute lymphoblastic leukemia. --03

results.name: Hemophagocytic Syndrome
results.definition: A classification of rare, non-neoplastic, proliferative disorders of the hematologic system. Primary or familial hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (HLH) is inherited with an autosomal recessive pattern with five known subtypes differentiated by specific genetic mutations. Secondary manifestation of HLH is usually seen in hyperactivated immunologic states such as infection, autoimmune disease or malignancy. Histiocytes in the bone marrow, spleen or lymph nodes become activated to the point that phagocytosis proceeds unchecked. Clinical signs usually present within the first decade and include fever, jaundice, hepatosplenomegaly, lymphadenopathy and skin rash. Prompt initiation of treatment improves survival though prognosis remains poor even with intervention.

results.name: Ovarian Carcinosarcoma
match: Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Neoplasm of Ovary
Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Neoplasm of the Ovary
Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Tumor of Ovary
Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Tumor of the Ovary
Ovarian Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Neoplasm
Ovarian Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Tumor
search: Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Neoplasm of Ovary
Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Neoplasm of the Ovary
Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Tumor of Ovary
Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Tumor of the Ovary
Ovarian Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Neoplasm
Ovarian Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Tumor
results.definition: A highly aggressive malignant neoplasm arising from the ovary. Morphologically, it is a high grade tumor, composed of carcinomatous and sarcomatous elements.
synonyms: Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Neoplasm of Ovary
Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Neoplasm of the Ovary
Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Tumor of Ovary
Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Tumor of the Ovary
Ovarian Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Neoplasm
Ovarian Malignant Mixed Mesodermal Mullerian Tumor

results.name: Gastric Body Carcinoma
match: Cancer of the Body of the Stomach
Carcinoma of the Body of the Stomach
search: Cancer of the Body of the Stomach
Carcinoma of the Body of the Stomach
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the body of the stomach.
synonyms: Cancer of the Body of the Stomach
Carcinoma of the Body of the Stomach

results.name: Skin Fibroepithelial Basal Cell Carcinoma
results.definition: A variant of basal cell carcinoma presenting as an elevated or erythematous nodular lesion usually in the back. Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of cords of basaloid cells extending from the epidermis into the dermis, creating a fenestrating pattern. It follows an indolent course.

results.name: Cervical Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma
match: Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma of the Cervix Uteri
Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma of the Uterine Cervix
Endometrioid Carcinoma of the Cervix Uteri
Endometrioid Carcinoma of the Uterine Cervix
search: Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma of the Cervix Uteri
Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma of the Uterine Cervix
Endometrioid Carcinoma of the Cervix Uteri
Endometrioid Carcinoma of the Uterine Cervix
results.definition: A cervical adenocarcinoma with the histologic characteristics of the endometrioid adenocarcinoma of the endometrium.
synonyms: Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma of the Cervix Uteri
Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma of the Uterine Cervix
Endometrioid Carcinoma of the Cervix Uteri
Endometrioid Carcinoma of the Uterine Cervix

results.name: Pineal Region Meningioma
results.definition: A meningioma that affects the pineal gland.

results.name: Renovascular Hypertension
results.definition: High blood pressure secondary to renal artery stenosis.

results.name: Hantavirus Pulmonary Syndrome
results.definition: An infection caused by Hantaviruses. It manifests with flu-like symptoms but it rapidly progresses to life-threatening respiratory problems.

results.name: Hemosiderosis
results.definition: Accumulation of iron in internal organs.

results.name: Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma
results.definition: A malignant tumor arising from the epithelial cells. Microscopically, the neoplastic epithelial cells form cylindrical spatial configurations (cribriform or classic type of adenoid cystic carcinoma), cordlike structures (tubular type of adenoid cystic carcinoma), or solid structures (basaloid variant of adenoid cystic carcinoma). Adenoid cystic carcinomas mostly occur in the salivary glands. Other primary sites of involvement include the lacrimal gland, the larynx, and the lungs. Adenoid cystic carcinomas spread along nerve sheaths, resulting in severe pain, and they tend to recur. Lymph node metastases are unusual; hematogenous tumor spread is characteristic.
results.glossary_definition: A rare type of cancer that usually begins in the salivary glands.

results.name: Hereditary Melanoma
results.definition: A melanoma defined by the presence of multiple cases of cutaneous melanoma among blood-relatives on the same side of the family. It is caused by germline mutations in the CDKN2A or CDK4 genes. It is associated with an increased risk of pancreatic cancer in a subset of CDKN2A families (WHO, 2006).

results.name: Urea Cycle Metabolism Disorder
results.definition: A genetic inborn error of metabolism characterized by the deficiency of one of the enzymes necessary for the urea cycle. It results in accumulation of ammonia in the body.

results.name: Localized Bone Ewing Sarcoma
match: Localized Ewing's Sarcoma of the Bone
search: Localized Ewing's Sarcoma of the Bone
results.definition: An Ewing sarcoma which is confined to a specific area of the bone and has not spread to other parts of the skeleton.
synonyms: Localized Ewing's Sarcoma of the Bone
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm
Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Bone
Localized Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor

results.name: Eye Carcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from any of the structures of the eye.

results.name: Eyelid Carcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the eyelid. Examples include basal cell carcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma.

results.name: Myeloid Leukemia
results.definition: A clonal proliferation of myeloid cells and their precursors in the bone marrow, peripheral blood, and spleen. When the proliferating cells are immature myeloid cells and myeloblasts, it is called acute myeloid leukemia. When the proliferating myeloid cells are neutrophils, it is called chronic myelogenous leukemia.
results.glossary_definition: leukemia characterized by an uncontrolled proliferation of the myeloid lineage and their precursors in the bone marrow and other sites.

results.name: Granulomatous Gastritis
results.definition: Gastritis that is associated with the presence of granulomas.

results.name: Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
results.definition: A spectrum of malignant tumors, affecting mostly males under age 20, characterized morphologically by the presence of small round cells. Ewing sarcoma and peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor represent the ends of a spectrum, with Ewing sarcoma lacking evidence of neural differentiation and the markers that characterize the peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor. Ewing sarcoma and peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor may share cytogenetic abnormalities, proto-oncogene expression, cell culture and immunohistochemical abnormalities. These tumors may occur in the soft tissues or the bones. Pain and the presence of a mass are the most common clinical symptoms.
results.glossary_definition: A group of cancers that includes Ewing tumor of bone (ETB or Ewing sarcoma of bone), extraosseous Ewing (EOE) tumors, primitive neuroectodermal tumors (PNET or peripheral neuroepithelioma), and Askin tumors (PNET of the chest wall). These tumors all come from the same type of stem cell.
children: Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Bone
Extraskeletal Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
Localized Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor

results.name: Anterior Foramen Magnum Meningioma
match: Meningioma of the Anterior Foramen Magnum
search: Meningioma of the Anterior Foramen Magnum
results.definition: A meningioma that affects the anterior foramen magnum.
synonyms: Meningioma of the Anterior Foramen Magnum

results.name: Periosteal Chondroma
results.definition: A benign neoplasm of bone surface composed of hyaline cartilage. It arises beneath the periosteum and is characterized by the presence of chondrocytes, a lobulated growth pattern, and calcification.

results.name: Gastritis
results.definition: Inflammation of the stomach.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the lining of the stomach.

results.name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
results.definition: A chronic and progressive lung disorder characterized by the loss of elasticity of the bronchial tree and the air sacs, destruction of the air sacs wall, thickening of the bronchial wall, and mucous accumulation in the bronchial tree. The pathologic changes result in the disruption of the air flow in the bronchial airways. Signs and symptoms include shortness of breath, wheezing, productive cough, and chest tightness. The two main types of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease are chronic obstructive bronchitis and emphysema.
results.glossary_definition: A type of lung disease marked by permanent damage to tissues in the lungs, making it hard to breathe. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease includes chronic bronchitis, in which the bronchi (large air passages) are inflamed and scarred, and emphysema, in which the alveoli (tiny air sacs) are damaged. It develops over many years and is usually caused by cigarette smoking.

results.name: Acute Interstitial Pneumonia
results.definition: A rare, rapidly progressing interstitial lung disorder characterized by diffuse and bilateral alveolar damage. Patients present with sudden onset of dyspnea and rapid development of respiratory failure. Management is supportive and hospitalization and mechanical ventilation are usually required.

results.name: Vulvar Leiomyoma
results.definition: A benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising from the vulva. It is characterized by the presence of spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, interlacing fascicles, and a whorled pattern.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Anhidrosis
results.definition: Lack of sweating or the ability to sweat when provoked by the appropriate stimulus.

results.name: Frontal Sinus Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the frontal sinus. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include Schneiderian papilloma and salivary gland-type adenoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma and lymphoma.

results.name: Tyrosinemia Type I
results.definition: Tyrosinemia caused by mutations in the FAH gene. It is characterized by deficiency of the enzyme fumarylacetoacetate hydrolase. It is the most severe form of tyrosinemia. Signs and symptoms appear early in life and include failure to thrive, vomiting, diarrhea, jaundice, and bleeding tendency. It may result in liver and kidney failure.

results.name: Childhood Cerebral Astrocytoma
results.definition: An astrocytoma, without designation of benign or malignant, that is found in the supratentorial region. The infratentorial location is more common in children.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Conventional Malignant Hemangiopericytoma
results.definition: A malignant hemangiopericytoma characterized by the presence of necrotic changes and in some cases high mitotic activity.

results.name: Malignant Urethral Neoplasm
results.definition: Abnormal malignant growth of cells in the urethra (lower urinary tract).

results.name: Lactating Adenoma
results.definition: A tubular type adenoma of the breast in which, during pregnancy and lactation, the epithelial cells show extensive secretory changes.

results.name: Hyperhomocysteinemia
results.definition: A serious metabolic condition caused by mutations in the MTHFR gene, medications, or nutritional deficiency. It results in increased levels of homocysteine in the blood. Patients with this condition are at an increased risk for recurrent blood clots formation and cardiovascular accidents.
results.glossary_definition: Abnormally high level of homocysteine in the blood.

results.name: Esophageal Verrucous Carcinoma
results.definition: A rare variant of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma. It is an exophytic, cauliflower-like or papillary mass that can arise in any part of the esophagus. This variant of squamous cell carcinoma grows slowly and invades locally, with a very low metastasizing potential. (WHO)

results.name: Pineal Region Yolk Sac Tumor
match: Endodermal Sinus Tumor of Pineal Region
Endodermal Sinus Tumor of the Pineal Region
Yolk Sac Tumor of Pineal Region
Yolk Sac Tumor of the Pineal Region
search: Endodermal Sinus Tumor of Pineal Region
Endodermal Sinus Tumor of the Pineal Region
Yolk Sac Tumor of Pineal Region
Yolk Sac Tumor of the Pineal Region
synonyms: Endodermal Sinus Tumor of Pineal Region
Endodermal Sinus Tumor of the Pineal Region
Yolk Sac Tumor of Pineal Region
Yolk Sac Tumor of the Pineal Region
parents: Malignant Pineal Area Germ Cell Neoplasm
ancestors: Malignant Pineal Area Germ Cell Neoplasm
Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor

results.name: Struma Ovarii
results.definition: An ovarian mature teratoma characterized by the presence of aberrant thyroid tissue. The aberrant thyroid tissue shows morphologic changes identical to thyroid adenoma or carcinoma. Patients may present with abdominal mass and unusual symptoms due to thyrotoxicosis, or Meigs syndrome (ascites and pleural effusion).
parents: Ovarian Monodermal and Highly Specialized Teratoma
ancestors: Ovarian Monodermal and Highly Specialized Teratoma

results.name: Posterior Uveitis
results.definition: An inflammatory process that affects the choroid.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the posterior uveal tract.

results.name: Intraductal Breast Papilloma
results.definition: A benign papillary neoplasm that arises anywhere in the ductal system of the breast. It is characterized by fibrovascular structures lined by benign epithelial and myoepithelial proliferations. Intraductal breast papillomas are classified as central, when they arise in large ducts, or peripheral, when they arise in the terminal ductal lobular units.
results.glossary_definition: A benign (not cancer), wart-like growth in a milk duct of the breast. It is usually found close to the nipple and may cause a discharge from the nipple. It may also cause pain and a lump in the breast that can be felt. It usually affects women aged 35-55 years. Having a single papilloma does not increase the risk of breast cancer. When there are multiple intraductal breast papillomas, they are usually found farther from the nipple. There may not be a nipple discharge and the papillomas may not be felt. Having multiple intraductal breast papillomas may increase the risk of breast cancer.

results.name: Fibromyositis
results.definition: Inflammation and fibrous degeneration of a muscle.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation and fibrous degeneration of a muscle.

results.name: Acute Biphenotypic Leukemia
results.definition: An acute leukemia of ambiguous lineage characterized by blasts which coexpress myeloid and T or B lineage antigens or concurrent B and T lineage antigens. (WHO, 2001)

results.name: Dysplastic Nevus Syndrome
results.definition: An autosomal dominant disorder defined by the presence of multiple dysplastic nevi and a history of melanoma in two family members. Patients are at an increased risk for the development of melanoma.
results.glossary_definition: A condition that runs in certain families in which at least two members have dysplastic nevi (atypical moles) and have a tendency to develop melanoma.

results.name: Childhood Supratentorial Ependymoblastoma
results.definition: An ependymoblastoma arising from the supratentorial brain, occurring in children.
parents: Embryonal Tumor with Multilayered Rosettes, C19MC-Altered
ancestors: Embryonal Tumor with Multilayered Rosettes, C19MC-Altered

results.name: Cervical Disc Degenerative Disorder
results.definition: Any degenerative disorder affecting one or more vertebral discs of the cervical spine.

results.name: Monilethrix
results.definition: A rare autosomal dominant inherited hair shaft disorder caused by mutations in the type II keratin gene. It is characterized by the presence of thin, fragile hairs that appear beaded.

results.name: Pancreatic Acinar Cell Cystadenocarcinoma
match: Acinar Cell Cystadenocarcinoma of the Pancreas
search: Acinar Cell Cystadenocarcinoma of the Pancreas
results.definition: A cystic adenocarcinoma characterized by the presence of relatively uniform neoplastic cells which produce pancreatic enzymes and are arranged in acinar patterns. Signs and symptoms include abdominal pain, weight loss, nausea, and diarrhea. It usually has an aggressive clinical course.
synonyms: Acinar Cell Cystadenocarcinoma of the Pancreas

results.definition: A rare aggressive malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from skeletal muscle. It usually occurs in children and young adults. Only a small percentage of tumors arise in the skeletal muscle of the extremities. The majority arise in other anatomical sites.
results.glossary_definition: Cancer that forms in the soft tissues in a type of muscle called striated muscle. Rhabdomyosarcoma can occur anywhere in the body.
results.name: Rhabdomyosarcoma
Bladder Papillary Urothelial Neoplasm of Low Malignant Potential
results.name_text: Bladder Papillary Urothelial Neoplasm of Low Malignant Potential
match: Bladder Papillary Urothelial Neoplasm of Low Malignant Potential
Bladder Papillary Neoplasm of Low Malignant Potential
Bladder Papillary Transitional Cell Neoplasm of Low Malignant Potential
Bladder Papillary Urothelial Neoplasm of Low Malignant Potential
search: Bladder Papillary Urothelial Neoplasm of Low Malignant Potential
Bladder Papillary Neoplasm of Low Malignant Potential
Bladder Papillary Transitional Cell Neoplasm of Low Malignant Potential
Bladder Papillary Urothelial Neoplasm of Low Malignant Potential
results.definition: A papillary neoplasm of the urinary bladder in which the transitional cells form papillae. The papillary structures exhibit minimal architectural distortion and minimal atypia. Mitoses are infrequent. Patients are at an increased risk of developing new papillary lesions. Occasionally, the new lesions are urothelial carcinomas.
synonyms: Bladder Papillary Neoplasm of Low Malignant Potential
Bladder Papillary Transitional Cell Neoplasm of Low Malignant Potential
Bladder Papillary Urothelial Neoplasm of Low Malignant Potential

results.name: Urethral Leiomyoma
results.definition: A benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising from the urethra. It is characterized by the presence of spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, interlacing fascicles, and a whorled pattern.

results.name: Bartter Syndrome
results.definition: A rare inherited syndrome characterized by juxtaglomerular cell hyperplasia, hyperaldosteronism, hypokalemia, and alkalosis. Patients have high levels of plasma renin concentration which is not associated with hypertension.
results.glossary_definition: transmitted as an autosomal recessive trait; characterized by hypertrophy and hyperplasia of the juxtaglomerular cells, and increased concentrations of renin, angiotensin II, and aldosterone in the absence of edema and hypertension.

results.name: Orbital Granuloma
results.definition: A granuloma located on the orbit of the eye.

results.name: Aspiration Pneumonitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the lungs due to the inhalation of solid or liquid material.
results.glossary_definition: A type of pneumonia resulting from the aspiration of food, liquid, or gastric contents into the upper respiratory tract.

results.name: Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Minimal Deviation Variant
results.name_text: Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Minimal Deviation Variant
match: Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Minimal Deviation Variant
Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Minimal Deviation Variant
search: Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Minimal Deviation Variant
Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Minimal Deviation Variant
results.definition: A rare, extremely well differentiated cervical mucinous adenocarcinoma in which most of the neoplastic glands cannot be distinguished from the normal endocervical glands.
synonyms: Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Minimal Deviation Variant

results.name: Ornithine Carbamoyltransferase Deficiency Disease
results.definition: An X-linked urea cycle metabolic disorder characterized by deficiency of ornithine carbamoyltransferase, resulting in the accumulation of amino acids and ammonia in the serum. Signs and symptoms include seizures, delayed growth, behavioral changes, ataxia, lethargy, and coma.

results.name: Spinal Cord Neoplasm
results.definition: A primary or metastatic neoplasm affecting the spinal cord.
results.glossary_definition: A neoplasm arising within the spinal cord.
children: Spinal Canal And Spinal Cord Meningioma

results.name: Spiradenoma
results.definition: A benign epithelial neoplasm with eccrine or apocrine differentiation, arising from the sweat glands. It usually presents as a solitary, well circumscribed, firm nodule in the face and upper trunk. It is characterized by the presence of basaloid cells forming nodules in the dermis. Cases of carcinoma arising from long standing spiradenomas have been reported.

results.name: Trichorhinophalangeal Syndrome Type II
results.definition: A rare, usually sporadic and less frequently familiar syndrome caused by deletions on the long arm of chromosome 8. It is characterized by distinctive facial appearance (sparse hair, pear-shaped nose, and large ears), multiple exostoses, redundant skin, and mental retardation.

results.name: Non-Neoplastic Urinary System Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic disorder that affects the urinary system. Representative examples include urinary tract infections, urolithiasis, and acute kidney insufficiency.

results.name: Childhood Multilocular Cystic Renal Neoplasm
results.definition: A cystic neoplasm which arises from the kidney and occurs in children. It includes the cystic partially differentiated nephroblastoma and cases in which nephroblastomatous elements are not present.

results.name: Cervical Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
results.definition: A rare, aggressive neuroendocrine carcinoma that arises from the cervix and is characterized by the presence of malignant cells with abundant cytoplasm, large nuclei, and prominent nucleoli.

results.name: Fallopian Tube Papillary Adenocarcinoma
match: Papillary Adenocarcinoma of the Fallopian Tube
search: Papillary Adenocarcinoma of the Fallopian Tube
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the fallopian tube and is characterized by a papillary architectural pattern.
synonyms: Papillary Adenocarcinoma of the Fallopian Tube

results.name: Scurvy
results.definition: Abnormally low concentrations of vitamin C in the blood.
results.glossary_definition: A condition due to deficiency of ASCORBIC ACID (vitamin C) in the diet and marked by weakness, anemia, spongy gums, a tendency to mucocutaneous hemorrhages and a brawny induration of the muscles of the calves and legs. (Dorland, 27th ed)

results.name: Osteochondrodysplasia
results.definition: A term referring to disorders characterized by abnormalities in the development of bones and cartilage.
results.glossary_definition: A complex group of bone and cartilage disorders that result in abnormalities in the size and shape of the trunk, extremities, and/or skull.

results.name: Ampulla of Vater Mucinous Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma with glandular differentiation arising from the ampulla of Vater. Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of mucoid stroma formation.

results.name: Malignant Corneal Neoplasm
results.definition: A malignant growth of cells within the cornea of the eye.

results.name: Sarcomatoid Carcinoma of the Penis
match: Spindle Cell Carcinoma of the Penis
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Penis, Sarcomatoid Type
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Penis, Sarcomatoid Type
search: Spindle Cell Carcinoma of the Penis
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Penis, Sarcomatoid Type
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Penis, Sarcomatoid Type
results.definition: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the penis and is characterized by the presence of malignant spindle-shaped cells.
synonyms: Spindle Cell Carcinoma of the Penis
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Penis, Sarcomatoid Type
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Penis, Sarcomatoid Type
parents: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Penis
ancestors: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Penis

results.name: Testicular Brenner Tumor
results.definition: An uncommon usually benign neoplasm that arises from the testis. It is characterized by the presence of cysts lined by transitional cells and solid nests of transitional cells in a spindle cell stroma.

results.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
results.definition: A chronic, systemic autoimmune disorder characterized by inflammation in the synovial membranes and articular surfaces. It manifests primarily as a symmetric, erosive polyarthritis that spares the axial skeleton and is typically associated with the presence in the serum of rheumatoid factor.
results.glossary_definition: An autoimmune disease that causes pain, swelling, and stiffness in the joints, and may cause severe joint damage, loss of function, and disability. The disease may last from months to a lifetime, and symptoms may improve and worsen over time.

results.name: Constrictive Pericarditis
results.definition: A heart disorder in which the pericardial sac becomes thickened and fibrotic, tightening the myocardium and impeding the normal myocardial function.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by a thickened and fibrotic pericardial sac; these fibrotic changes impede normal myocardial function by restricting myocardial muscle action.

results.name: Depersonalization Disorder
results.definition: A disorder characterized by persistent or recurrent episodes of feeling detached from one's self (either one's body or one's mental processes), although the sufferer remains aware that this is only a feeling and does not represent reality.

results.name: Bronchioloalveolar Carcinoma
results.definition: A solitary adenocarcinoma arising from the lung measuring 3 cm or less. It is characterized by a predominantly lepidic pattern and 5 mm or less invasion in greatest dimension. It is usually a non-mucinous adenocarcinoma, but rarely may be mucinous.
results.glossary_definition: A malignant lung neoplasm originating from the alveolar/bronchiolar epithelium.

results.name: Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma
match: Endometrioid Carcinoma of Female Reproductive System
Endometrioid Carcinoma of the Female Reproductive System
search: Endometrioid Carcinoma of Female Reproductive System
Endometrioid Carcinoma of the Female Reproductive System
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma characterized by the presence of malignant glandular epithelial cells resembling endometrial cells. It can arise from the uterine body, ovary, fallopian tube, cervix, vagina, and uterine ligament.
results.glossary_definition: An adenocarcinoma characterized by the presence of cells resembling the glandular cells of the ENDOMETRIUM. It is a common histological type of ovarian carcinoma and endometrial carcinoma. There is a high frequency of co-occurrence of this form of adenocarcinoma in both tissues.
synonyms: Endometrioid Carcinoma of Female Reproductive System
Endometrioid Carcinoma of the Female Reproductive System

results.name: Cervical Squamous Papilloma
match: Squamous Papilloma of the Cervix Uteri
Squamous Papilloma of the Uterine Cervix
search: Squamous Papilloma of the Cervix Uteri
Squamous Papilloma of the Uterine Cervix
results.definition: A papilloma that arises from the squamous epithelium of the cervix.
synonyms: Squamous Papilloma of the Cervix Uteri
Squamous Papilloma of the Uterine Cervix

results.name: Sialic Acid Storage Disease
results.definition: A rare, autosomal recessive lysosomal storage disease caused by mutations in the SLC17A5 gene. It primarily affects the nervous system. Signs and symptoms include developmental delay, intellectual disability, hypotonia, failure to thrive, seizures, and ataxia.

results.name: Adenosquamous Breast Carcinoma
results.definition: An invasive breast carcinoma characterized by the presence of tubular and glandular neoplastic cell structures, admixed with islands of neoplastic cells showing squamous differentiation.

results.name: Costello Syndrome
results.definition: A genetic syndrome caused by mutations in the HRAS gene. It is characterized by developmental delay, mental retardation, loose skin folds, cardiomyopathy, tachycardia, and structural heart defects. Patients are at an increased risk of developing benign or malignant neoplasms.

results.name: Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma
results.definition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm that affects the uterine corpus, and rarely, the ovaries, cervix, and vagina. In the uterine corpus it is classified as low grade or high grade endometrial stromal sarcoma. In the remainder of the anatomic sites it is classified as low grade endometrioid stromal sarcoma.
results.glossary_definition: A malignant, mesenchymal tumor of the uterine stroma.
children: Low Grade Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma of the Cervix
Low Grade Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma of the Vagina
Ovarian Low Grade Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma

results.name: Cervical Atypical Polypoid Adenomyoma
results.definition: An adenomyoma that arises from the cervix and is characterized by the presence of a glandular component exhibiting architectural complexity.

results.name: Glomus Tumor
results.definition: A rare benign or malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from cells that resemble the modified smooth muscle cells of the glomus body. The majority of glomus tumors occur in the distal extremities.

results.name: Cholesteatoma
results.definition: A pathologic process characterized by the proliferation of keratinizing squamous epithelium resulting in the accumulation of keratin and cells in the middle ear and/or mastoid. It may be congenital or acquired. If left untreated, it may increase in size and destroy adjacent structures.
results.glossary_definition: A non-neoplastic keratinizing mass with stratified squamous epithelium, frequently occurring in the meninges, central nervous system, bones of the skull, and most commonly in the middle ear and mastoid region.

results.name: Intestinal Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm involving the small or large intestine.
results.glossary_definition: Tumors or cancer of the INTESTINES.

results.name: Lymphangiosarcoma
results.definition: A malignant neoplasm arising from the endothelial cells of the lymphatic vessels.
results.glossary_definition: A type of cancer that begins in the cells that line lymph vessels.

results.name: Gastric Cronkhite Canada Polyposis
results.definition: Non-neoplastic polyps that arise from the stomach and are often indistinguishable from hyperplastic polyps. They may be associated with the presence of polyps in other parts of the gastrointestinal tract. Associated clinical signs and symptoms are nail atrophy, alopecia, and hyperpigmentation.

results.name: Mediastinal Synovial Sarcoma
results.definition: A synovial sarcoma arising from the mediastinum.

results.name: Sarcomatoid Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma
match: Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma with Extensive Sarcomatous Changes
search: Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma with Extensive Sarcomatous Changes
results.definition: A rare, aggressive variant of intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma. It is characterized by the presence of adenocarcinoma cells that are intermingled with malignant pleomorphic spindle cells.
synonyms: Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma with Extensive Sarcomatous Changes
ancestors: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Carcinoma
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Epithelial Neoplasm
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Neoplasm

results.name: Fallopian Tube Serous Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: A serous adenocarcinoma that arises from the fallopian tube. It is usually a high grade invasive adenocarcinoma.
children: High Grade Fallopian Tube Serous Adenocarcinoma
Low Grade Fallopian Tube Serous Adenocarcinoma

results.name: Acute Laryngitis
results.definition: An acute inflammatory process affecting the larynx. It is caused by bacteria, viruses, or vocal strain. Signs and symptoms include sore throat, cough, swallowing difficulties, and hoarseness.

results.name: Acute Poliomyelitis
results.definition: An acute infectious disorder that affects the nervous system. It is caused by the poliovirus. The virus spreads by direct contact, and can be prevented by prophylaxis with the polio vaccine.

results.name: Esophageal Sarcoma
results.definition: A malignant soft tissue neoplasm that arises from the esophagus. Representative examples include Kaposi sarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, rhabdomyosarcoma, and synovial sarcoma.

results.name: Selective IgG Immunodeficiency
results.definition: A broad classification of dysgammaglobulinemias characterized by low or undetectable serum levels of immunoglobulin class G (IgG). Deficiencies of IgG present variably according to subclass. IgG deficiencies are typically relative among subclasses and not absolute. Thus even with a given selective IgG subclass deficiency, total IgG levels may still fall within normal range. The clinical course and prognosis is dependent upon the severity of the deficiency and associated morbidity.

results.name: Laryngeal Carcinoma
results.definition: Carcinoma that arises from the laryngeal epithelium. More than 90% of laryngeal carcinomas are squamous cell carcinomas. The remainder are adenoid cystic carcinomas, mucoepidermoid carcinomas and carcinomas with neuroendocrine differentiation.
results.glossary_definition: Cancer that forms in tissues of the larynx (area of the throat that contains the vocal cords and is used for breathing, swallowing, and talking). Most laryngeal cancers are squamous cell carcinomas (cancer that begins in flat cells lining the larynx).

results.name: Achondroplasia
results.definition: An autosomal dominant disorder caused by mutation(s) in the FGFR3 gene, encoding fibroblast growth factor receptor 3. The condition is characterized by inappropriate cartilage growth plate differentiation and deficient endochondral growth, manifest clinically with severe rhizomelic short stature, short limbs, characteristic facies with frontal bossing and midface hypoplasia.

results.name: Bipolar Disorder
results.definition: A major affective disorder marked by severe mood swings (manic or major depressive episodes) and a tendency to remission and recurrence.

results.name: Rhabdoid Tumor
results.definition: An aggressive malignant embryonal neoplasm usually occurring during childhood. It is characterized by the presence of large cells with abundant cytoplasm, large eccentric nucleus, and a prominent nucleolus and it is associated with abnormalities of chromosome 22. It can arise from the central nervous system, kidney, and the soft tissues. The prognosis is poor.
results.glossary_definition: A malignant tumor of either the central nervous system (CNS) or the kidney. Malignant rhabdoid tumors of the CNS often have an abnormality of chromosome 22. These tumors usually occur in children younger than 2 years.

results.name: Extrahepatic Bile Duct Mucoepidermoid Carcinoma
match: Mucoepidermoid Carcinoma of the Bile Duct
search: Mucoepidermoid Carcinoma of the Bile Duct
results.definition: A mucoepidermoid carcinoma that arises from the extrahepatic bile ducts.
synonyms: Mucoepidermoid Carcinoma of the Bile Duct

results.name: Epididymal Cyst
results.definition: A benign testicular cyst that is located in the epididymis, and which contains serous fluid, lymphocytes, spermatozoa, and debris.

results.name: Erythromelalgia
results.definition: A rare disorder characterized by periodic inflammation and blockage of the vessels of the extremities, resulting in skin redness, swelling, and burning pain in the affected sites. It may manifest as a primary disorder caused by mutations of the SCN9A gene or as a secondary disorder due to hematologic disorders or medication side effects.
results.glossary_definition: Disease marked by paroxysmal, bilateral vasodilatation, particularly of the extremities, with burning pain, and increased skin temperature and redness.

results.name: Laryngeal Verrucous Carcinoma
results.reporting_disease: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
results.definition: A well differentaited, non-metastasizing squamous cell carcinoma arising from the larynx. It is an exophytic, warty, and slow growing tumor affecting predominantly older men. It is associated with tobacco smoking. Symptoms include hoarseness, airway obstruction, weight loss, dysphagia, and throat pain. If left untreated, it may cause extensive local destruction.
ancestors: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma

results.name: Nonanaplastic Kidney Wilms Tumor
results.definition: Wilms tumor of the kidney characterized by the absence of nuclear anaplasia.

results.name: Transient Hypogammaglobulinemia
results.definition: A broad classification for humoral immunodeficiencies. These disorders may be caused by inadequate activation of progenitor B cells, defective class-switching or the effects of medications. Despite the potential for increased susceptibility to infection, these disorders are self-limited with eventual normalization of serum antibody levels.

results.name: Cervical Wilms Tumor
results.definition: An embryonal neoplasm arising from the cervix with morphologic features resembling Wilms tumor of the kidney.

results.name: Dermatophytosis of Scalp and Beard
results.definition: Dermatophytosis involving the stratum corneum of the skin of the scalp and beard area.

results.name: Alcoholic Gastritis
results.definition: Inflammation of the stomach resulting from alcohol ingestion.

results.name: Adrenal Gland Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant (primary or metastatic) neoplasm affecting the adrenal glands.

results.name: Mesothelioma
results.definition: A usually malignant and aggressive neoplasm of the mesothelium which is often associated with exposure to asbestos.
results.glossary_definition: A benign (noncancerous) or malignant (cancerous) tumor affecting the lining of the chest or abdomen. Exposure to asbestos particles in the air increases the risk of developing malignant mesothelioma.

results.name: Rete Ovarii Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: An exceptionally rare adenocarcinoma that arises from the rete ovarii.

results.name: Breast Blunt Duct Adenosis
match: Blunt Duct Adenosis of the Breast
search: Blunt Duct Adenosis of the Breast
results.definition: Breast adenosis characterized by the presence of ducts with distended lumen and columnar cell metaplasia.
synonyms: Blunt Duct Adenosis of the Breast

results.name: Trisomy 21
results.definition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the presence of a third copy of chromosome 21 in somatic cells.

results.name: Childhood Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
results.name_text: Childhood Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
match: Childhood Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
Childhood Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
Childhood Sarcoma Botryoides of the Vagina
search: Childhood Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
Childhood Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
Childhood Sarcoma Botryoides of the Vagina
results.definition: A morphologic variant of embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma occurring in female children. The neoplasm arises from the vagina. It is characterized by the formation of a cambium layer in the affected tissue and polypoid nodules with an abundant myxoid stroma.
synonyms: Childhood Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
Childhood Sarcoma Botryoides of the Vagina
parents: Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
ancestors: Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina

results.name: Pantothenate Kinase-Associated Neurodegeneration
results.definition: A rare autosomal recessive inherited disorder caused by mutations in the PANK2 gene. It is characterized by abnormal accumulation of iron in the basal ganglia. Signs and symptoms include progressive motor disturbances, muscle spasm and rigidity, dysarthria, mental deterioration, and behavioral changes.

results.name: Rectal Lymphoma
results.definition: An extranodal lymphoma that arises from the rectum. The majority are B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphomas.

results.name: Peripheral Breast Papilloma
results.definition: A benign papillary neoplasm that arises in a terminal ductal lobular unit. It is characterized by the presence of a fibrovascular core that is lined by benign epithelial and myoepithelial proliferations. Peripheral breast papillomas are often multiple and are usually found microscopically. Patients are often asymptomatic.

results.name: Salpingitis
results.definition: Acute or chronic inflammation of the fallopian tube. It is most often caused by Neisseria gonorrhoeae and Chlamydia trachomatis infections. The infections usually originate in the vagina and ascend to the fallopian tube. Symptoms include abdominal, pelvic, and lower back pain, pain during ovulation and sexual intercourse, fever, nausea, and vomiting. Complications include infertility and ectopic pregnancy.
results.glossary_definition: inflammation of the fallopian tubes.

results.name: Acute Nasopharyngitis
results.definition: An acute inflammatory process that affects the nasopharynx. It is caused by viruses. Signs and symptoms include fever, coughing, sneezing, and sore throat.

results.name: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Microcystic Variant
results.name_text: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Microcystic Variant
match: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Microcystic Variant
Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Microcystic Variant
search: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Microcystic Variant
Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Microcystic Variant
synonyms: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Microcystic Variant

results.name: Sclera Disorder
results.definition: A disorder affecting the sclera. Examples include inflammatory processes (e.g., scleritis and episcleritis), and degenerative processes. Primary tumors of the sclera are extremely rare.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by involvement of the sclera of the eye.

results.name: Cloacogenic Carcinoma of the Rectum
match: Transition Zone Carcinoma of the Rectum
Transitional Zone Carcinoma of the Rectum
search: Transition Zone Carcinoma of the Rectum
Transitional Zone Carcinoma of the Rectum
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the transitional zone at the junction of the rectum and anus.
synonyms: Transition Zone Carcinoma of the Rectum
Transitional Zone Carcinoma of the Rectum

results.name: Intracranial Hemangioma
results.definition: A hemangioma arising from the brain and meninges.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Trisomy 18
results.definition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the presence of a third copy of chromosome 18 in somatic cells.

results.name: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Epithelial Neoplasm
results.name_text: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Epithelial Neoplasm
match: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Epithelial Neoplasm
Epithelial Hepatic and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Neoplasm
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Epithelial Neoplasm
search: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Epithelial Neoplasm
Epithelial Hepatic and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Neoplasm
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Epithelial Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant epithelial neoplasm that affects the liver parenchyma and intrahepatic bile ducts. Representative examples of benign epithelial neoplasms include hepatocellular adenoma and intrahepatic bile duct adenoma. Representative examples of malignant epithelial neoplasms include hepatocellular carcinoma and intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma.
synonyms: Epithelial Hepatic and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Neoplasm
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Epithelial Neoplasm
parents: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Neoplasm
ancestors: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Neoplasm
children: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Carcinoma

results.name: Non-Functioning Pituitary Gland Adenoma
match: Functionless Adenoma of the Pituitary Gland
Non-Functioning Adenoma of the Pituitary Gland
Non-Secretory Adenoma of the Pituitary Gland
search: Functionless Adenoma of the Pituitary Gland
Non-Functioning Adenoma of the Pituitary Gland
Non-Secretory Adenoma of the Pituitary Gland
results.definition: A hormone producing or non-producing pituitary gland adenoma not associated with a hormonal syndrome.
synonyms: Functionless Adenoma of the Pituitary Gland
Non-Functioning Adenoma of the Pituitary Gland
Non-Secretory Adenoma of the Pituitary Gland

results.name: Gastric Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
match: Small Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
Oat Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
search: Small Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
Oat Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
results.oncotree_disease: Small Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
results.definition: An aggressive, high-grade and poorly differentiated carcinoma with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the stomach. It is characterized by the presence of malignant small cells.
synonyms: Oat Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach

results.name: Trisomy 13
results.definition: A chromosomal abnormality characterized by the presence of three copies of genetic material for chromosome 13, instead of the normal two. It leads to a variety of abnormalities that include mental retardation, microcephaly, low-set ears, eye structural defects, polydactyly, and limb abnormalities.

results.name: Benign Mesonephroma
results.definition: A benign epithelial neoplasm of the female reproductive system arising from mesonephric remnants.

results.name: Rete Testis Adenoma
results.definition: A benign epithelial neoplasm arising from the rete testis.
results.glossary_definition: A benign epithelial neoplasm arising from the rete testis.

results.name: Pulmonary Valve Disorder
results.definition: A heart disorder characterized by a defect in pulmonary valve structure or function.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in pulmonary valve function or structure.

results.name: Ovarian Transitional Cell Carcinoma
match: Transitional Cell Carcinoma of the Ovary
search: Transitional Cell Carcinoma of the Ovary
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the ovary and is characterized by the presence of malignant epithelial cells that resemble malignant urothelial cells. There is no morphologic evidence of a benign or borderline Brenner tumor component present.
synonyms: Transitional Cell Carcinoma of the Ovary

results.name: Intracranial Abscess
results.definition: An abscess that is located in the intracranial space.

results.name: Hypomelia Hypotrichosis Facial Hemangioma Syndrome
results.definition: A rare genetic syndrome with an autosomal recessive pattern of inheritance. It is caused by a mutation in the ESCO2 gene. Clinical signs at birth include multiple limb and facial abnormalities. It is considered to be a mild variant of Roberts syndrome.

results.name: Klinefelter Syndrome
results.definition: A sex chromosome disorder caused by the presence of an extra X chromosome in the male karyotype. Affected individuals are infertile and have a small penis and testes. They tend to have tall stature and long legs and may have difficulties with speech and language development. Gynecomastia may be present.
results.glossary_definition: A genetic disorder in males caused by having one or more extra X chromosomes. Males with this disorder may have larger than normal breasts, a lack of facial and body hair, a rounded body type, and small testicles. They may learn to speak much later than other children and may have difficulty learning to read and write. Klinefelter syndrome increases the risk of developing extragonadal germ cell tumors and breast cancer.

results.name: Leprosy
results.definition: A bacterial granulomatous infection caused by Mycobacterium leprae. It is a progressive disease affecting the skin, peripheral nerves, and limbs. If untreated, it causes permanent tissue damage leading to autoamputations.

results.name: Malignant Lacrimal Gland Neoplasm
match: Malignant Neoplasm of the Lacrimal Gland
Malignant Tumor of the Lacrimal Gland
search: Malignant Neoplasm of the Lacrimal Gland
Malignant Tumor of the Lacrimal Gland
results.definition: Primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm affecting the lacrimal gland.
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of the Lacrimal Gland
Malignant Tumor of the Lacrimal Gland

results.name: Scrotal Basal Cell Carcinoma
match: Basal Cell Carcinoma of the Scrotum
search: Basal Cell Carcinoma of the Scrotum
synonyms: Basal Cell Carcinoma of the Scrotum

results.name: Plexiform Neurofibroma
results.definition: An elongated and multinodular neurofibroma, formed when the tumor involves either multiple trunks of a plexus or multiple fascicles of a large nerve, such as the sciatic. Some plexiform neurofibromas resemble a bag of worms, others produce a massive ropy enlargement of the nerve. (Adapted from WHO.)
results.glossary_definition: A nerve that has become thick and misshapen due to the abnormal growth of cells and tissues that cover the nerve.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Prostate Lymphoma
results.definition: A rare non-Hodgkin or Hodgkin lymphoma that arises from the prostate gland.
A benign or malignant, gonadal or extragonadal neoplasm that originates from germ cells. Representative examples include teratoma, seminoma, embryonal carcinoma, and yolk sac tumor.
results.glossary_definition: A type of tumor that begins in the cells that give rise to sperm or eggs. Germ cell tumors can occur almost anywhere in the body and can be either benign or malignant.
results.name: Germ Cell Tumor
Tracheal Squamous Cell Carcinoma
match: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Trachea
search: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Trachea
results.definition: A rare squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the mucosal lining of the trachea. It usually grows as an intraluminal mass and later invades extraluminal structures. The majority of patients present with hemoptysis, coughing, dyspnea, or stridor.
synonyms: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Trachea

results.name: Cutaneous Leishmaniasis
results.definition: Leishmaniasis affecting the skin. It is the most common form of leishmaniasis. It presents with erythematous macules and papules, and nodules which may eventually ulcerate. The lesions appear in the bite site in the exposed skin areas.
results.glossary_definition: An endemic disease that is characterized by the development of single or multiple localized lesions on exposed areas of skin that typically ulcerate. The disease has been divided into Old and New World forms. Old World leishmaniasis is separated into three distinct types according to epidemiology and clinical manifestations and is caused by species of the L. tropica and L. aethiopica complexes as well as by species of the L. major genus. New World leishmaniasis, also called American leishmaniasis, occurs in South and Central America and is caused by species of the L. mexicana or L. braziliensis complexes.

results.name: Congenital Metabolic Disorder
