results.definition: A group of disorders present at birth that involve genetic defects leading to disturbances in carbohydrate, lipid, lysosomal storage or amino acid metabolism in the body.
results.glossary_definition: Errors in metabolic processes resulting from inborn genetic mutations that are inherited or acquired in utero.

results.name: Adult Central Nervous System Mature Teratoma
results.name_text: Adult Central Nervous System Mature Teratoma
match: Adult Central Nervous System Mature Teratoma
Adult Central Nervous System Mature Teratoma
search: Adult Central Nervous System Mature Teratoma
Adult Central Nervous System Mature Teratoma
synonyms: Adult Central Nervous System Mature Teratoma
ancestors: Central Nervous System Adult Germ Cell Tumor
Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor

results.name: Lennox-Gastaut Syndrome
results.definition: A syndrome characterized by frequent episodes of epilepsy during childhood. The epileptic episodes may be tonic, atonic, myoclonic, or absence seizures. It may be accompanied by mental retardation and behavioral problems.
results.glossary_definition: A severe form of childhood epilepsy that is characterized by frequent seizures of multiple types, a distinct electroencephalogram pattern consisting of slow spike-waves between seizures, behavioral disturbances, and cognitive dysfunction.

results.name: Petrous Apex Meningioma
results.definition: A meningioma that affects the petrous apex.

results.name: Mastitis
results.definition: Inflammation of breast tissue during lactation or postpartum due to an obstructed duct or infection.
results.glossary_definition: A condition in which breast tissue is inflamed. It is usually caused by an infection and is most often seen in nursing mothers.

results.name: Pulmonary Sarcoidosis
results.definition: Sarcoidosis affecting the lung parenchyma. It is characterized by the presence of non-necrotizing granulomas in the lung tissues. It is manifested with dyspnea, cough, fever, night sweats, fatigue, and weight loss.
results.glossary_definition: Sarcoidosis affecting predominantly the lungs, the site most frequently involved and most commonly causing morbidity and mortality in sarcoidosis. Pulmonary sarcoidosis is characterized by sharply circumscribed granulomas in the alveolar, bronchial, and vascular walls, composed of tightly packed cells derived from the mononuclear phagocyte system. The clinical symptoms when present are dyspnea upon exertion, nonproductive cough, and wheezing. (Cecil Textbook of Medicine, 19th ed, p431)

results.name: Glandular Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor
results.name_text: Glandular Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor
match: Glandular Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor
Glandular Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor
Malignant Glandular Neoplasm of Peripheral Nerve Sheath
Malignant Glandular Neoplasm of the Peripheral Nerve Sheath
Malignant Glandular Peripheral Nerve Sheath Neoplasm
Malignant Glandular Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor
Malignant Glandular Tumor of Peripheral Nerve Sheath
Malignant Glandular Tumor of the Peripheral Nerve Sheath
search: Glandular Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor
Glandular Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor
Malignant Glandular Neoplasm of Peripheral Nerve Sheath
Malignant Glandular Neoplasm of the Peripheral Nerve Sheath
Malignant Glandular Peripheral Nerve Sheath Neoplasm
Malignant Glandular Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor
Malignant Glandular Tumor of Peripheral Nerve Sheath
Malignant Glandular Tumor of the Peripheral Nerve Sheath
results.definition: A variant of malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor characterized by the presence of glandular epithelium.
synonyms: Glandular Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor
Malignant Glandular Neoplasm of Peripheral Nerve Sheath
Malignant Glandular Neoplasm of the Peripheral Nerve Sheath
Malignant Glandular Peripheral Nerve Sheath Neoplasm
Malignant Glandular Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor
Malignant Glandular Tumor of Peripheral Nerve Sheath
Malignant Glandular Tumor of the Peripheral Nerve Sheath
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Male Reproductive System Neoplasm
match: Neoplasm of the Male Reproductive System
Tumor of the Male Reproductive System
search: Neoplasm of the Male Reproductive System
Tumor of the Male Reproductive System
results.definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant neoplasm that affects the male reproductive system. Representative examples include benign prostate phyllodes tumor, benign testicular Sertoli cell tumor, prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia, prostate carcinoma, testicular seminoma, and testicular embryonal carcinoma.
results.glossary_definition: Neoplasms of the male genitalia.
synonyms: Neoplasm of the Male Reproductive System
Tumor of the Male Reproductive System

results.name: Malignant Carotid Body Paraganglioma
match: Malignant Neoplasm of the Carotid Body
Malignant Tumor of the Carotid Body
search: Malignant Neoplasm of the Carotid Body
Malignant Tumor of the Carotid Body
results.definition: A carotid body paraganglioma that metastasizes to other anatomic sites.
results.glossary_definition: A malignant neoplasm of the chemoreceptor system (e.g. carotid body, glomus jugulare, glomus vagale).
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of the Carotid Body
Malignant Tumor of the Carotid Body

results.name: Medulloblastoma with Melanotic Differentiation
results.definition: A rare malignant embryonal neoplasm characterized by the presence of small cells which resemble the cells of classic medulloblastoma and a minor population of melanin-forming neuroepithelial cells. It usually has an unfavorable clinical course.

results.name: Urethra Fibroepithelial Polyp
results.definition: A benign polypoid lesion of mesodermal origin that arises from the urethra.

results.name: Bladder Papillary Urothelial Neoplasm
match: Urinary Bladder Papillary Transitional Cell Neoplasm
search: Urinary Bladder Papillary Transitional Cell Neoplasm
synonyms: Urinary Bladder Papillary Transitional Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Kidney Medullary Carcinoma
results.definition: A type of renal carcinoma affecting mostly young African-Americans. It is located in the medulla of the kidney, and follows an aggressive clinical course. Most reported cases have shown metastatic disease at the time of diagnosis.

results.name: Hajdu-Cheney Syndrome
results.definition: A very rare inherited connective tissue disorder characterized by osteoporosis, skull deformities, short stature, and bone flexibility.

results.name: Carnitine Palmitoyltransferase II Deficiency
results.definition: A rare, autosomal recessive inherited disorder of long-chain fatty-acid oxidation caused by mutations in the CPT2 gene. The disease includes three main types: a lethal neonatal form, a severe infantile hepatocardiomuscular form, and a myopathic form.

results.name: Malignant Adult Hemangiopericytoma
results.definition: A malignant hemangiopericytoma occurring in the adult population.

results.name: Biphasic Mesothelioma
results.definition: A malignant neoplasm arising from mesothelial cells in the pleura. It is characterized by the presence of neoplastic epithelioid cells and sarcomatoid features.

results.name: Dentatorubral-Pallidoluysian Atrophy
results.definition: A rare, autosomal dominant inherited progressive neurodegenerative disorder. It is caused by a mutation in the ATN1 gene, resulting in a combined degeneration of the dentatorubral and pallidoluysian systems. It can appear at any age, but it usually affects individuals between 20 and 30 years and leads to death within 10-15 years. The clinical presentation depends on the age of the affected individual; juvenile patients develop severe progressive myoclonus epilepsy and cognitive decline, whereas adult patients develop ataxia, choreoathetosis and dementia.

results.name: Lens Disorder
results.definition: Any disease affecting the lens of the eye.

results.name: Epithelioid Trophoblastic Tumor
results.definition: A gestational trophoblastic tumor characterized by the presence of a monomorphous cellular population of intermediate trophoblastic cells infiltrating in a nodular pattern.

results.name: Corpus Callosum Lipoma
results.definition: A rare benign adipose tissue neoplasm of the corpus callosum.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Renal Pelvis Urothelial Papilloma
results.definition: A benign neoplasm of the renal pelvis that involves the transitional epithelium projecting above the surrounding epithelial surface and consisting of villous or arborescent outgrowths of fibrovascular stroma.

results.name: Breast Fibrocystic Change, Non-Proliferative Type
match: Non-Proliferative Fibrocystic Change of the Breast
search: Non-Proliferative Fibrocystic Change of the Breast
results.definition: Breast fibrocystic change characterized by the absence of epithelial cell hyperplasia.
synonyms: Non-Proliferative Fibrocystic Change of the Breast

results.name: Inverted Papilloma
results.definition: An endophytic benign papillary epithelial neoplasm that results from the invagination and proliferation of epithelial cells in the underlying stroma. Representative examples are the inverted urothelial papilloma that arises from the urinary tract and inverted Schneiderian papilloma that arises from the nasal cavity or paranasal sinuses.
results.glossary_definition: A type of tumor in which surface epithelial cells grow downward into the underlying supportive tissue. It may occur in the nose and/or sinuses or in the urinary tract (bladder, renal pelvis, ureter, urethra). When it occurs in the nose or sinuses, it may cause symptoms similar to those caused by sinusitis, such as nasal congestion. When it occurs in the urinary tract, it may cause blood in the urine.

results.name: Localized Pulmonary Fibrosis
results.definition: Replacement of the lung tissue by connective tissue in a specific area of the lung.

results.name: Ankylosing Spondylitis
results.definition: An autoimmune chronic inflammatory disorder characterized by inflammation in the vertebral joints of the spine and sacroiliac joints. It predominantly affects young males. Patients present with stiffness and pain in the spine.
results.glossary_definition: An immune-mediated disease characterized by inflammation in the axial skeleton including sacroiliac joints, vertebrae and vertebral joints. Peripheral joints may be involved as well. Clinical features can include low back pain and stiffness, limited motion of the lumbar spine, and limited chest expansion.

results.name: Hepatitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the liver; usually from a viral infection, but sometimes from toxic agents.
results.glossary_definition: Disease of the liver causing inflammation. Symptoms include an enlarged liver, fever, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and dark urine.

results.name: Vulvar Granular Cell Tumor
results.definition: A usually benign granular cell tumor that arises from the vulva.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Oculomotor Nerve Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the oculomotor nerve (third cranial nerve).
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by involvement of the oculomotor nerve (third cranial nerve).

results.name: Pituitary Gland Necrosis
results.definition: Ischemic or hemorrhagic necrosis of the pituitary gland.

results.name: Batten Disease
results.definition: A condition associated with mutation(s) in the CLN3 gene, encoding battenin. The condition is one of a group of genetically heterogeneous neurodegenerative disorders, characterized by accumulation of intracellular lipopigments.

results.name: Subependymoma
results.definition: A benign, slow growing neoplasm which is typically attached to a ventricular wall. It is composed of glial tumor cell clusters embedded in an abundant fibrillary matrix with frequent microcystic change. Some lesions have the histological features of both subependymoma and ependymoma. It is often detected incidentally and has a very favorable prognosis. (Adapted from WHO.)
results.glossary_definition: Rare, slow-growing, benign intraventricular tumors, often asymptomatic and discovered incidentally. The tumors are classified histologically as ependymomas and demonstrate a proliferation of subependymal fibrillary astrocytes among the ependymal tumor cells. (From Clin Neurol Neurosurg 1997 Feb;99(1):17-22)
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy
results.definition: An X-linked inherited disorder caused by mutations in the DMD gene found on the X chromosome. It is characterized by rapidly progressing muscle weakness and muscle atrophy initially involving the lower extremities and eventually affecting the whole body. It affects males whereas females can be carriers. The symptoms start before the age of six and may appear at infancy.

results.name: Mast Cell Neoplasm
results.definition: A heterogeneous group of disorders characterized by the abnormal growth and accumulation of mast cells in one or more organ systems. Recent data suggest that most variants of mast cell neoplasms are clonal disorders. (WHO, 2001)
results.glossary_definition: A growth or lump of mast cells (a type of white blood cell). Mast cell tumors can involve the skin, subcutaneous tissue, and muscle tissue.

results.name: Splenic Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the spleen. Examples include infection, hemangioma, lymphoma, leukemia and angiosarcoma.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder of the spleen.

results.name: Fanconi Syndrome
results.definition: A genetic or acquired disorder characterized by impairment of the function of the proximal tubules of the kidney. It results in decreased reabsorption of electrolytes, glucose, amino acids, and other nutrients.
results.glossary_definition: A constellation of functional abnormalities including aminoaciduria, glycosuria, phosphaturia, renal tubular acidosis, and hypophosphatemia, resulting from decreased reabsorption caused by proximal renal tubule dysfunction.

results.name: Compartment Syndrome
results.definition: Elevated pressure in a confined space enclosed by fascia or eschar, which may lead to vascular compromise and subsequent ischemic injury to the tissue within the space.
results.glossary_definition: Elevated pressure in a confined space enclosed by fascia or eschar, which may lead to vascular compromise and subsequent ischemic injury to the tissue within the space.

results.name: Glanders
results.definition: A condition resulting from infection by Burkholderia mallei, which mainly affects horses.
results.glossary_definition: A contagious disease of horses that can be transmitted to humans. It is caused by Burkholderia mallei and characterized by ulceration of the respiratory mucosa and an eruption of nodules on the skin.

results.name: Breast Fat Necrosis
results.definition: Localized necrosis of the adipose tissue in the breast. Clinically, it may present as a mass. Causes include injury, surgical procedures, and radiation treatment.

results.name: Leukopenia
results.definition: A laboratory test result indicating a decreased number of white blood cells in the peripheral blood.
results.glossary_definition: A condition in which there is a lower-than-normal number of leukocytes (white blood cells) in the blood.

results.name: Reiter Syndrome
results.definition: A rare, reactive inflammatory disorder seen following bacterial infection. It predominantly affects males aged 20-40. Individuals with HLA-B27 antigen are estimated to have a 50 % increased risk. The disorder is characterized by arthritis, conjunctivitis, uveitis, iritis and ulceration of the oral cavity, genitals and volar surfaces of the hands and feet. The clinical course is self-limited with resolution of clinical disease usually within six months of onset.
results.glossary_definition: A triad of nongonococcal urethritis followed by conjunctivitis and arthritis, of unknown etiology.

results.name: Esophageal Neuroendocrine Neoplasm
results.definition: A neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the esophagus. It includes well differentiated neuroendocrine tumors (low and intermediate grade) and poorly differentiated neuroendocrine carcinomas (high grade).

results.name: Anal Sarcoma
results.definition: A malignant soft tissue neoplasm arising from the anus. Representative examples include leiomyosarcoma, rhabdomyosarcoma, and Kaposi sarcoma.

results.name: Megaloblastic Anemia
results.definition: Anemia characterized by the presence of unusually large erythroblasts in the bone marrow called megaloblasts. It is usually caused by vitamin B12 or folic acid deficiency. Other causes include toxins and drugs.
results.glossary_definition: anemias associated with impaired DNA synthesis in bone marrow progenitor cells leading to odd shaped, macrocytic, or dysfunctional erythrocytes; usually caused by B12 or folate deficiency.

results.name: Basophilic Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm of the anterior pituitary gland in which the neoplastic cells stain positive with basic dyes.

results.name: Malignant Hard Palate Neoplasm
match: Malignant Neoplasm of the Hard Palate
Malignant Tumor of the Hard Palate
search: Malignant Neoplasm of the Hard Palate
Malignant Tumor of the Hard Palate
results.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm that affects the hard palate.
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of the Hard Palate
Malignant Tumor of the Hard Palate

results.name: Parapsoriasis
results.definition: An inflammatory skin disorder of unknown etiology characterized by papules and plaques or scaly patches resembling psoriasis.
results.glossary_definition: The term applied to a group of relatively uncommon inflammatory, maculopapular, scaly eruptions of unknown etiology and resistant to conventional treatment. Eruptions are both psoriatic and lichenoid in appearance, but the diseases are distinct from psoriasis, lichen planus, or other recognized dermatoses. Proposed nomenclature divides parapsoriasis into two distinct subgroups, PITYRIASIS LICHENOIDES and parapsoriasis en plaques (small- and large-plaque parapsoriasis).

results.name: Muir-Torre Syndrome
results.definition: A usually autosomal dominant inherited neoplastic syndrome caused by mutations in the hMSH-2 and hMLH-1 genes. It is characterized by the presence of sebaceous skin tumors (adenoma or carcinoma), and internal organ malignant tumors, usually of the gastrointestinal or genitourinary tract.

results.name: Basaloid Carcinoma of the Penis
match: Basaloid Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Penis
Basaloid Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Penis
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Penis, Basaloid Type
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Penis, Basaloid Type
search: Basaloid Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Penis
Basaloid Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Penis
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Penis, Basaloid Type
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Penis, Basaloid Type
results.definition: An aggressive, human papillomavirus-related squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the penis. It is characterized by the presence of nests of small malignant cells. The malignant cells tend to invade deeply into the adjacent tissues. Comedo-type necrosis is often present.
synonyms: Basaloid Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Penis
Basaloid Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Penis
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Penis, Basaloid Type
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Penis, Basaloid Type
parents: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Penis
ancestors: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Penis

results.name: Vaginal Carcinosarcoma
results.definition: An aggressive mixed epithelial and mesenchymal neoplasm that arises from the vagina and is characterized by the presence of a malignant epithelial component and a malignant mesenchymal component.
parents: Malignant Vaginal Mixed Epithelial and Mesenchymal Neoplasm
ancestors: Malignant Vaginal Mixed Epithelial and Mesenchymal Neoplasm

results.name: Acute Rheumatic Heart Disease
results.definition: Pancarditis, involving inflammation of the endocardium, myocardium, and epicardium. It results from an autoimmune reaction following an infection with Streptococcus pyogenes (Group A Streptococci).

results.name: Chondroma of the Central Nervous System
results.name_text: Chondroma of the Central Nervous System
match: Chondroma of the Central Nervous System
Chondroma of the Central Nervous System
Osteochondroma of the Central Nervous System

Chondroma of the Central Nervous System
Osteochondroma of the Central Nervous System
results.definition: An extraskeletal chondroma usually arising from the dura.
synonyms: Chondroma of the Central Nervous System
Osteochondroma of the Central Nervous System
parents: Central Nervous System Mesenchymal Non-meningothelial Tumor
ancestors: Central Nervous System Mesenchymal Non-meningothelial Tumor

results.name: Bardet-Biedl Syndrome
results.definition: An autosomal recessive inherited syndrome caused by mutations in at least fourteen different genes, called BBS genes. It is characterized by loss of vision, obesity, diabetes, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, polydactyly, intellectual disability, genital organs abnormalities, and delayed development of motor skills.

results.name: Sleep Disorder
results.definition: A change from the patient's baseline sleeping pattern, in the hours slept and/or an alteration/dysfunction in the stages of sleep.
results.glossary_definition: A disturbance of normal sleep patterns. There are a number of sleep disorders that range from trouble falling asleep, to nightmares, sleepwalking, and sleep apnea (problems with breathing that cause loud snoring). Poor sleep may also be caused by diseases such as heart disease, lung disease, or nerve disorders.

results.name: Lateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
results.name_text: Lateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
match: Lateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Lateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Lateral Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding
search: Lateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Lateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Lateral Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding
results.definition: An electrocardiographic finding of pathologic Q waves in leads V5, V6, I and aVL, which is suggestive of myocardial infarction of the lateral wall of the left ventricle. (CDISC)
results.glossary_definition: An electrocardiographic finding of pathologic Q waves in leads V5, V6, I and aVL, which is suggestive of myocardial infarction of the lateral wall of the left ventricle.
synonyms: Lateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Lateral Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding

results.name: Small Intestinal Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the small intestine. Histologic variants include mucinous adenocarcinoma and signet ring cell carcinoma.

results.name: Diffuse Glomerulonephritis
results.definition: Inflammation of the glomeruli, in which all glomeruli are affected, resulting in renal failure.

results.name: Pancreatic Serous Cystadenoma
results.definition: A benign, non-metastasizing cystic epithelial neoplasm arising from the exocrine pancreas. It is composed of glycogen-rich epithelial cells which produce a watery fluid. Signs and symptoms include abdominal mass, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, and weight loss.

results.name: Granuloma Inguinale
results.definition: A condition resulting from infection by Klebsiella granulomati, which is characterized by ulcerative lesions of the genitalia.
results.glossary_definition: Anogenital ulcers caused by Calymmatobacterium granulomatis as distinguished from lymphogranuloma inguinale (see LYMPHOGRANULOMA VENEREUM) caused by CHLAMYDIA TRACHOMATIS. Diagnosis is made by demonstration of typical intracellular Donovan bodies in crushed-tissue smears.

results.name: Paroxysmal Nocturnal Hemoglobinuria
results.definition: A rare acquired hematologic disorder characterized by hemolytic anemia, dark-colored urine due to the release of hemoglobin in the blood, and thrombosis. The episodes of hemolysis tend to occur at night. It is caused by a somatic mutation in the glycosylphosphatidylinositol biosynthesis gene.
results.glossary_definition: A rare disorder in which red blood cells are easily destroyed by certain immune system proteins. Symptoms include blood clots, and red or brownish urine in the morning. Aplastic anemia (decreased production of blood cells) may lead to PNH, and people with PNH are at increased risk of acute myelogenous leukemia.

results.name: Uterine Carcinosarcoma
match: Malignant Mixed Mesodermal (Mullerian) Tumor of the Uterus
search: Malignant Mixed Mesodermal (Mullerian) Tumor of the Uterus
results.definition: A usually aggressive malignant neoplasm arising from the uterine corpus and less often the cervix. It is characterized by the presence of two components: a malignant epithelial component and a sarcomatous component. In the uterine corpus the epithelial component is usually glandular whereas in the cervix is usually non-glandular. Carcinosarcoma of the cervix, although it is aggressive, it may have a better prognosis compared to the uterine corpus carcinosarcoma.
synonyms: Malignant Mixed Mesodermal (Mullerian) Tumor of the Uterus

results.name: Vaginal Squamous Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from the squamous epithelium of the vagina. Representative examples include condyloma acuminatum, squamous papilloma, and squamous cell carcinoma.

results.name: Lung Abscess
results.definition: A bacterial, fungal or parasitic abscess that develops in the lung parenchyma. Causes include aspiration pneumonia, necrotizing pneumonia, necrotizing malignant tumors, and Wegener's granulomatosis.

results.name: Alveolar Adenoma
results.definition: A benign, well circumscribed lung neoplasm morphologically characterized by the presence of cystic spaces resembling alveoli, lined by a simple cuboidal epithelium. The cystic spaces are surrounded by a spindle cell stroma which may show myxoid changes. It is a solitary, usually peripheral lung lesion. Patients are usually asymptomatic and its discovery is an incidental finding during chest X-ray examination. Surgical excision is curative.
results.glossary_definition: A benign lung neoplasm arising from the alveolar/bronchiolar epithelium.

results.name: Breast Lipoma
results.definition: A benign, mesenchymal neoplasm that arises from the breast. It is surrounded by a thin capsule and composed of mature adipose tissue cells. Atypia is absent.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Bartholin Gland Adenoma
results.definition: A rare, benign neoplasm that arises from the Bartholin gland and is characterized by the presence of clustered glands and tubules lined by mucin-secreting epithelial cells.

results.name: Facial Nerve Palsy
results.definition: Partial or complete paralysis of the facial muscles of one side of a person's face. It is caused by damage to the seventh cranial nerve. It is usually temporary but it may recur.
results.glossary_definition: Severe or complete loss of facial muscle motor function. This condition may result from central or peripheral lesions. Damage to CNS motor pathways from the cerebral cortex to the facial nuclei in the pons leads to facial weakness that generally spares the forehead muscles. FACIAL NERVE DISEASES generally results in generalized hemifacial weakness. NEUROMUSCULAR JUNCTION DISEASES and MUSCULAR DISEASES may also cause facial paralysis or paresis.

results.name: Malignant Ovarian Mixed Epithelial Tumor
match: Mixed Epithelial Carcinoma of the Ovary
search: Mixed Epithelial Carcinoma of the Ovary
results.definition: A malignant mixed epithelial neoplasm that arises from the ovary and is composed predominantly of serous and endocervical-type mucinous epithelium.
synonyms: Mixed Epithelial Carcinoma of the Ovary

results.name: Ovarian Endometrioid Adenocarcinofibroma
results.definition: A malignant neoplasm of the ovary characterized by the presence of malignant glandular cells resembling endometrial cells in a fibrotic stroma.

results.name: Cystinuria
results.definition: An autosomal recessive inherited metabolic disorder caused by mutations in the SLC3A1 and SLC7A9 genes. It is characterized by deficient re-absorption of cystine in the proximal tubules of the kidney. It results in the formation of stones in the kidney, ureter, and urinary bladder.

results.name: Yaws
results.definition: An endemic, infectious, nonvenereal disease in humans that presents mainly in children younger than 15 years. The disease occurs primarily in warm, humid, tropical areas of Africa, Asia, South America, and Oceania, among poor rural populations where conditions of overcrowding and poor sanitation prevail. Infection with Treponema pertenue, a subspecies of Treponema pallidum, causes the disease.

results.name: Breast Neuroendocrine Neoplasm
results.definition: A neoplasm that arises from the breast and is composed of cells of neuroendocrine origin. Most cases are neuroendocrine carcinomas. Primary carcinoid tumors of the breast are very rare.

results.name: Oxyphilic Endometrial Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: A primary endometrioid adenocarcinoma of the endometrium characterized by the presence of eosinophilic malignant glandular epithelial cells.

results.name: Cerebral Sarcoidosis
results.definition: Sarcoidosis of the cerebrum.

results.name: Pineoblastoma
match: Primitive Neuroectodermal Neoplasm of Pineal Gland
Primitive Neuroectodermal Neoplasm of the Pineal Gland
Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Pineal Gland
Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of the Pineal Gland
search: Primitive Neuroectodermal Neoplasm of Pineal Gland
Primitive Neuroectodermal Neoplasm of the Pineal Gland
Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Pineal Gland
Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of the Pineal Gland
results.definition: A poorly differentiated malignant embryonal neoplasm arising from the pineal region. It usually occurs in children and it is characterized by the presence of small immature neuroepithelial cells. It may follow an aggressive clinical course.
results.glossary_definition: A fast growing type of brain tumor that occurs in or around the pineal gland, a tiny organ near the center of the brain.
synonyms: Primitive Neuroectodermal Neoplasm of Pineal Gland
Primitive Neuroectodermal Neoplasm of the Pineal Gland
Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Pineal Gland
Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of the Pineal Gland
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Nasal Cavity Squamous Cell Carcinoma
match: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Nasal Cavity
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Nasal Cavity
search: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Nasal Cavity
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Nasal Cavity
results.reporting_disease: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
results.definition: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the nasal cavity mucosa. Signs and symptoms include nasal fullness and obstruction, pain, epistaxis, and the presence of a nasal mass.
synonyms: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Nasal Cavity
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Nasal Cavity
parents: Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Squamous Cell Carcinoma
ancestors: Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Squamous Cell Carcinoma
Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Carcinoma
Paranasal Sinus and Nasal Cavity Cancer

results.name: Small Intestinal Lymphoma
results.definition: A non-Hodgkin or Hodgkin lymphoma that arises from the small intestine.

results.name: Mucinous Gastric Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: A variant of gastric adenocarcinoma with more than half of the tumor containing extracellular mucinous pools.

results.name: Urethritis
results.definition: Inflammation of the urethra.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the urethra.

results.name: Dysgerminoma
results.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor characterized by the presence of a monotonous primitive germ cell population. The neoplastic cells form aggregates and have an abundant pale cytoplasm and uniform nuclei. The aggregates of the germ cells are separated by fibrous septa which contain inflammatory cells, mostly T-lymphocytes. It arises primarily in the ovaries, but can occur both primarily and secondarily at other sites, particularly the central nervous system. It responds to chemotherapy and radiotherapy. Its prognosis is related to the tumor stage.
results.glossary_definition: A type of tumor that begins in the type of cells that give rise to egg cells and is most often found in the ovaries. Dysgerminomas may also occur in other places in the body, including the central nervous system. They are the most common type of ovarian germ cell tumor and can spread to other parts of the body. They are most common in females who are younger than 20 years old.

results.name: Iris Spindle Cell Melanoma
match: Spindle Cell Melanoma of the Iris
search: Spindle Cell Melanoma of the Iris
synonyms: Spindle Cell Melanoma of the Iris

results.name: Gallbladder Angiosarcoma
results.definition: A malignant vascular neoplasm arising from the gallbladder.

results.name: Proliferative Diabetic Retinopathy
results.definition: Advanced retinopathy due to diabetes mellitus characterized by the formation of new vessels in the retina. The new vessels are abnormal and fragile. If hemorrhage occurs due to the vascular fragility, there is increased risk of vision loss or blindness.

results.name: Common Variable Immunodeficiency
results.definition: A primary immunodeficiency characterized by low levels or absence of all the immunoglobulin classes and lack of B-lymphocytes or plasma cells. It results in recurrent bacterial infections. Complications include autoimmune phenomena and cancer development.
results.glossary_definition: Heterogeneous group of immunodeficiency syndromes characterized by hypogammaglobulinemia of most isotypes, variable B-cell defects, and the presence of recurrent bacterial infections.

results.name: Malignant Buccal Mucosa Neoplasm
match: Malignant Neoplasm of the Buccal Mucosa
Malignant Tumor of the Buccal Mucosa
search: Malignant Neoplasm of the Buccal Mucosa
Malignant Tumor of the Buccal Mucosa
results.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving the buccal mucosa.
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of the Buccal Mucosa
Malignant Tumor of the Buccal Mucosa

results.name: Joubert Syndrome
results.definition: A rare genetic syndrome characterized by the hypoplasia or absence of the cerebellar vermis. Signs and symptoms include rapid breathing (hyperpnea), sleep apnea, abnormal eye movements, mental retardation, and ataxia.

results.name: Noonan Syndrome
results.definition: A genetic syndrome caused by mutations in the PTPN11 gene (over 50% of the cases) or less frequently mutations in the SOS1, RAF1, or KRAS genes. It is characterized by short stature, webbed neck, hypertelorism, low-set ears, deafness, and thrombocytopenia or abnormal platelet function.

results.name: Postauricular Lymphadenitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the postauricular lymph nodes.

results.name: Extrahepatic Bile Duct Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma
results.name_text: Extrahepatic Bile Duct Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma
match: Extrahepatic Bile Duct Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma
Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma of Bile Duct
Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma of the Bile Duct
Extrahepatic Bile Duct Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma
search: Extrahepatic Bile Duct Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma
Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma of Bile Duct
Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma of the Bile Duct
Extrahepatic Bile Duct Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: A morphologic variant of extrahepatic bile duct adenocarcinoma characterized by the presence of malignant glandular epithelium composed of clear cells.
synonyms: Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma of Bile Duct
Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma of the Bile Duct
Extrahepatic Bile Duct Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma

results.name: Small Cell Osteosarcoma
results.definition: An osteosarcoma usually arising from the metaphysis of long bones. It is characterized by the presence of small cells and osteoid production. The prognosis is usually unfavorable.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Cerebellar Vermis Medulloblastoma
results.definition: A medulloblastoma arising from the vermis of the cerebellum.

results.name: Intravascular Angioleiomyoma
results.definition: A morphologic variant of angioleiomyoma characterized by the adherence of neoplastic smooth muscle cells to the walls of vascular channels.

results.name: Dissociative Amnesia
results.definition: A disorder characterized by a retrospective gap in memory of important personal information, usually of a traumatic or stressful nature; the memory loss far exceeds ordinary forgetfulness and is not the result of substance use or the consequence of a medical condition.

results.name: Arthropathy
results.definition: Any disorder of the joints.
results.glossary_definition: A disease or disorder that affects a joint.

results.name: Delusional Disorder
results.definition: A disorder characterized by the presence of one or more nonbizarre delusions that persist for at least 1 month; the delusion(s) are not due to schizophrenia or a mood disorder, and do not impair psychosocial functioning apart from the ramifications of the delusion(s).

results.name: Epithelioid Neurofibroma
results.definition: A rare neurofibroma with epithelioid morphology.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Breast Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the breast. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include fibrocystic disease, gynecomastia, and mastitis. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include fibroadenoma, lobular neoplasia, carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma.

results.name: Otorrhea
results.definition: Discharge or drainage of fluid from the ear.
results.glossary_definition: Discharge or drainage of fluid from the ear.

results.name: Robinow Syndrome
results.definition: A rare autosomal recessive or dominant inherited disorder. The autosomal recessive form is caused by mutations in the ROR2 gene. There is no causative mutation identified for the autosomal dominant form. It is manifested with short limbs, abnormal facial features, underdeveloped genitalia, and wedge-shaped vertebrae.

results.name: Pityriasis Rubra Pilaris
results.definition: A rare cutaneous disorder of unknown etiology characterized by the presence of reddish-orange scaly plaques, palmoplantar keratoderma, keratotic follicular papules, and confluent erythematous areas with areas of normal skin between the lesions.

results.name: Spinal Cord Astrocytoma
results.definition: A low or high grade astrocytoma that arises in the spinal cord.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Type 2 Renal Papillary Adenoma
match: Type 2 Papillary Adenoma of the Kidney
search: Type 2 Papillary Adenoma of the Kidney
synonyms: Type 2 Papillary Adenoma of the Kidney

results.name: Hepatobiliary Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the liver, bile ducts, and gallbladder. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include hepatitis, cirrhosis, cholangitis, and cholecystitis. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include hepatocellular adenoma, hepatocellular carcinoma, and cholangiocarcinoma.
children: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Disorder

results.name: Bloom Syndrome
results.definition: Bloom syndrome is an autosomal recessive disorder associated with mutations in BLM gene encoding protein that belongs to the family of DNA helicases. It is characterized by predisposition to cancer, immunodeficiency, high sensitivity to UV and genomic instability of somatic cells. (Oncogene 2001 Dec 13;20(57):8276-80)
results.glossary_definition: A rare, inherited disorder marked by height that is shorter than average, a narrow face with redness and a rash, a high-pitched voice, and fertility problems. Patients with this disorder have an increased risk of cancer, especially leukemia and osteosarcoma (bone cancer). Bloom syndrome is caused by changes in a protein that normally helps cells make copies of the DNA. Changes in this protein cause many breaks, rearrangements, and other mutations in the DNA. It is a type of autosomal recessive genetic disease.

results.name: L-Cell Glucagon-Like Peptide-Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor
results.definition: A neuroendocrine tumor that arises from the gastrointestinal tract and produces glucagon-like peptides. Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of neoplastic cells forming tubular or trabecular patterns.
children: Small Intestinal L-Cell Glucagon-Like Peptide-Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor
Appendix L-Cell Glucagon-Like Peptide-Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor
Colon L-Cell Glucagon-Like Peptide-Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor

results.name: Seizure Disorder
results.definition: A brain disorder characterized by episodes of abnormally increased neuronal discharge resulting in transient episodes of sensory or motor neurological dysfunction, or psychic dysfunction. These episodes may or may not be associated with loss of consciousness or convulsions.
results.glossary_definition: A group of disorders marked by problems in the normal functioning of the brain. These problems can produce seizures, unusual body movements, a loss of consciousness or changes in consciousness, as well as mental problems or problems with the senses.

results.name: Acrodermatitis
results.definition: An inflammatory skin condition affecting children. It is often associated with Epstein-Barr virus infection, hepatitis B infection or cytomegalovirus infection. It is characterized by the presence of cutaneous rashes and patches on the palms and soles. The trunk is not affected.

results.name: Clear Cell Hidradenoma
results.definition: An uncommon benign neoplasm of the sweat glands characterized by the presence of clear cells.

results.name: Premature Ejaculation
results.definition: A disorder characterized by persistent or recurrent ejaculation before or after penetration and before the person wishes it.

results.name: Eosinophilic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
results.name_text: Eosinophilic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
match: Eosinophilic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
Eosinophilic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
search: Eosinophilic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
Eosinophilic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
synonyms: Eosinophilic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma

results.name: Malignant Cranial Nerve Neoplasm
match: Malignant Neoplasm of the Cranial Nerve
Malignant Tumor of the Cranial Nerve
search: Malignant Neoplasm of the Cranial Nerve
Malignant Tumor of the Cranial Nerve
results.definition: Abnormal malignant growth of the cells that comprise the cranial nerve.
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of the Cranial Nerve
Malignant Tumor of the Cranial Nerve

results.name: Intestinal Pseudo-Obstruction
results.definition: Ileus of the intestine in which there is no mechanical obstruction.
results.glossary_definition: Obstruction of the intestines that is functional, not mechanical.

results.name: Bile Duct Adenoma
results.definition: A benign, well-demarcated polypoid neoplasm arising from the bile duct epithelium. According to the growth pattern, it is classified as tubular, papillary, or tubulopapillary. Adenomas arising from the extrahepatic bile ducts usually produce symptoms related to biliary obstruction.
results.glossary_definition: A benign neoplasm arising from/comprising cells resembling those of bile ducts.

results.name: Hypoglycemia
results.definition: Abnormally low level of glucose in the blood.
results.glossary_definition: Abnormally low blood sugar.

results.name: Adult Ependymoblastoma
results.definition: An embryonal tumor with multilayered rosettes, C19MC-altered, occurring in adults.
parents: Embryonal Tumor with Multilayered Rosettes, C19MC-Altered
ancestors: Embryonal Tumor with Multilayered Rosettes, C19MC-Altered

results.name: Cauda Equina Syndrome
results.definition: A rare neurologic disorder caused by impingement of the nerve roots of the cauda equina secondary to disc herniation, spinal stenosis, vertebral fracture, neoplasm or infection. Clinical signs may include bladder or bowel dysfunction, paresthesia and weakness of the lower extremities. The clinical course rapidly deteriorates and necessitates emergent surgical decompression to minimize risk of incontinence, sexual dysfunction and permanent paralysis.

results.name: Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease
results.definition: A rare transmittable degenerative disorder of the brain caused by prions. Morphologically it is characterized by spongiform degeneration of the cerebral and cerebellar cortex. Signs and symptoms include sleep disturbances, personality changes, aphasia, ataxia, muscle atrophy and weakness, visual loss, and myoclonus. It usually leads to death within a year from the onset of the disease.
results.glossary_definition: A rare transmissible encephalopathy most prevalent between the ages of 50 and 70 years. Affected individuals may present with sleep disturbances, personality changes, ATAXIA; APHASIA, visual loss, weakness, muscle atrophy, MYOCLONUS, progressive dementia, and death within one year of disease onset. A familial form exhibiting autosomal dominant inheritance and a new variant CJD (potentially associated with ENCEPHALOPATHY, BOVINE SPONGIFORM) have been described. Pathological features include prominent cerebellar and cerebral cortical spongiform degeneration and the presence of PRIONS. (From N Engl J Med, 1998 Dec 31;339(27))

results.name: Trichorhinophalangeal Syndrome Type I
results.definition: A rare autosomal dominant syndrome caused by mutations in the TRPS1 gene. It is characterized by distinctive facial appearance (sparse hair, pear-shaped nose, and elongated philtrum), skeletal abnormalities (cone-shaped epiphyses, hip malformation), short stature, and mild growth retardation.

results.name: Beri Beri
results.definition: Abnormally low concentrations of vitamin B1 in the blood.
results.glossary_definition: A disease caused by a deficiency of thiamine (vitamin B1) and characterized by polyneuritis, cardiac pathology, and edema. The epidemic form is found primarily in areas in which white (polished) rice is the staple food, as in Japan, China, the Philippines, India, and other countries of southeast Asia. (Dorland, 27th ed)

results.name: External Ear Carcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the external ear. This category includes squamous cell carcinoma, basal cell carcinoma, and ceruminous adenocarcinoma.

results.name: Glucose Metabolism Disorder
results.definition: A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormal blood glucose levels.

results.name: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain
results.name_text: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain
match: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain
Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain
Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm to the Brain
search: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain
Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain
Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm to the Brain
results.definition: A malignant neoplasm that has spread to the brain from another anatomic site or system. The majority are carcinomas (usually lung or breast carcinomas).
results.glossary_definition: Cancer that has spread from the original (primary) tumor to the brain.
synonyms: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain
Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm to the Brain

results.name: Placenta Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the placenta. Representative examples include chorioamnionitis, hemangioma, and choriocarcinoma.

results.name: Glanzmann Thrombasthenia
results.definition: A rare, autosomal recessive inherited and less frequently acquired platelet disorder. It is characterized by deficient or dysfunctional glycoprotein IIb/IIIa complex. It leads to defective platelet aggregation, resulting in bleeding.

results.name: Spindle Cell Sarcoma
results.definition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm composed of spindle-shaped cells. This is a morphologic term which can be applied to a wide range of sarcomas.
results.glossary_definition: A type of connective tissue cancer in which the cells are spindle-shaped when examined under a microscope.

results.name: Hyperphosphatemia
results.definition: Abnormally high level of phosphate in the blood.
results.glossary_definition: Abnormally high level of phosphate in the blood.

results.name: Intramuscular Hemangioma
results.definition: A hemangioma arising from skeletal muscle.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Cerebral Palsy
results.definition: A group of disorders affecting the development of movement and posture, often accompanied by disturbances of sensation, perception, cognition, and behavior. It results from damage to the fetal or infant brain.
results.glossary_definition: A non-progressive, neurological syndrome presenting in infancy or early childhood that is caused by brain injury or malformation and is characterized by permanent impairment of muscle coordination and various movement disorders.

results.name: Hidradenoma
results.definition: A benign epithelial neoplasm arising from the sweat glands. Variants include the clear cell and nodular hidradenoma.

results.name: Eye Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the eye. Representative examples include conjunctivitis, glaucoma, cataract, conjunctival squamous cell carcinoma, uveal melanoma, and retinoblastoma.

results.name: Classic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
results.name_text: Classic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
match: Classic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
Classic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
search: Classic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
Classic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
synonyms: Classic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma

results.name: Linitis Plastica
results.definition: A cancer-related condition in which the gastric wall becomes thickened and rubbery (leather-bottle stomach). It is most often associated with diffuse gastric adenocarcinomas.
results.glossary_definition: A condition where the stomach wall becomes thickened, rubbery and loses its ability to distend. The stomach assumes a "leather bottle" shape. It is most often seen in adenocarcinoma of the stomach. The term is often used synonymously with diffuse adenocarcinoma of the stomach.

results.name: Penile Fibromatosis
results.definition: Fibromatosis arising from the soft tissues of the penis. It is characterized by the presence of spindle-shaped fibroblasts, and an infiltrative growth pattern. It causes the penis to bend when it becomes erect.

results.name: Early Gastric Cancer
results.definition: An invasive adenocarcinoma confined to the mucosa or mucosa and submucosa of the gastric wall. The regional lymph nodes may or may not be involved. It usually occurs in the lesser curvature. The 5-year survival rate following resection is between 80 percent and 95 percent, and remains high even when lymph node metastases are present.

results.name: Acanthosis Nigricans
results.definition: A melanotic cutaneous lesion that develops in the axilla and other body folds. It may be idiopathic, drug-induced, or it may be associated with the presence of an endocrine disorder or malignancy.
results.glossary_definition: Abnormal darkening of the skin in body folds and creases characterized by a velvet texture and appearance.

results.name: Vagus Nerve Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the vagus nerve (tenth cranial nerve).
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by involvement of the vagus nerve (tenth cranial nerve).

results.name: Meningeal Solitary Fibrous Tumor/Hemangiopericytoma
match: Hemangiopericytoma of the Central Nervous System
search: Hemangiopericytoma of the Central Nervous System
results.oncotree_disease: Hemangiopericytoma of the Central Nervous System
results.definition: A solitary fibrous tumor/hemangiopericytoma that arises from the meninges.
parents: Central Nervous System Solitary Fibrous Tumor/Hemangiopericytoma
ancestors: Central Nervous System Solitary Fibrous Tumor/Hemangiopericytoma
Central Nervous System Mesenchymal Non-meningothelial Tumor

results.name: Retinopathy of Prematurity
results.definition: A bilateral retinopathy characterized by neovascularization, scarring, retinal detachment, and eventually blindness. It may be mild or severe. It occurs in babies born prematurely. Causes include oxygen toxicity and hypoxia.
results.glossary_definition: A retinal condition of very immature infants that may be characterized by non-vascularized retina that may lead to neovascularization, scarring, retinal detachment, and blindness.

results.name: Urothelial Papilloma
results.definition: A rare benign condition, characterized by a papillary growth in the urinary tract with a central fibrovascular core. The latter is lined by normal urothelium.

results.name: Azoospermia
results.definition: Complete absence of spermatozoa in the semen.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate complete absence of spermatozoa in the semen.

results.name: Tick-Born Relapsing Fever
results.definition: An infection that is caused by certain species of Rickettsia or Borrelia, which are transmitted to humans from infected ticks; it is characterized by sudden fever, chills, headaches, myalgia, arthralgia, nausea, and possibly a rash. Symptoms usually persist for two to nine days, then disappear, with recurrence after several weeks if the patient remains untreated.

results.name: Ciliary Body Epithelioid Cell Melanoma
match: Epithelioid Cell Melanoma of Ciliary Body
Epithelioid Cell Melanoma of the Ciliary Body
search: Epithelioid Cell Melanoma of Ciliary Body
Epithelioid Cell Melanoma of the Ciliary Body
synonyms: Epithelioid Cell Melanoma of Ciliary Body
Epithelioid Cell Melanoma of the Ciliary Body

results.name: Ileus
results.definition: Decrease in peristalsis in the absence of a mechanical bowel obstruction.
results.glossary_definition: Blockage of the intestines

results.name: Occult Squamous Cell Lung Carcinoma
match: Occult Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Lung
Occult Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
search: Occult Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Lung
Occult Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
results.definition: A squamous cell lung carcinoma detectable by sputum cytology only. The primary tumor is undetectable radiographically or during bronchoscopy; therefore, it can not be assessed.
synonyms: Occult Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Lung
Occult Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Lung

results.name: Benign Synovial Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign neoplasm arising from the synovial membrane. Examples include the diffuse giant cell tumor of tendon sheath and localized giant cell tumor of tendon sheath.
results.glossary_definition: A benign neoplasm arising from the synovial membrane.
parents: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm
children: Tenosynovial Giant Cell Tumor, Diffuse Type

results.name: Motion Sickness
results.definition: A sensation of discomfort that results from a discordant relationship between visualized movement and any movement sensed by the vestibular system, which is characterized by dizziness, nausea, and vomiting.
results.glossary_definition: Disorder caused by motion, as sea sickness, train sickness, car sickness, air sickness, or SPACE MOTION SICKNESS. It may include nausea, vomiting and dizziness.

results.name: Maxillary Sinus Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the maxillary sinus. It is classified as intestinal-type or non-intestinal-type adenocarcinoma. Nasal obstruction and epistaxis are the presenting signs.
ancestors: Paranasal Sinus and Nasal Cavity Cancer
Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Carcinoma

results.name: Endocrine Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from the epithelial cells of an endocrine organ. Representative examples include pituitary gland adenoma, pituitary gland carcinoma, thyroid gland carcinoma, carcinoid tumor, and neuroendocrine carcinoma.

results.name: Sexual Sadism
results.definition: A disorder characterized by recurrent sexual urges, fantasies, or behaviors involving acts (real, not simulated) in which the psychological or physical suffering of a victim is sexually exciting to the individual.

results.name: Toxic Shock Syndrome
results.definition: A rare acute life-threatening systemic bacterial noncontagious illness caused by any of several related staphylococcal exotoxins. It is characterized by high fever, hypotension, rash, multi-organ dysfunction, and cutaneous desquamation during the early convalescent period. The toxins affect the host immune system, causing an exuberant and pathological host inflammatory response. Laboratory findings include leukocytosis, elevated prothrombin time, hypoalbuminemia, hypocalcemia, and pyuria.
results.glossary_definition: syndrome characterized by high fever, vomiting, diarrhea, confusion, and skin rash; almost all cases have been related to an infection with toxin-producing Staphylococcus aureus.

results.name: Childhood Infratentorial Ependymoma
results.definition: An ependymoma that arises from the infratentorial region of the brain and occurs during childhood.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Contact Dermatitis
results.definition: An inflammatory skin condition caused by direct contact between the skin and either an irritating substance or an allergen.
results.glossary_definition: An inflammatory skin condition caused by direct contact between the skin and either an irritating substance or an allergen.

results.name: Parkinson's Disease
results.definition: A progressive degenerative disorder of the central nervous system characterized by loss of dopamine producing neurons in the substantia nigra and the presence of Lewy bodies in the substantia nigra and locus coeruleus. Signs and symptoms include tremor which is most pronounced during rest, muscle rigidity, slowing of the voluntary movements, a tendency to fall back, and a mask-like facial expression.
results.glossary_definition: A progressive disorder of the nervous system marked by muscle tremors, muscle rigidity, decreased mobility, stooped posture, slow voluntary movements, and a mask-like facial expression.

results.name: Nephropathy
results.definition: A term referring to any disease affecting the kidneys.
results.glossary_definition: Descriptive histopathologic term for renal disease without an inflammatory component.

results.name: Hypochromic Anemia
results.definition: Anemia caused by the reduction of hemoglobin in relation to the red cell volume. As a result, the red cells have an area of central pallor which is increased in size. The leading cause is iron deficiency.
results.glossary_definition: Anemia characterized by a decrease in the ratio of the weight of hemoglobin to the volume of the erythrocyte, i.e., the mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration is less than normal. The individual cells contain less hemoglobin than they could have under optimal conditions. Hypochromic anemia may be caused by iron deficiency from a low iron intake, diminished iron absorption, or excessive iron loss. It can also be caused by infections or other diseases, therapeutic drugs, lead poisoning, and other conditions. (Stedman, 25th ed; from Miale, Laboratory Medicine: Hematology, 6th ed, p393)

results.name: Gonadoblastoma
results.definition: A mixed germ cell/sex cord-stromal tumor characterized by the presence of large germ cells which resemble seminoma cells and small cells which resemble Sertoli or granulosa cells. It occurs in the testis and the ovary and is identified in children and adults. It is often associated with gonadal dysgenesis and abnormal karyotype.
results.glossary_definition: A DYSGERMINOMA that contains all gonadal elements - germ cells, sex cord derivatives, and stromal derivatives. It occurs almost exclusively in abnormal gonads, most often associated with some form of gonadal dysgenesis, frequently associated with abnormal chromosomal karyotype. It is rare and occurs almost exclusively during the first two decades of life. Almost 33% are associated with germinomas. Gonadoblastomas consist of large germ cells surrounded by smaller round, darkly staining Sertoli cells, forming microfollicles consisting of hyaline bodies and calcium deposits. (Dorland, 27th ed; DeVita Jr et al., Cancer: Principles & Practice of Oncology, 3d ed, p1643)

results.name: Substance-Induced Psychotic Disorder
results.definition: A psychotic disorder characterized by prominent hallucinations or delusions that have been determined to be etiologically linked to substance use, intoxication or withdrawal.

results.name: Signet Ring Cell Gastric Adenocarcinoma
match: Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
Signet Ring Cell Adenocarcinoma of Stomach
Signet Ring Cell Adenocarcinoma of the Stomach
search: Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
Signet Ring Cell Adenocarcinoma of Stomach
Signet Ring Cell Adenocarcinoma of the Stomach
results.oncotree_disease: Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
results.definition: A poorly cohesive gastric adenocarcinoma characterized by malignant cells containing intracytoplasmic mucin.
synonyms: Signet Ring Cell Adenocarcinoma of Stomach
Signet Ring Cell Adenocarcinoma of the Stomach

results.name: Fallopian Tube Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm affecting the fallopian tube. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papilloma, adenofibroma, and leiomyoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, carcinosarcoma, and adenosarcoma.
results.glossary_definition: Benign or malignant neoplasms of the FALLOPIAN TUBES. They are uncommon. If they develop, they may be located in the wall or within the lumen as a growth attached to the wall by a stalk.

results.name: Pancreatic ACTH-Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor
results.definition: A malignant, ectopic ACTH secreting pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor, associated with Cushing's syndrome. The prognosis is usually poor.

results.name: Subacute Granulomatous Thyroiditis
results.definition: Self-limited inflammation of the thyroid gland characterized by the presence of multinucleated giant cells. Patients present with neck pain, often associated with fever and dysphagia. The clinical course includes an initial phase of hyperthyroidism, followed by a phase of hypothyroidism, and eventually a return to normal thyroid function.

results.name: Riedel Fibrosing Thyroiditis
results.definition: An inflammatory disorder of unknown etiology that affects the thyroid gland. It is characterized by extensive fibrosis of the thyroid parenchyma. The fibrosis extends beyond the thyroid gland capsule to the adjacent structures.

results.name: Central Nervous System Degenerative Disorder
results.definition: A disorder of the central nervous system characterized by gradual and progressive loss of neural tissue and neurologic function.

results.name: Neonatal Candidiasis
results.definition: A fungal infection by any of the Candida species in a newborn infant up to 28 days old.
results.glossary_definition: A fungal infection by any of the Candida species in a newborn infant up to 28 days old.

results.name: Silicosis
results.definition: An occupational lung disorder caused by the inhalation of silica dust. It results in the inflammation and scarring of the upper lobes of the lungs. It may be an acute or chronic disorder. In the acute form, patients develop shortness of breath, fever, and cyanosis. In the chronic form patients, develop progressive shortness of breath.
results.glossary_definition: Pneumoconiosis due to the inhalation of dust of stone, sand, or flint containing silicon dioxide, with formation of generalized, nodular fibrotic changes in both lungs. (Dorland, 27th ed)

results.name: Bone Leiomyosarcoma
results.definition: A rare aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, arising from the bone. It is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic spindle cells.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Mononeuritis Multiplex
results.definition: A painful asymmetric asynchronous sensory and motor peripheral neuropathy involving isolated damage to at least 2 separate nerve areas; associated with (but not limited to) systemic disorders such as diabetes, vasculitis, amyloidosis, direct tumor involvement, polyarteritis nodosa, rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosus, and paraneoplastic syndromes. It also may be associated with Lyme disease, Wegener's granulomatosis, Sjogren syndrome, cryoglobulinemia, hypereosinophilia, temporal arteritis, scleroderma, sarcoidosis, leprosy, acute viral hepatitis A, and acquired immunodeficiency syndrome.
parents: Mononeuritis Of Upper Limb And Mononeuritis Multiplex
ancestors: Mononeuritis Of Upper Limb And Mononeuritis Multiplex

results.name: Bowel Obstruction
results.definition: Blockage of the normal flow of the intestinal contents within the bowel.
results.glossary_definition: Any impairment, arrest, or reversal of the normal flow of intestinal contents toward the anus.

results.name: Migraine Without Aura
results.definition: A migraine disorder characterized by episodes that occur in the absence of preceding focal neurological symptoms.
results.glossary_definition: A migraine disorder characterized by episodes that occur in the absence of preceding focal neurological symptoms.

results.name: Pleomorphic Rhabdomyosarcoma
results.definition: An aggressive malignant mesenchymal neoplasm with skeletal muscle differentiation, occurring in adults and rarely in children. The tumor is characterized by the presence of bizarre round, spindle, and polygonal cells. Clinical presentation includes a rapidly enlarging painful mass usually of the lower extremities.

results.name: Vulvar Syringoma
results.definition: A benign neoplasm that arises from eccrine ducts in the vulva and is characterized by the presence of tubules and cysts which are lined by epithelial cells in the densely fibrotic dermis.

results.name: Cutaneous Diphtheria
results.definition: A usually mild form of diphtheria characterized by infection of the skin by corynebacterium diphtheria and the resulting formation of a chronic, shallow ulcer that is sometimes bordered or followed by a bulla.

results.name: Diphtheria
results.definition: A Gram-positive bacterial infection caused by Corynebacterium diphtheriae. It usually involves the oral cavity, pharynx, and nasal cavity. Patients develop pseudomembranes in the affected areas and manifest signs and symptoms of an upper respiratory infection. The diphtheria toxin may cause myocarditis, polyneuritis, and other systemic effects.
results.glossary_definition: A localized infection of mucous membranes or skin caused by toxigenic strains of CORYNEBACTERIUM DIPHTHERIAE. It is characterized by the presence of a pseudomembrane at the site of infection. DIPHTHERIA TOXIN, produced by C. diphtheriae, can cause myocarditis, polyneuritis, and other systemic toxic effects.

match: CD30 Positive Anaplastic Large Cell Lymphoma
search: CD30 Positive Anaplastic Large Cell Lymphoma
synonyms: CD30 Positive Anaplastic Large Cell Lymphoma
ancestors: Mature T-Cell and NK-Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
children: Primary Cutaneous Anaplastic Large Cell Lymphoma
parents: Mature T-Cell and NK-Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
results.definition: A peripheral (mature) T-cell lymphoma, consisting of usually large anaplastic, CD30 positive cells. The majority of cases are positive for the anaplastic large cell lymphoma (ALK) protein. The most frequently seen genetic alteration is a t(2;5) translocation. Majority of patients present with advanced disease. The most important prognostic indicator is ALK positivity, which has been associated with a favorable prognosis. (WHO, 2001)
results.glossary_definition: An aggressive (fast-growing) type of non-Hodgkin lymphoma that is usually of the T-cell type. The cancer cells express a marker called CD30 or Ki-1 on the surface, and may appear in the lymph nodes, skin, bones, soft tissues, lungs, or liver.
results.name: Anaplastic Large Cell Lymphoma
Rheumatic Heart Disease
results.definition: An autoinflammatory condition following an infection with Group A Beta Hemolytic Streptococcus (GABHS), in which the heart is attacked by antibodies formed in reaction to a recent GABHS infection. Chief anatomic changes of the valve include leaflet thickening, commissural fusion, and shortening and thickening of the tendinous cords, all of which can result in valvular dysfunction.

results.name: Erythema Infectiosum
results.definition: A self-limited viral infectious disorder caused by the human parvovirus B19. It affects predominantly children and is characterized by the development of a bright red skin eruption in the cheeks. It is followed by a maculopapular skin eruption in the extremities which eventually fades into a lacey pattern.

results.name: Clear Cell-Sugar-Tumor of the Lung
results.definition: A rare benign lung tumor with perivascular epithelioid cell differentiation. It is composed of round or oval cells with abundant clear or eosinophilic cytoplasm and distinct cell borders. The vast majority of patients are asymptomatic and the tumors are discovered incidentally. Excision is curative.

results.name: Middle Ear Cholesteatoma
results.definition: A non-neoplastic lesion characterized by the proliferation of keratinizing squamous epithelium in the middle ear that results in the accumulation of keratin and cells. It is usually caused by repeated infections. If left untreated, it may increase in size and destroy the adjacent delicate bones of the middle ear.
results.glossary_definition: Cholesteatoma of the middle ear, usually associated with chronic infection, and commonly affecting the tympanum, epitympanum, and antrum.

results.name: Cervical Lymphoepithelioma-Like Carcinoma
results.definition: A variant of cervical squamous cell carcinoma characterized by the presence of islands of cells with uniform, vesicular nuclei and prominent nucleoli and a dense lymphocytic infiltrate.

results.name: Refractory Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor
results.name_text: Refractory Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor
match: Refractory Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor
Refractory Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor
search: Refractory Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor
Refractory Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor
results.definition: Malignant testicular germ cell tumor that is resistant to treatment.
synonyms: Refractory Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor

results.name: Fallopian Tube Adenosarcoma
results.definition: An extremely rare malignant neoplasm that arises from the fallopian tube and is characterized by the presence of a benign epithelial component and a sarcomatous component.

results.name: Prostate Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the prostate gland. It is one of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men. The majority of adenocarcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occurs in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland. Grading of prostatic adenocarcinoma predicts disease progression and correlates with survival. Several grading systems have been proposed, of which the Gleason system is the most commonly used. Gleason sums of 2 to 4 represent well-differentiated disease, 5 to 7 moderately differentiated disease and 8 to 10 poorly differentiated disease. Prostatic-specific antigen (PSA) serum test is widely used as a screening test for the early detection of prostatic adenocarcinoma. Treatment options include radical prostatectomy, radiation therapy, androgen ablation and cryotherapy. Watchful waiting or surveillance alone is an option for older patients with low-grade or low-stage disease.
children: Acinar Prostate Adenocarcinoma, Signet Ring Variant

results.name: Acute Monoblastic and Monocytic Leukemia
match: Acute Monoblastic Leukemia and Acute Monocytic Leukemia
search: Acute Monoblastic Leukemia and Acute Monocytic Leukemia
results.definition: Acute myeloid leukemia in which 80% or more of the leukemic cells are of monocytic lineage, including monoblasts, promonocytes, and monocytes. Bleeding disorders are common presenting features.
synonyms: Acute Monoblastic Leukemia and Acute Monocytic Leukemia
parents: Acute Myeloid Leukemia Not Otherwise Specified
ancestors: Acute Myeloid Leukemia Not Otherwise Specified

results.name: Craniosynostosis
results.definition: A congenital disorder characterized by earlier than normal closure of some or all sutures of the infant skull.

results.name: Congenital T-Cell Immunodeficiency
results.definition: A broad classification of inherited disorders presenting at birth that affect the cell-mediated aspect of the immune response. Circulating numbers of T lymphocytes are decreased or ineffective.

results.name: Selective Immunoglobulin G Subclass Deficiency
results.definition: A classification of dysgammaglobulinemias characterized by low or undetectable serum levels of one of the four immunoglobulin class G (IgG) subclasses. Selective IgG1 deficiency is rare and primarily decreases the immune response to bacterial protein antigens. Selective IgG2 deficiency is the most common subclass deficiency among children and primarily leads to an inadequate response to bacterial polysaccharide antigens. Selective IgG3 deficiency is the most common subclass deficiency among adults and also primarily lowers the response to bacterial proteins. Selective IgG4 deficiency may be a clinically insignificant developmental variant, as IgG4 is a subclass that is virtually undetectable until the end of the first decade of life. Low levels of any IgG subclass will reduce the immune system's effectiveness and thus the clinical presentation of these diseases is usually recurrent infection, particularly by encapsulated bacteria.

results.name: Color Blindness
results.definition: The absence of or defect in the perception of colors.
results.glossary_definition: Impaired ability to distinguish colors on the spectrum.

results.name: Maxillary Sinus Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the maxillary sinus. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include Schneiderian papilloma and salivary gland-type adenoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma and lymphoma.
results.glossary_definition: Neoplasms or tumors of the maxillary sinus. The majority of paranasal sinus neoplasms arise here. They develop silently when confined to the sinus and produce symptoms on extension through the walls.

results.name: Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome
results.definition: Progressive and life-threatening pulmonary distress in the absence of an underlying pulmonary condition, usually following major trauma or surgery. Cases of neonatal respiratory distress syndrome are not included in this definition.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by progressive and life-threatening pulmonary distress in the absence of an underlying pulmonary condition, usually following major trauma or surgery.

results.name: Pedophilia
results.definition: A disorder characterized by recurrent sexual urges, fantasies, or behaviors involving sexual activity with a prepubescent child or children.

results.name: Nasal Cavity Inverted Papilloma
match: Inverting Papilloma of the Nasal Cavity
Nasal Cavity Schneiderian Papilloma, Inverted Type
search: Inverting Papilloma of the Nasal Cavity
Nasal Cavity Schneiderian Papilloma, Inverted Type
results.definition: A benign neoplasm that arises from the ciliated respiratory mucosa that lines the nasal cavity. It results from the invagination and proliferation of epithelial cells in the underlying stroma. Clinical manifestations include nasal obstruction, epistaxis, and anosmia. It has the tendency to recur and extend to adjacent structures. Inverted papillomas are occasionally associated with the development or presence of carcinomas, usually squamous cell carcinomas.
synonyms: Inverting Papilloma of the Nasal Cavity
Nasal Cavity Schneiderian Papilloma, Inverted Type

results.name: Esophageal Adenosquamous Carcinoma
results.definition: An esophageal carcinoma characterized by the presence of distinguishable squamous and glandular carcinomatous components.

results.name: Mixed Ductal-Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Pancreas
results.name_text: Mixed Ductal-Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Pancreas
match: Mixed Ductal-Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Pancreas
Mixed Ductal-Endocrine Carcinoma of the Pancreas
Mixed Ductal-Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Pancreas
search: Mixed Ductal-Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Pancreas
Mixed Ductal-Endocrine Carcinoma of the Pancreas
Mixed Ductal-Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Pancreas
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the pancreas showing a mixture of ductal and neuroendocrine malignant cells in both the primary tumor and in the metastatic sites.
synonyms: Mixed Ductal-Endocrine Carcinoma of the Pancreas
Mixed Ductal-Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Pancreas

results.name: Monckeberg Arteriosclerosis
results.definition: A type of arteriosclerosis in which calcification of the tunica media is the predominant feature.

results.name: Gastric Gastrin-Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor
match: Gastrin Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor of the Stomach
Gastrin Producing Tumor of the Stomach
Gastrin-Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor of the Stomach
search: Gastrin Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor of the Stomach
Gastrin Producing Tumor of the Stomach
Gastrin-Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor of the Stomach
results.definition: A well differentiated neuroendocrine tumor that arises from the stomach. It produces gastrin and it may be associated with Zollinger-Ellison syndrome.
synonyms: Gastrin Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor of the Stomach
Gastrin Producing Tumor of the Stomach
Gastrin-Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor of the Stomach

results.name: Neutropenia
results.definition: A decrease in the number of neutrophils in the peripheral blood.
results.glossary_definition: A condition in which there is a lower-than-normal number of neutrophils (a type of white blood cell).

results.name: Intraventricular Brain Neoplasm
results.definition: A neoplasm that involves a brain ventricle. It may be a primary neoplasm arising from a brain ventricle, a metastasis from a distant anatomic site, or an extension of an invasive neoplasm from an adjacent brain structure.
results.glossary_definition: Neoplasms located in the brain ventricles, including the two lateral, the third, and the fourth ventricle. Ventricular tumors may be primary (e.g., CHOROID PLEXUS NEOPLASMS and GLIOMA, SUBEPENDYMAL), metastasize from distant organs, or occur as extensions of locally invasive tumors from adjacent brain structures.
children: Chordoid Glioma of the Third Ventricle

results.name: Low Grade Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma of the Cervix
