results.name_text: Low Grade Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma of the Cervix
match: Low Grade Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma of the Cervix
Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma of the Cervix
search: Low Grade Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma of the Cervix
Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma of the Cervix
results.definition: A rare sarcoma that arises from the cervix. This category includes low grade endometrioid stromal sarcoma and undifferentiated endocervical sarcoma.
synonyms: Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma of the Cervix
parents: Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Cervix
ancestors: Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Cervix

results.name: Retinal Vascular Disorder
results.definition: Retinal damage resulting from diminished blood flow/oxygenation due to abnormalities of the retinal vessels. Causes include hypertension, diabetes, thrombosis, embolism, and hemorrhage.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by pathological retinal blood vessels that adversely affects vision.

results.name: Duodenal Obstruction
results.definition: Blockage of the normal flow of stomach contents through the duodenum.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by blockage of the normal flow of stomach contents through the duodenum.

results.name: Vaginal Discharge
results.definition: Normal or abnormal secretions from the vagina. Mucus produced by the cervical glands is discharged from the vagina naturally, especially during the childbearing years. Causes of abnormal vaginal discharge include infectious agents (e.g., Neisseria gonorrhea, Chlamydia trachomatis, Trichomonas, and Candida albicans), the presence of foreign bodies, and cervical or vaginal cancer.
results.glossary_definition: Normal or abnormal secretions from the vagina. Mucus produced by the cervical glands is discharged from the vagina naturally, especially during the childbearing years. Causes of abnormal vaginal discharge include infectious agents (e.g., Neisseria gonorrhea, Chlamydia trachomatis, Trichomonas, and Candida albicans), the presence of foreign bodies, and cervical or vaginal cancer.

results.name: Neuroma
results.definition: A tumor that grows from a nerve or is composed of nerve cells and nerve fibers.
results.glossary_definition: A tumor that arises in nerve cells.

results.name: Uterine Corpus Sarcoma
match: Sarcoma of the Body of Uterus
search: Sarcoma of the Body of Uterus
results.definition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from the wall of the uterine corpus (uterine body). The most representative examples are leiomyosarcoma and endometrial stromal sarcoma.
results.glossary_definition: A rare type of uterine cancer that forms in muscle or other tissues of the uterus (the small, hollow, pear-shaped organ in a woman's pelvis in which a fetus develops). It usually occurs after menopause. The two main types are leiomyosarcoma (cancer that begins in smooth muscle cells) and endometrial stromal sarcoma (cancer that begins in connective tissue cells).
synonyms: Sarcoma of the Body of Uterus

results.name: Lewy Body Dementia
results.definition: A progressive form of dementia characterized by the presence of protein deposits called Lewy bodies in the midbrain and cerebral cortex, and loss of cholinergic and dopaminergic neurons. The signs and symptoms overlap with Alzheimer and Parkinson disease.

results.name: Nodular Fasciitis
results.definition: A self-limiting, rapidly growing, non-encapsulated benign neoplasm that arises from the soft tissues. It is characterized by the presence of plump spindle-shaped fibroblasts, multinucleated osteoclast-like giant cells, chronic inflammatory infiltrate, red blood cell extravasation, and high mitotic activity.
parents: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Seborrheic Dermatitis
results.definition: A chronic, inflammatory skin disorder that affects the scalp, central face and skin folds; it is characterized by scaling and itching.
results.glossary_definition: A chronic, inflammatory skin disorder that affects the scalp, central face and skin folds; it is characterized by scaling and itching.

results.name: Paranasal Sinus Lymphoma
results.definition: A lymphoma that arises from the paranasal sinus. Representative examples include diffuse large B-cell lymphoma and extranodal NK/T-cell lymphoma, nasal type.
ancestors: Paranasal Sinus and Nasal Cavity Cancer

results.name: Acanthoma
results.definition: A benign skin neoplasm composed of epithelial cells.

results.name: Clostridium difficile Colitis
results.definition: A bacterial infection of the colon secondary to infection with Clostridium difficile bacteria. This infection generally results from the loss of normal gut flora secondary to recent antibiotic use, and manifests as copious watery stools, with associated abdominal pain and myalgia. C. difficile is the most common cause of pseudomembranous colitis, and can progress to toxic megacolon if left untreated.
results.glossary_definition: An infection of the large intestine by the bacterium C. difficile.

results.name: Mature Ganglioneuroma
results.definition: A ganglioneuroma characterized by the presence of mature ganglion cells and a mature Schwannian stroma.

results.name: Malignant Leydig Cell Tumor
results.definition: A Leydig cell tumor characterized by large tumor size, the presence of cytologic atypia, increased mitotic activity, necrosis, and vascular invasion. Approximately 10% of the testicular Leydig cell tumors show malignant characteristics and metastasize. Leydig cell tumors of the ovary follow a benign clinical course.
results.glossary_definition: A malignant neoplasm of the testis originating from interstitial (Leydig) cells.

results.name: Parathyroid Gland Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the parathyroid glands. Representative examples include hyperparathyroidism, hypoparathyroidism, adenoma, and carcinoma.

results.name: Rubinstein-Taybi Syndrome
results.definition: A rare genetic syndrome mapped to chromosome 16p13.3 and associated with mutations in the CREBBP gene. It is characterized by mental and growth retardation, distinctive facial features (prominent nose, low-set ears, microcephaly, and small mouth), and broad thumbs and great toes. Patients are at an increased risk of developing benign and malignant neoplasms, including nervous system neoplasms and malignant lymphoproliferative disorders.

results.name: Epithelioid Hemangioma
results.definition: A hemangioma characterized by the presence of epithelioid endothelial cells.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Adult Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
results.name_text: Adult Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
match: Adult Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
Adult Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
Adult Sarcoma Botryoides of the Vagina
search: Adult Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
Adult Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
Adult Sarcoma Botryoides of the Vagina
results.definition: A morphologic variant of embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma arising from the vagina. It is characterized by the formation of a cambium layer in the affected tissue and polypoid nodules with an abundant myxoid stroma. It occurs in female adults.
synonyms: Adult Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
Adult Sarcoma Botryoides of the Vagina
parents: Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina
ancestors: Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vagina

results.name: Gender Identity Disorder
results.definition: A disorder characterized by a strong and persistent cross-gender identification (such as stating a desire to be the other sex or frequently passing as the other sex) coupled with persistent discomfort with his or her sex (manifested in adults, for example, as a preoccupation with altering primary and secondary sex characteristics through hormonal manipulation or surgery).

results.name: Spastic Quadriplegia
results.definition: A type of spastic cerebral palsy characterized by increased muscle tone of all four extremities.
results.glossary_definition: A type of spastic cerebral palsy characterized by increased muscle tone of all four extremities.

results.name: Double Outlet Right Ventricle
results.definition: A rare congenital cardiovascular abnormality in which both the aorta and the pulmonary artery arise from the right ventricle.

results.name: Congenital Infundibular Stenosis
results.definition: The obstruction of the right ventricular outflow tract that originates within the body of the right ventricle, that exists at the time of birth; it often occurs in association with other intracardiac anomalies.
results.glossary_definition: Stenosis of the conus arteriosus (infundibulum) with or without involvement of the pulmonary valve. It is usually associated with a defect in the interventricular septum.

results.name: Melorheostosis
results.definition: A very rare bone disorder characterized by thickening of the cortex in a linear pattern. Signs and symptoms include joint pain, joint swelling, limb deformity, and changes in the skin covering the bone lesion.

results.name: Oculopharyngeal Muscular Dystrophy
results.definition: An autosomal dominant disorder caused by mutations in the PABPN1 gene, encoding polyadenylate-binding protein 2. The condition is characterized by progressive ptosis, dysphagia and weakness of the muscles of the face, neck, and extraocular muscles.

results.name: Fallopian Tube Germ Cell Tumor
results.definition: A rare germ cell tumor that affects the fallopian tube. The vast majority of cases are teratomas.

results.name: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Microcystic Adenoma
results.definition: An adenoma that arises from the intrahepatic bile ducts and it is characterized by the presence of microcystic changes.

results.name: Gastric Adenosquamous Carcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the stomach and is characterized by the presence of malignant cells with glandular and squamous differentiation.

results.name: Aicardi Syndrome
results.definition: A sporadic genetic syndrome characterized by agenesis of the corpus callosum, infantile spasms, and chorioretinal lacunae. It is associated with the presence of choroid plexus neoplasms in the brain.

results.name: Tonsillitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the tonsillar tissue.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the tonsillar tissue.

results.name: Pilomatricoma
results.definition: A benign adnexal neoplasm arising from hair-bearing skin surfaces, usually the head and neck and upper extremities. It usually presents as a solitary, slow-growing nodular mass. Morphologically, it displays differentiation towards the matrix and inner sheath of the normal hair follicle and the hair cortex. Complete surgical excision is usually curative. Occasionally, it may recur.
results.glossary_definition: A tumor composed of cells resembling those of the hair matrix, which undergo 'mummification' and may calcify. It is a relatively uncommon tumor, which may occur at any age from infancy. The majority of patients are under 20, and females are affected more than males. The lesion is usually a solitary deep dermal or subcutaneous tumor 3-30 mm in diameter, situated in the head, neck, or upper extremity. (From Rook et al., Textbook of Dermatology, 4th ed, p2401)

results.name: Splenic Manifestation of Hairy Cell Leukemia
results.name_text: Splenic Manifestation of Hairy Cell Leukemia
match: Splenic Manifestation of Hairy Cell Leukemia
Splenic Manifestation of Hairy Cell Leukemia
search: Splenic Manifestation of Hairy Cell Leukemia
Splenic Manifestation of Hairy Cell Leukemia
synonyms: Splenic Manifestation of Hairy Cell Leukemia

results.name: Cardiac Tamponade
results.definition: Acute compression of the heart caused by increased intrapericardial pressure due to the collection of blood or fluid in the pericardium from rupture of the heart, penetrating trauma, or progressive effusion.
results.glossary_definition: Compression of the heart caused by increased intrapericardial pressure due to the collection of blood or fluid in the pericardial space. Cardiac tamponade should usually be documented by either: Echocardiogram showing pericardial fluid and signs of tamponade such as right heart compromise, or systemic hypotension due to pericardial fluid compromising cardiac function.

results.name: Uterine Polyp
results.definition: A benign protruding lesion arising either from the endometrial cavity (endometrial polyp) or the endocervix (endocervical polyp). It may occasionally recur following complete resection.

results.name: Retrograde Amnesia
results.definition: The loss of access to memories that were previously encoded; this disorder is most commonly preceded by trauma, including physical brain injury, stroke, or seizure, but may also be psychogenic in origin. Memory loss may be temporary or permanent, but the ability to encode new memories or skills is not generally affected.
results.glossary_definition: Loss of the ability to recall information that had been previously encoded in memory prior to a specified or approximate point in time. This process may be organic or psychogenic in origin. Organic forms may be associated with CRANIOCEREBRAL TRAUMA; CEREBROVASCULAR ACCIDENTS; SEIZURES; DEMENTIA; and a wide variety of other conditions that impair cerebral function. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, pp426-9)

results.name: Middle Ear Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the middle ear. Representative examples include adenoma, paraganglioma, and carcinoma.

results.name: Nevus of Ito
results.definition: A large brown, blue, or gray hamartoma of dermal melanocytes, usually on the shoulder and upper arm that is most commonly found in Asian populations and in females. It is sometimes associated with sensory changes in the involved skin area, but very rarely becomes cancerous.

results.name: Brain Glioblastoma
match: Grade IV Astrocytic Neoplasm of Brain
Grade IV Astrocytic Neoplasm of the Brain
Grade IV Astrocytic Tumor of Brain
Grade IV Astrocytic Tumor of the Brain
search: Grade IV Astrocytic Neoplasm of Brain
Grade IV Astrocytic Neoplasm of the Brain
Grade IV Astrocytic Tumor of Brain
Grade IV Astrocytic Tumor of the Brain
results.definition: A WHO grade IV malignant astrocytic tumor that arises from the brain, usually the cerebral hemispheres. It is characterized by the presence of poorly differentiated astrocytes, cellular polymorphism, nuclear atypia, and increased mitotic activity. The prognosis is poor.
synonyms: Grade IV Astrocytic Neoplasm of Brain
Grade IV Astrocytic Neoplasm of the Brain
Grade IV Astrocytic Tumor of Brain
Grade IV Astrocytic Tumor of the Brain
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Autism Spectrum Disorder
results.definition: A spectrum of developmental disorders that includes autism, Asperger syndrome, and Rett syndrome. Signs and symptoms include poor communication skills, defective social interactions, and repetitive behaviors.
results.glossary_definition: Neurodevelopmental disorders presenting in childhood with classic symptoms of impairment in verbal and nonverbal communication, social interactions, and/or imaginative play.

results.name: Malignant Struma Ovarii
results.definition: An ovarian mature teratoma characterized by the presence of aberrant thyroid tissue with morphologic changes identical to thyroid carcinoma. Patients may present with abdominal mass and unusual symptoms due to thyrotoxicosis, or with Meigs syndrome (ascites and pleural effusion).
ancestors: Ovarian Monodermal and Highly Specialized Teratoma

results.name: Transient Hypogammaglobulinemia of Infancy
results.definition: A rare, primary humoral immunodeficiency of childhood characterized by decreasing serum levels of immunoglobulin G (IgG) as maternal antibodies clear the circulation while serum levels of immunoglobulin A and immunoglobulin M remain normal or are slightly decreased. Diagnosis may be suspected after the age of six months when a child's own synthesis of IgG should accelerate but it must be confirmed retrospectively after normalization of all serum immunoglobulin levels is seen by ages 2-6. This disorder may be caused by inadequate activation of progenitor B cells, defective class-switching or may even represent a maturational variant. Typically, a normal response to protein antigens is found while there is a notably diminished response to viral and bacterial polysaccharide antigens. Clinical presentation may include recurrent infections especially those of the respiratory tract. Despite increased susceptibility to infection in childhood, this disorder is self-limited with minimal implications for a normal life span.
results.glossary_definition: Transitory decrease in the concentration of IgG below established reference ranges, in an infant or child less than 6 months of age. IgA and IgM concentrations may be decreased as well.

results.name: Serous Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma that is characterized by the presence of papillary patterns and cellular budding. Psammoma bodies may be present. Representative examples include cervical serous adenocarcinoma, endometrial serous adenocarcinoma, ovarian serous adenocarcinoma, and primary peritoneal serous adenocarcinoma.

results.name: Clear Cell Adenoma
results.definition: A benign neoplasm composed of glands containing epithelial clear cells.
results.glossary_definition: A benign neoplasm comprising glands containing epithelial clear cells.

results.name: Orbit Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma
results.definition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm that arises from the orbit. It is characterized by the presence of skeletal muscle tissue exhibiting embryonic features.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Bladder Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the urinary bladder. A representative example of non-neoplastic bladder disorder is bacterial bladder infection. A representative example of neoplastic bladder disorder is bladder carcinoma.

results.name: Sinusitis
results.definition: An acute or chronic inflammatory process affecting the mucous membranes of any sinus cavity.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the mucous membranes lining a sinus cavity.

results.name: Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia
match: Telangiectasia, Hereditary Hemorrahagic, of Rendu, Osler
search: Telangiectasia, Hereditary Hemorrahagic, of Rendu, Osler
results.definition: An autosomal dominant hereditary disorder caused by mutations in the ACVRL1, ENG, and SMAD4 genes. It is characterized by the presence of telangiectasias in the skin, mucous membranes, lungs, brain, liver, and gastrointestinal tract. It results in hemorrhages from the affected areas.
results.glossary_definition: An autosomal dominant vascular anomaly characterized by the presence of multiple small telangiectases of the skin, mucous membranes, gastrointestinal tract, and other organs, associated with recurrent episodes of bleeding from affected sites and gross or occult melena. (Dorland, 27th ed)
synonyms: Telangiectasia, Hereditary Hemorrahagic, of Rendu, Osler

results.name: Proctitis
results.definition: An inflammatory process affecting the anus. It is usually caused by sexually transmitted infectious agents and/or inflammatory bowel disease.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the mucous membrane that lines the rectum (the last several inches of the large intestine closest to the anus).

results.name: Corneal Melanoma
results.definition: A melanoma within the cornea of the eye.

results.name: Orbit Lymphoma
results.definition: A lymphoma that arises from the structures of the orbit. Representative examples include mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue lymphoma, follicular lymphoma, and diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Cleft Palate
results.definition: A congenital abnormality consisting of a fissure in the midline of the hard and/or soft palate; it is the result of the failure of the two sides of the palate to fuse during embryonic development.

results.name: Ethmoid Sinus Primary Ectopic Meningioma
match: Primary Ectopic Meningioma of Ethmoid Sinus
Primary Ectopic Meningioma of Ethmoidal Sinus
Primary Ectopic Meningioma of the Ethmoid Sinus
Primary Ectopic Meningioma of the Ethmoidal Sinus
search: Primary Ectopic Meningioma of Ethmoid Sinus
Primary Ectopic Meningioma of Ethmoidal Sinus
Primary Ectopic Meningioma of the Ethmoid Sinus
Primary Ectopic Meningioma of the Ethmoidal Sinus
results.definition: An extremely rare meningioma that arises as a primary ectopic tumor in the ethmoid sinus.
synonyms: Primary Ectopic Meningioma of Ethmoid Sinus
Primary Ectopic Meningioma of Ethmoidal Sinus
Primary Ectopic Meningioma of the Ethmoid Sinus
Primary Ectopic Meningioma of the Ethmoidal Sinus

results.name: Adult Pineal Parenchymal Cell Neoplasm
match: Parenchymal Neoplasm of Adult Pineal Gland
Parenchymal Neoplasm of the Adult Pineal Gland
Parenchymal Tumor of Adult Pineal Gland
Parenchymal Tumor of the Adult Pineal Gland
search: Parenchymal Neoplasm of Adult Pineal Gland
Parenchymal Neoplasm of the Adult Pineal Gland
Parenchymal Tumor of Adult Pineal Gland
Parenchymal Tumor of the Adult Pineal Gland
results.definition: A pineal parenchymal cell neoplasm (pineocytoma or pineoblastoma) occurring in adults.
synonyms: Parenchymal Neoplasm of Adult Pineal Gland
Parenchymal Neoplasm of the Adult Pineal Gland
Parenchymal Tumor of Adult Pineal Gland
Parenchymal Tumor of the Adult Pineal Gland
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Ethmoidal Sinusitis
results.definition: An acute or chronic inflammatory process affecting the mucous membrane of the ethmoid sinus.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the ethmoid sinus. It may present itself as an acute (associated with viral rhinitis) or chronic (associated with allergic or hyperplastic sinusitis) condition.

results.name: Pancreatic Gastrinoma
results.definition: A neuroendocrine tumor arising from the pancreas. It is characterized by inappropriate secretion of gastrin and associated with Zollinger Ellison syndrome. The latter is characterized by the presence of peptic ulcer, gastroesophageal reflux disease, abdominal pain, diarrhea, and malabsorption.

results.name: Interdigitating Dendritic Cell Sarcoma
results.definition: A neoplastic proliferation of spindle to ovoid cells which show phenotypic features similar to those of interdigitating dendritic cells. The clinical course is generally aggressive. (WHO, 2008)

results.name: Ureter Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the ureter.
results.glossary_definition: Cancer or tumors of the URETER. Hematuria, which occurs in 75% of patients with ureteral carcinoma, is the most common presenting symptom. The most common site for the occurrence of a ureteral tumor is in the lower third of the URETER, with a lesser incidence higher up.

results.name: Tracheal Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the trachea. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include congenital malformations and infection. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include carcinoma and lymphoma.

results.name: Syringomyelia
results.definition: A rare disorder characterized by the formation of a cyst in the spinal cord. It results in weakness, pain, and stiffness in the shoulders, arms, legs, or back. It may be associated with Chiari malformation. Other causes include spinal cord injury, inflammation, or tumor.

results.name: Breast Cyst
results.definition: A cystic lesion located in breast tissue.

results.name: Malignant Kidney Mixed Epithelial and Stromal Tumor
results.name_text: Malignant Kidney Mixed Epithelial and Stromal Tumor
match: Malignant Kidney Mixed Epithelial and Stromal Tumor
Malignant Mixed Epithelial Stromal Tumor of the Kidney
search: Malignant Kidney Mixed Epithelial and Stromal Tumor
Malignant Mixed Epithelial Stromal Tumor of the Kidney
results.definition: A mixed epithelial stromal tumor of the kidney with malignant stromal features.
synonyms: Malignant Mixed Epithelial Stromal Tumor of the Kidney

results.name: Supraglottic Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the supraglottic area of the larynx.

results.name: Primary Hypertrophic Osteoarthropathy
results.definition: A rare disorder of unknown etiology characterized by hypertrophy of the bones of the distal extremities, periostosis of the tubular bones, digital clubbing, and skin changes including coarse facial features, acne, and hyperhydrosis.

results.name: Colorectal Leiomyoma
results.definition: A well-circumscribed benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising from the colorectal area. It is characterized by the presence of spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, interlacing fascicles, and a whorled pattern.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Retroperitoneal Germ Cell Tumor
match: Germ Cell Neoplasm of the Retroperitoneum
Germ Cell Tumor of the Retroperitoneum
search: Germ Cell Neoplasm of the Retroperitoneum
Germ Cell Tumor of the Retroperitoneum
synonyms: Germ Cell Neoplasm of the Retroperitoneum
Germ Cell Tumor of the Retroperitoneum

results.name: Rectal Neuroendocrine Neoplasm
results.definition: A neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the rectum. It includes well differentiated neuroendocrine tumors (low and intermediate grade) and poorly differentiated neuroendocrine carcinomas (high grade).

results.name: Bronchopneumonia
results.definition: Acute inflammation of the walls of the terminal bronchioles that spreads into the peribronchial alveoli and alveolar ducts. It results in the creation of foci of consolidation, which are surrounded by normal parenchyma. It affects one or more lobes, and is frequently bilateral and basal. It is usually caused by bacteria (e.g., Staphylococcus, Streptococcus, Haemophilus influenzae). Signs and symptoms include fever, cough with production of brown-red sputum, dyspnea, and chest pain.
results.glossary_definition: Acute inflammation of the walls of the smaller bronchial tubes, with varying amounts of pulmonary consolidation due to spread of the inflammation into peribronchiolar alveoli and the alveolar ducts. (Stedman, 25th ed)

results.name: Stevens-Johnson Syndrome
results.definition: A systemic, serious, and life-threatening disorder characterized by lesions in the skin and mucous membranes that may lead to necrosis. The lesions may appear anywhere in the body but they occur more commonly in the palms, soles, dorsum of the hands, and extensor surfaces. The lesions are vesicular or necrotic in the center, surrounded by an erythematous zone and occupy less than 10% of the body surfaces. The appearance of the mucocutaneous lesions is preceded by an upper respiratory tract infection. It is an immune complex hypersensitivity reaction usually caused by drugs (e.g., sulfa, phenytoin, penicillin), viruses (e.g., herpes simplex, influenza, hepatitis), and malignancies (e.g., carcinoma and lymphoma).
results.glossary_definition: Drug or microbial induced exanthem characterized by papular or target-like lesions that involve less than 30% of the skin surface and at least two mucous membranes associated with systemic symptoms and may result in variable areas of skin necrosis.

results.name: Panniculitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the subcutaneous adipose tissue.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the subcutaneous adipose tissue.

results.name: Necrotizing Enterocolitis
match: Necrotizing Enterocolitis in Fetus or Newborn
search: Necrotizing Enterocolitis in Fetus or Newborn
results.definition: A fulminating disease of neonates in which there is extensive mucosal ulceration, pseudomembrane formation, submucosal hemorrhage, and necrosis usually of the right colon, cecum, terminal ileum, and appendix, possibly due to perinatal intestinal ischemia and bacterial invasion. Progression can lead to necrosis, perforation and/or scarring of the intestinal tract.
results.glossary_definition: A disease of neonates in which there is extensive mucosal ulceration, pseudomembrane formation, submucosal hemorrhage, and necrosis.
synonyms: Necrotizing Enterocolitis in Fetus or Newborn

results.name: Pancreatic Acinar Cell Carcinoma
match: Acinar Cell Carcinoma of the Pancreas
Acinar Cell Adenocarcinoma of the Pancreas
Acinar Cell Carcinoma of the Pancreas
search: Acinar Cell Carcinoma of the Pancreas
Acinar Cell Adenocarcinoma of the Pancreas
Acinar Cell Carcinoma of the Pancreas
results.oncotree_disease: Acinar Cell Carcinoma of the Pancreas
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the pancreas. It is characterized by the presence of relatively uniform malignant cells which form acinar patterns. It usually occurs during adulthood. Signs and symptoms include abdominal pain, weight loss, nausea, and diarrhea. It may metastasize to regional lymph nodes and the liver. A minority of patients develop lipase hypersecretion syndrome. This syndrome may be seen in patients with liver metastases and it is characterized by excessive secretion of lipase in the serum, polyarthralgia, and subcutaneous fat necrosis.
synonyms: Acinar Cell Adenocarcinoma of the Pancreas
Acinar Cell Carcinoma of the Pancreas

results.name: Extrahepatic Bile Duct Leiomyosarcoma
match: Leiomyosarcoma of the Extrahepatic Bile Duct
search: Leiomyosarcoma of the Extrahepatic Bile Duct
results.definition: An aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, arising from an extrahepatic bile duct. It is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic spindle cells.
synonyms: Leiomyosarcoma of the Extrahepatic Bile Duct

results.name: Reflex Epilepsy
results.definition: Epilepsy triggered by an external stimulus or an internal mental process. Photosensitive epilepsy is the most common form of reflex epilepsy.
parents: Variable Age At Onset Electroclinical Syndrome
ancestors: Variable Age At Onset Electroclinical Syndrome

results.name: Salivary Gland Carcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the major or minor salivary glands. Representative examples include carcinoma ex pleomorphic adenoma, adenocarcinoma, adenoid cystic carcinoma, and mucoepidermoid carcinoma.
children: Salivary Gland Carcinoma ex Pleomorphic Adenoma

results.name: Infectious Rhinitis
results.definition: An inflammatory process affecting the nasal mucosa, usually caused by viruses (e.g., rhinovirus, adenovirus, parainfluenza virus, and coronavirus). It is characterized by chills, headaches, mucopurulent nasal discharge, coughing, and facial pain.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the mucous membrane lining the nose due to infection.

results.name: Pilar Sheath Acanthoma
results.definition: A benign, small, papular or nodular skin neoplasm that usually arises above the upper lip. It is characterized by an epithelial proliferation with a central cavity. The cavity wall is lined with keratinocytes.

results.name: Gastric Leiomyoma
results.definition: A rare benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising from the wall of the stomach. It is characterized by the presence of spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, interlacing fascicles, and a whorled pattern. Unlike gastrointestinal stromal tumors, gastric leiomyomas are by definition negative for CD34 and CD117 (C-KIT).
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Subendocardial Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
results.name_text: Subendocardial Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
match: Subendocardial Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Subendocardial Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Subendocardial Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding
search: Subendocardial Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Subendocardial Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Subendocardial Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding
results.definition: An electrocardiographic finding of an injury in leads corresponding to the anatomic region of the subendocardial layer of the wall of the heart.
synonyms: Subendocardial Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Subendocardial Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding

results.name: Crigler-Najjar Syndrome
results.definition: A rare autosomal recessive inherited syndrome characterized by abnormalities in the metabolism of bilirubin. It results in the development of jaundice. It may cause brain damage in infancy.

results.name: Lung Lymphangioleiomyomatosis
results.definition: Lymphangiomyomatosis involving the lungs and local lymph nodes. Patients usually present with chylous pleural effusion. The clinical course is variable. Patients with resectable lesions usually have a favorable clinical outcome. Patients with diffuse lesions usually have a progressive clinical course.

results.name: Placental Abruption
match: Abruptio Placentae, Premature Separation of Placenta
search: Abruptio Placentae, Premature Separation of Placenta
results.definition: Placental separation from the uterus with bleeding (concealed or vaginal) before fetal birth, with or without maternal/fetal compromise. (reVITALize)
results.glossary_definition: Premature separation of the normally implanted placenta.
synonyms: Abruptio Placentae, Premature Separation of Placenta

results.name: Dry Eye Syndrome
results.definition: A syndrome characterized by dryness of the cornea and conjunctiva. It is usually caused by a deficiency in tear production. Symptoms include a feeling of burning eyes and a possible foreign body presence in the eye.
results.glossary_definition: Corneal and conjunctival dryness due to deficient tear production, predominantly in menopausal and post-menopausal women. Filamentary keratitis or erosion of the conjunctival and corneal epithelium may be caused by these disorders. Sensation of the presence of a foreign body in the eye and burning of the eyes may occur.

results.name: Retinal Tear
results.definition: A usually small tearing of the retina occurring when the vitreous separates from the retina. It may lead to retinal detachment. Symptoms include flashes and floaters.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by a small laceration of the retina, this occurs when the vitreous separates from the retina. Symptoms include flashes and floaters.

results.name: Malignant Skeletal Muscle Neoplasm
match: Malignant Neoplasm of the Skeletal Muscle
Malignant Tumor of the Skeletal Muscle
search: Malignant Neoplasm of the Skeletal Muscle
Malignant Tumor of the Skeletal Muscle
results.definition: A malignant neoplasm arising from skeletal muscle.
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of the Skeletal Muscle
Malignant Tumor of the Skeletal Muscle

results.name: Jejunal Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the wall of the jejunum. Representative examples include adenoma, carcinoma, and lymphoma.

results.name: Rapidly Progressive Glomerulonephritis
results.definition: Inflammation of the glomeruli that is characterized by a rapid loss in renal function with glomerular crescent formation observed on biopsy; it is often seen in patients with concomitant autoimmune disease, like Goodpasture's syndrome or systemic lupus erythematosus.

results.name: Granulomatous Dermatitis
results.definition: An inflammatory reaction of the skin to various organic and inorganic antigens. It is characterized by tumor-like masses or nodules of granulomatous tissue comprised of activated histiocytes, epitheliod cells, and multinucleated giant cells.

results.name: Lymphoplasmacytic Lymphoma
results.definition: A clonal neoplasm of small B-lymphocytes, lymphoplasmacytoid cells, and plasma cells involving the bone marrow, lymph nodes, and the spleen. The majority of patients have a serum IgM paraprotein.
results.glossary_definition: A malignant neoplasm composed of lymphocytes (B-cells), lymphoplasmacytoid cells, and plasma cells.

results.name: Hypokalemia
results.definition: Lower than normal levels of potassium in the circulating blood.
results.glossary_definition: Abnormally low level of potassium in the blood.

results.name: Plasmacytoma
results.definition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of plasma cells that are cytologically and immunophenotypically identical to those of plasma cell myeloma, but manifest a localized osseous or extraosseous growth pattern. (WHO, 2001)
results.glossary_definition: A type of cancer that begins in plasma cells (white blood cells that produce antibodies). A plasmacytoma may turn into multiple myeloma.

results.name: Nelson Syndrome
results.definition: A syndrome that develops following bilateral adrenalectomy for Cushing syndrome. The signs and symptoms result from the presence of an adenocorticotropin-secreting pituitary gland adenoma, and include enlargement of the sella turcica and pressure on the adjacent structures, and skin hyperpigmentation.

results.name: Endometrial Stromal Nodule
results.definition: A non-infiltrating, benign mesenchymal neoplasm arising from the uterine corpus. It is characterized by the presence of neoplastic cells that resemble the cells of the proliferative phase of endometrial stroma and numerous thin-walled small vessels. It usually presents with abnormal uterine bleeding and menorrhagia.

results.name: Anal Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma arising in the anal canal epithelium, including the mucosal surface, the anal glands, and the lining of fistulous tracts. The prognosis is related to the stage at diagnosis.

results.name: Myotonic Dystrophy
results.definition: An inherited progressive disorder affecting the muscles. It is characterized by muscle wasting and hypotonia, cataracts, heart conduction defects and endocrinopathies.

results.name: Uterine Corpus Myxoid Leiomyosarcoma
results.definition: A morphologic variant of leiomyosarcoma arising from the uterus corpus. It is characterized by the presence of cellular pleomorphism, malignant cells with large nuclei, and a myxoid stroma.

results.name: Central Nervous System Lymphoma
results.definition: A non-Hodgkin or Hodgkin lymphoma that arises in the brain or spinal cord as a primary lesion. There is no evidence of lymphoma outside the central nervous system at the time of diagnosis.
results.glossary_definition: Cancer that forms in the lymph tissue of the brain, spinal cord, meninges (outer covering of the brain), or eye (called ocular lymphoma).
children: Primary Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma of the Central Nervous System

results.name: Vulvar Sarcoma
results.definition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm that arises from the vulva. Representative examples include childhood botryoid-type embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma, alveolar soft part sarcoma, and leiomyosarcoma.
children: Childhood Botryoid-Type Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Vulva

results.name: Intraneural Perineurioma
results.definition: A WHO grade I perineurioma that arises within the endoneurium. It is characterized by the formation of pseudo-onion bulbs by the proliferating perineural cells.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Lecithin Acyltransferase Deficiency
results.definition: A disorder of lipoprotein metabolism caused by mutations in the LCAT gene. It is characterized by deficiency of the enzyme lecithin cholesterol acyltransferase. It is manifested with corneal opacity, hemolytic anemia, and proteinuria.

results.name: Lacrimal Gland Carcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the lacrimal glands. Representative examples include adenocarcinoma, carcinoma ex pleomorphic adenoma, squamous cell carcinoma, adenoid cystic carcinoma, and mucoepidermoid carcinoma.
children: Lacrimal Gland Carcinoma ex Pleomorphic Adenoma

results.name: Cardiac Sarcoidosis
results.definition: Sarcoidosis affecting the tissues of the heart.

results.name: Sphenoid Sinus Inverted Papilloma
match: Inverted Papilloma of the Sphenoid Sinus
search: Inverted Papilloma of the Sphenoid Sinus
results.definition: A benign neoplasm that arises from the ciliated respiratory mucosa that lines the sphenoid sinus. It results from the invagination and proliferation of epithelial cells in the underlying stroma.
synonyms: Inverted Papilloma of the Sphenoid Sinus

results.name: Myotonic Cataract
results.definition: A cataract occurring as a sequela of myotonic dystrophy.

results.name: Colon Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the colon. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include lipoma and leiomyoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma. Colonic adenomas always exhibit epithelial dysplasia and are considered premalignant neoplasms.
results.glossary_definition: tumors or cancer of the colon, which is part of the large intestine from the cecum to the rectum.

results.name: Encapsulated Thymoma
results.definition: A thymoma that is confined within the capsule and may display benign or malignant morphologic characteristics.

results.name: Nasal Cavity Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the nasal cavity. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include Schneiderian papilloma and salivary gland-type adenoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma and lymphoma.

results.name: Plantar Verrucous Skin Carcinoma
match: Plantar Verrucous Carcinoma of the Skin
search: Plantar Verrucous Carcinoma of the Skin
synonyms: Plantar Verrucous Carcinoma of the Skin

results.name: Mongolian Spot
results.definition: A congenital mark on the skin near the base of the spine, consisting of scattered ectopic melanocytes in the dermis, that enlarges for a short time after birth and disappears during childhood.

results.name: Retinal Neuroblastoma
results.definition: A neuroblastoma arising from the retina.

results.name: Ovarian Serous Cystadenofibroma
results.definition: A benign neoplasm of the ovary characterized by the presence of cystic structures lined by serous epithelial cells in a fibrotic stroma.

results.name: Nipple Syringomatous Adenoma
results.definition: An invasive, non-metastasizing neoplasm with sweat duct differentiation that arises in the area of the nipple. Local recurrences have been reported.

results.name: Optic Nerve Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the optic nerve (second cranial nerve).
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by involvement of the optic nerve (second cranial nerve).

results.name: Keratoconjunctivitis
results.definition: Inflammation of both the cornea and the conjunctiva.
results.glossary_definition: Simultaneous inflammation of the cornea and conjunctiva.

results.name: Retinal Disorder
results.definition: An abnormal structure or function of the retina and its associated tissues.

results.name: Metabolic Syndrome
results.definition: A combination of medical conditions that, when present, increase the risk of heart attack, stroke, and diabetes mellitus. It includes the following medical conditions: increased blood pressure, central obesity, abnormal cholesterol levels, and elevated fasting glucose.
results.glossary_definition: A condition is marked by extra fat around the abdomen, high levels of blood glucose (sugar) when not eating, high levels of triglycerides (a type of fat) in the blood, low levels of high-density lipoproteins (a type of protein that carries fats) in the blood, and high blood pressure. People with metabolic syndrome are at increased risk of diabetes mellitus and diseases of the heart and blood vessels.

results.name: Binocular Vision Disorder
results.definition: Any inability to efficiently utilize and/or sustain binocular vision.

results.name: Malignant Hyperthermia Syndrome
results.definition: A rare disorder characterized by rapid rise of the body temperature, accompanied by rhabdomyolysis and, if untreated, by collapse and death. It occurs in susceptible individuals who receive certain drugs for general anesthesia, gas anesthetics, or succinylcholine. It may be inherited in an autosomal dominant pattern.
results.glossary_definition: A rare drug reaction characterized by a rapid rise of the body temperature and rhabdomyolysis.

results.name: Atrial Fibrillation
results.definition: A disorder characterized by an electrocardiographic finding of a supraventricular arrhythmia characterized by the replacement of consistent P waves by rapid oscillations or fibrillatory waves that vary in size, shape and timing and are accompanied by an irregular ventricular response. (CDISC)
results.glossary_definition: An irregular heart rhythm, usually associated with a rapid rate, that is caused by abnormal electrical activity within the atria.

results.name: Subcutaneous Tissue Hemangioma
results.definition: A hemangioma arising from the subcutaneous soft tissues.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Ovarian Small Cell Carcinoma, Pulmonary Type
results.name_text: Ovarian Small Cell Carcinoma, Pulmonary Type
match: Ovarian Small Cell Carcinoma, Pulmonary Type
Ovarian Small Cell Carcinoma, Pulmonary Type
search: Ovarian Small Cell Carcinoma, Pulmonary Type
Ovarian Small Cell Carcinoma, Pulmonary Type
results.definition: An aggressive small cell neuroendocrine carcinoma that arises from the ovary. Morphologically, it resembles the small cell carcinoma that arises from the lung.
synonyms: Ovarian Small Cell Carcinoma, Pulmonary Type

results.name: Occupational Dermatitis
results.definition: Contact dermatitis associated with allergens or irritants found in the workplace.
results.glossary_definition: A recurrent contact dermatitis caused by substances found in the work place.

results.name: Testicular Choriocarcinoma
results.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor arising from the testis. It represents the rarest of the testicular germ cell tumors. Histologically it is characterized by the presence of syncytiotrophoblasts and cytotrophoblasts.
parents: Malignant Testicular Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor
ancestors: Malignant Testicular Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor

results.name: Laryngeal Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the larynx. Representative examples include laryngitis, vocal cord polyp, squamous papilloma, and carcinoma.
results.glossary_definition: Disorders of the larynx, general or unspecified.

results.name: Scrotal Hemangioma
results.definition: A hemangioma arising from the skin of the scrotum.

results.name: Diffuse Pulmonary Fibrosis
results.definition: Diffuse replacement of the lung tissue by connective tissue.

results.name: Myocardial Infarction
results.definition: Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as in coronary thrombosis.
results.glossary_definition: Necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area.
children: Anterolateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Anteroseptal Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Apical Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Inferior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Inferolateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Lateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Posterior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Posteroinferior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Posterolateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Septal Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Subendocardial Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding

results.name: Adrenoleukodystrophy
results.definition: A rare metabolic disorder characterized by damage of the myelin sheaths in the nervous system and degeneration of the adrenal glands. It leads to progressive neurologic disorders, adrenal insufficiency and death.

results.name: Lipoatrophic Diabetes Mellitus
results.definition: A rare syndrome characterized by almost complete absence of body fat, accentuated muscularity, insulin-resistant diabetes, hyperlipidemia, hepatomegaly, and hypermetabolism.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by complete absence of subcutaneous adipose tissue, insulin-resistant diabetes with little tendency to ketoacidosis, hyperlipidemia with subcutaneous xanthomatosis, hepatomegaly, and an elevated basal metabolic rate.

results.name: Thymic Basaloid Carcinoma
results.definition: A rare primary thymic carcinoma, characterized by the presence of tumor cell lobules with peripheral palisading, and a basophilic staining pattern. More than half of reported cases were associated with the presence of a multilocular thymic cyst. Metastases to lung and liver have been reported in approximately 30% of cases.

results.name: LEOPARD Syndrome
results.definition: A genetic syndrome caused by mutations in the PTPN11 and RAF1 genes. It is characterized by the following abnormalities: multiple lentigines, electrocardiographic conduction abnormalities, ocular hypertelorism, pulmonary stenosis, abnormalities in genitalia, growth retardation, and deafness.

results.name: Brucellosis
results.definition: A gram negative bacterial infection caused by bacteria of the genus Brucella. Humans are infected by ingesting unpasteurized milk or meat from infected animals. Signs and symptoms include fevers, sweating, weakness, headache, muscle pain, arthritis and anemia.

results.name: Pulmonary Fibrosis
results.definition: Chronic progressive interstitial lung disorder characterized by the replacement of the lung tissue by connective tissue, leading to progressive dyspnea, respiratory failure, or right heart failure. Causes include chronic inflammatory processes, exposure to environmental irritants, radiation therapy, autoimmune disorders, certain drugs, or it may be idiopathic (no identifiable cause).
results.glossary_definition: Chronic inflammation and progressive fibrosis of the pulmonary alveolar walls, with steadily progressive dyspnea, resulting finally in death from oxygen lack or right heart failure.

results.name: Rectal Kaposi Sarcoma
results.definition: A Kaposi sarcoma arising from the rectum.

results.name: Childhood Choroid Plexus Neoplasm
results.definition: A neoplasm that arises from the choroid plexus in the brain and occurs during childhood.

results.name: Pars Planitis
results.definition: An inflammatory disorder of the cilliary body in the uvea that affects healthy, younger individuals who are often asymptomatic. It has a long clinical course with relapses and remissions. Symptoms include mildly decreased vision and floaters. It may be associated with autoimmune disorders.
results.glossary_definition: Form of granulomatous uveitis occurring in the region of the pars plana. This disorder is a common condition with no detectable focal pathology. It causes fibrovascular proliferation at the inferior ora serrata.

results.name: Testicular Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the testis. Representative examples include fibroma, thecoma, benign Sertoli cell tumor, seminoma, embryonal carcinoma, sarcoma, leukemia, and lymphoma.
results.glossary_definition: Tumors or cancer of the TESTIS. Germ cell tumors (GERMINOMA) of the testis constitute 95% of all testicular neoplasms.

results.name: Acquired Hemangioma
results.definition: A hemangioma that is not present at birth but develops later in life.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Renal Pelvis Papillary Urothelial Neoplasm
match: Papillary Neoplasm of the Renal Pelvis
Papillary Tumor of the Renal Pelvis
search: Papillary Neoplasm of the Renal Pelvis
Papillary Tumor of the Renal Pelvis
results.definition: A papillary tumor originating in the renal pelvis.
synonyms: Papillary Neoplasm of the Renal Pelvis
Papillary Tumor of the Renal Pelvis

results.name: Colloid Carcinoma of the Pancreas
results.definition: An infiltrating pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, characterized by the presence of malignant cells floating in pools of mucin. It has a more favorable prognosis than the conventional infiltrating ductal adenocarcinoma. It often arises in association with intraductal pancreatic mucinous neoplasms and in some cases it may result in the development of pseudomyxoma peritonei.

results.name: Keratitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the cornea.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the cornea.

results.name: Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis
results.definition: A neoplastic proliferation of Langerhans cells which contain Birbeck granules by ultrastructural examination. Three major overlapping syndromes are recognized: eosinophilic granuloma, Letterer-Siwe disease, and Hand-Schuller-Christian disease. The clinical course is generally related to the number of organs affected at presentation. (WHO, 2001)
results.glossary_definition: A group of rare disorders in which too many Langerhans cells (a type of white blood cell) grow in certain tissues and organs including the bones, skin, and lungs, and damage them. Langerhans cell histiocytosis may also affect the pituitary gland (which makes hormones that control other glands and many body functions, especially growth). Langerhans cell histiocytosis is most common in children and young adults.

results.name: Hepatic Encephalopathy
results.definition: A constellation of signs and symptoms characterized by changes in personality, consciousness, and reflexes, resulting from neuropsychiatric abnormalities secondary to liver failure without evidence of other brain disease.

results.name: Anal Canal Squamous Cell Carcinoma
results.definition: A squamous cell carcinoma arising from the mucosa of the anal canal.

results.name: Internal Auditory Canal Meningioma
match: Meningioma of the Internal Auditory Canal
search: Meningioma of the Internal Auditory Canal
results.definition: A meningioma that affects the internal auditory canal.
synonyms: Meningioma of the Internal Auditory Canal

results.name: Osteoblastoma
results.definition: A rare benign bone-forming neoplasm usually arising from the spine. It is a well-circumscribed lytic tumor that varies in size. The tumor is composed of woven bone trabeculae and shares similar histologic characteristics with the osteoid osteoma. Surgical curettage is the treatment of choice. The prognosis is excellent.
results.glossary_definition: A benign neoplasm of bone, characterized by the formation of osteoid tissue and large osteoblast-like cells.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Myxoid Liposarcoma
results.definition: A liposarcoma characterized by the presence of round non-lipogenic primitive mesenchymal cells and small signet ring lipoblasts within a myxoid stoma with a branching vascular pattern. This category includes hypercellular lesions with round cell morphology, formerly known as round cell liposarcoma.

results.name: Basaloid Squamous Cell Carcinoma
results.definition: A squamous cell carcinoma characterized by the presence of cells with hyperchromatic nuclei, scant amount of cytoplasm, and peripheral nuclear palisading.

results.name: Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
results.definition: A small round cell tumor with neural differentiation arising from the soft tissues or bone.
results.glossary_definition: A type of cancer that forms in bone or soft tissue.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm
children: Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Soft Tissues
Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Bone

results.name: Galactocele
results.definition: Single or multiple, milk-containing nodules in the breast. It is caused by obstruction of the breast ducts during lactation. Needle aspiration of the milk is the treatment of choice.

results.name: Peripheral Retinal Degeneration
results.definition: Degeneration of the peripheral retina.

results.name: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
results.definition: A type of diabetes mellitus that is characterized by insulin resistance or desensitization and increased blood glucose levels. This is a chronic disease that can develop gradually over the life of a patient and can be linked to both environmental factors and heredity.
results.glossary_definition: Diabetes characterized by the ability to survive without ketoacidosis in the absence of insulin therapy. It is usually of slow onset and patients exhibit a tendency to obesity.

results.name: Oligohydramnios
results.definition: A lower than normal quantity of amniotic fluid in the amniotic sac as compared to normal values. Typically associated with an amniotic fluid index (AFI) of less than 5 cm or a single maximum vertical pocket (MVP) of less than 2 cm.
results.glossary_definition: A lower than normal quantity of amniotic fluid in the amniotic sac. Typically associated with an amniotic fluid index (AFI) of less than 5 cm or a single maximum vertical pocket (MVP) of less than 2 cm.

results.name: Gallbladder Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma
match: Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma of Gallbladder
Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma of the Gallbladder
search: Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma of Gallbladder
Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma of the Gallbladder
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the gallbladder. It is characterized by the presence of signet ring malignant epithelial cells.
synonyms: Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma of Gallbladder
Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma of the Gallbladder

results.name: Optic Atrophy
results.definition: A disorder characterized by loss of optic nerve fibers. It may be inherited or acquired. Acquired causes include ischemia, optic nerve neuropathy, glaucoma, trauma, radiation, brain tumors, and multiple sclerosis. It leads to vision disturbances.
results.glossary_definition: Atrophy of the optic disk which may be congenital or acquired. This condition indicates a deficiency in the number of nerve fibers which arise in the RETINA and converge to form the OPTIC DISK, OPTIC NERVE, OPTIC CHIASM, and optic tracts. GLAUCOMA, ISCHEMIA, inflammation, a chronic elevation of intracranial pressure, toxins, optic nerve compression, and inherited conditions (see OPTIC ATROPHIES, HEREDITARY) are relatively common causes of this condition.

results.name: Night Blindness
results.definition: An inability to see clearly in dim light; due to a deficiency of vitamin A or to a retinal disorder.
results.glossary_definition: Poor visual function in dim light.

results.name: Tricuspid Valve Regurgitation
results.definition: The backflow of blood from the right ventricle into the right atrium, owning to imperfect functioning/insufficiency of the tricuspid valve.
results.glossary_definition: The backflow of blood from the right ventricle into the right atrium, owning to imperfect functioning/insufficiency of the tricuspid valve.

results.name: Acute Pancreatitis
results.definition: An acute inflammatory process that leads to necrosis of the pancreatic parenchyma. Signs and symptoms include severe abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fever, and shock. Causes include alcohol consumption, presence of gallstones, trauma, and drugs.

results.name: Extragonadal Germ Cell Tumor
match: Neoplasm of the Extragonadal Germ Cell
Tumor of the Extragonadal Germ Cell
search: Neoplasm of the Extragonadal Germ Cell
Tumor of the Extragonadal Germ Cell
results.definition: A germ cell tumor arising in an anatomic site other than the testis or ovary (e.g., central nervous system, lung, mediastinum, and retroperitoneum).
results.glossary_definition: A rare cancer that develops in germ cells that are found in areas of the body other than the ovary or testicle (such as the brain, chest, abdomen, or tailbone). Germ cells are reproductive cells that develop into sperm in males and eggs in females.
synonyms: Neoplasm of the Extragonadal Germ Cell
Tumor of the Extragonadal Germ Cell
children: Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor

results.name: Herpes Zoster
results.definition: A common dermal and neurologic disorder caused by reactivation of the varicella-zoster virus that has remained dormant within dorsal root ganglia, often for decades, after the patient's initial exposure to the virus in the form of varicella (chickenpox). It is characterized by severe neuralgic pain along the distribution of the affected nerve and crops of clustered vesicles over the area.

results.name: Childhood Malignant Ovarian Germ Cell Tumor
results.name_text: Childhood Malignant Ovarian Germ Cell Tumor
match: Childhood Malignant Ovarian Germ Cell Tumor
search: Childhood Malignant Ovarian Germ Cell Tumor
results.definition: A germ cell tumor that arises from the ovary and occurs in children.

results.name: Lower Clivus Meningioma
results.definition: A meningioma that affects the lower clivus.

results.name: Middle Cranial Fossa Meningioma
match: Meningioma of the Middle Cranial Fossa
search: Meningioma of the Middle Cranial Fossa
results.definition: A meningioma that affects the middle cranial fossa.
synonyms: Meningioma of the Middle Cranial Fossa

results.name: Cri du Chat Syndrome
results.definition: A genetic syndrome resulting from a partial deletion on the short arm of chromosome 5. It is characterized by a cat-like cry in infancy, microcephaly, mental retardation, growth failure, round face, hypertelorism, and cardiac failure.

results.name: Sialadenitis
results.definition: An acute or chronic inflammatory process affecting a salivary gland. Signs and symptoms include pain and tenderness in the affected area.

results.name: Gestational Ovarian Choriocarcinoma
results.definition: A rare malignant trophoblastic tumor that arises from the ovary as a result of ectopic ovarian pregnancy. There is no germ cell component present.

results.name: Pancreatic Somatostatinoma
results.definition: A neuroendocrine tumor arising from the delta cells of the pancreas. It is characterized by inappropriate secretion of somatostatin and associated with diabetes mellitus, hypochlorhydria, gallbladder disease, diarrhea, steatorrhea, anemia, and weight loss.

results.name: Infertility
results.definition: Inability to conceive for at least one year after trying and having unprotected sex. Causes of female infertility include endometriosis, fallopian tubes obstruction, and polycystic ovary syndrome. Causes of male infertility include abnormal sperm production or function, blockage of the epididymis, blockage of the ejaculatory ducts, hypospadias, exposure to pesticides, and health related issues.
results.glossary_definition: The inability to produce children.

results.name: Preeclampsia
results.definition: A systolic blood pressure of 140 mmHg or higher, or a diastolic blood pressure of 90 mmHg or higher on two occasions at least 4 hours apart (or greater than or equal to 160/110 mmHg within a short interval) after 20 weeks of gestation in a woman with previously normal blood pressure. It may present with proteinuria but if not, it may be associated with thrombocytopenia, impaired liver function, progressive renal insufficiency, pulmonary edema, or new-onset cerebral or visual disturbances.
results.glossary_definition: A systolic blood pressure of 140 mmHg or higher, or a diastolic blood pressure of 90 mmHg or higher on two occasions at least 4 hours apart (or greater than or equal to 160/110 mmHg within a short interval) after 20 weeks of gestation in a woman with previously normal blood pressure. It may present with proteinuria but if not, it may be associated with thrombocytopenia, impaired liver function, progressive renal insufficiency, pulmonary edema, or new-onset cerebral or visual disturbances.

results.name: Abducent Nerve Paralysis
results.definition: Paralysis of the abducens nerve.

results.name: Adult Brain Stem Mixed Glioma
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Medullary Breast Carcinoma
match: Infiltrating Medullary Carcinoma of the Breast
Invasive Medullary Carcinoma of the Breast
Medullary Breast Carcinoma with Lymphoid Stroma
search: Infiltrating Medullary Carcinoma of the Breast
Invasive Medullary Carcinoma of the Breast
Medullary Breast Carcinoma with Lymphoid Stroma
results.definition: An infiltrating breast carcinoma with a relatively favorable prognosis. It is an uncommon carcinoma, accounting for less than 1% of all infiltrating breast carcinomas. It is well circumscribed, with soft cut surface and often of considerable size. Microscopically, the predominant growth pattern is syncytial with broad anastomosing bands or sheets of malignant cells. The malignant cells are round with abundant cytoplasm and vesicular nuclei. The sheets of malignant cells are associated with a marked lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate. Glandular or tubular structures are absent.
results.glossary_definition: A rare type of breast cancer that often can be treated successfully. It is marked by lymphocytes (a type of white blood cell) in and around the tumor that can be seen when viewed under a microscope.
synonyms: Infiltrating Medullary Carcinoma of the Breast
Invasive Medullary Carcinoma of the Breast
Medullary Breast Carcinoma with Lymphoid Stroma

results.name: Salivary Gland Stone
results.definition: A concretion in the salivary gland.
results.glossary_definition: Calculi occurring in a salivary gland. Most salivary gland calculi occur in the submandibular gland, but can also occur in the parotid gland and in the sublingual and minor salivary glands.

results.name: Pressure Sore
results.definition: Death of tissue due to external pressure.
results.glossary_definition: Skin damage generally present over a bony prominence that is associated with uninterrupted external pressure.

results.name: Meconium Aspiration Syndrome
results.definition: A serious condition in which a newborn breathes a mixture of meconium (the first intestinal discharge) and amniotic fluid into the lungs around the time of delivery. Meconium aspiration syndrome occurs in 5-10 percent of births and typically occurs when the infant is stressed, as when the infant is past its due date.
results.glossary_definition: Aspiration of meconium around the time of delivery resulting in severe respiratory distress.

results.name: Divergent Strabismus
results.definition: A form of strabismus in which the eyes are deviated laterally.
results.glossary_definition: A form of ocular misalignment where the visual axes diverge inappropriately. For example, medial rectus muscle weakness may produce this condition as the affected eye will deviate laterally upon attempted forward gaze. An exotropia occurs due to the relatively unopposed force exerted on the eye by the lateral rectus muscle, which pulls the eye in an outward direction.

results.name: Chest Wall Solitary Plasmacytoma
match: Solitary Plasmacytoma of the Chest Wall
search: Solitary Plasmacytoma of the Chest Wall
results.definition: A solitary plasmacytoma that arises from the chest wall.
synonyms: Solitary Plasmacytoma of the Chest Wall

results.name: Lymph Node Tuberculosis
results.definition: Tuberculosis of the lymph node.
results.glossary_definition: Infection of the lymph nodes by tuberculosis. Tuberculous infection of the cervical lymph nodes is scrofula.

results.name: Neurogenic Diabetes Insipidus
results.definition: Diabetes insipidus caused by decreased secretion of antidiuretic hormone from the pituitary gland.
results.glossary_definition: Diabetes insipidus caused by decreased secretion of antidiuretic hormone from the pituitary gland.

results.name: Axonal Neuropathy
results.definition: Any nerve disorder affecting the axon of a nerve.

results.name: Periventricular Leukomalacia
results.definition: Necrosis and softening of the white matter around the ventricles in the brain. It is usually seen in preterm infants and caused by lack of blood flow and oxygenation in the periventricular brain parenchyma.
results.glossary_definition: A form of cerebral white matter injury usually seen in preterm infants that is characterized by necrotic degeneration or gliosis of white matter adjacent to the cerebral ventricles, that may evolve into focal cysts.

results.name: Sebaceous Gland Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from the sebaceous glands. Representative examples include sebaceous adenoma and sebaceous carcinoma.

results.name: Klippel-Trenaunay-Weber Syndrome
results.definition: A rare syndrome characterized by the presence of port-wine stain (a vascular malformation), varicose veins, and hypertrophy of the soft tissues and bones in an extremity. It usually affects one extremity, most commonly a leg.

results.name: Tooth and Nail Syndrome
results.definition: A rare genetic disorder with an autosomal dominant pattern of inheritance. It is associated with mutations in the MSX-1 gene on chromosome 4 which alter ectodermal morphogenesis. Characteristic clinical signs include absent or poorly-formed dentition and brittle, spoon-shaped finger and toenails. Clinical course features an increased incidence of dental caries but is essentially benign.

results.name: Immunodeficiency With Hyper-IgM
results.definition: Immunodeficiency caused by mutations in the gene encoding the CD40 ligand. It is characterized by decreased levels of IgG, IgA, and IgE, and normal or increased levels of IgM. Patients are at an increased risk of infections and development of malignancies.

results.name: Metabolic Acidosis
results.definition: Increased acidity in the blood secondary to acid base imbalance. Causes include diabetes, kidney failure and shock.
results.glossary_definition: A condition in which the blood is too acidic. It may be caused by severe illness or sepsis (bacteria in the bloodstream).

results.name: Intracranial Extraskeletal Myxoid Chondrosarcoma
results.definition: An extraskeletal myxoid chondrosarcoma arising from the structures within the cranium.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Squamous Papillomatosis
results.definition: A benign squamous neoplasm characterized by a papillary growth pattern, diffusely involving a specific anatomic site.

results.name: Hypothyroidism
results.definition: Abnormally low levels of thyroid hormone.
results.glossary_definition: Too little thyroid hormone. Symptoms include weight gain, constipation, dry skin, and sensitivity to the cold.

results.name: Eosinophilia
results.definition: Abnormal high level of eosinophils in the blood.
results.glossary_definition: A condition in which the number of eosinophils (a type of white blood cell) in the blood is greatly increased. Eosinophilia is often a response to infection or allergens (substances that cause an allergic response).

results.name: Ovarian Clear Cell Adenofibroma
results.definition: An uncommon benign neoplasm of glandular epithelium characterized by the presence of clear or hobnail cells within a dense fibrous stroma.

results.name: Stage 0 Esophageal Cancer AJCC v6
match: Carcinoma in situ of Esophagus AJCC v6
Carcinoma in situ of the Esophagus AJCC v6
Esophageal Carcinoma in situ AJCC v6
Esophagus Carcinoma in situ AJCC v6
Oesophageal Carcinoma NOS Stage 0 AJCC v6
Stage 0 Carcinoma of Esophagus AJCC v6
Stage 0 Carcinoma of the Esophagus AJCC v6
search: Carcinoma in situ of Esophagus AJCC v6
Carcinoma in situ of the Esophagus AJCC v6
Esophageal Carcinoma in situ AJCC v6
Esophagus Carcinoma in situ AJCC v6
Oesophageal Carcinoma NOS Stage 0 AJCC v6
Stage 0 Carcinoma of Esophagus AJCC v6
Stage 0 Carcinoma of the Esophagus AJCC v6
results.definition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0. Tis: Carcinoma in situ. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th ed.) - 2003
synonyms: Carcinoma in situ of Esophagus AJCC v6
Carcinoma in situ of the Esophagus AJCC v6
Esophageal Carcinoma in situ AJCC v6
Esophagus Carcinoma in situ AJCC v6
Oesophageal Carcinoma NOS Stage 0 AJCC v6
Stage 0 Carcinoma of Esophagus AJCC v6
Stage 0 Carcinoma of the Esophagus AJCC v6

results.name: Adamantinoma
results.definition: A low grade malignant neoplasm arising from the long bones. The tibia is the most frequently affected bone site. Patients present with swelling which may or may not be associated with pain. Morphologically, it is characterized by a biphasic pattern consisting of an epithelial and an osteofibrous component. The vast majority of cases recur if they are not treated with radical surgery. In a minority of cases the tumor may metastasize to other anatomic sites including lymph nodes, lungs, liver, brain, and skeleton.
results.glossary_definition: A low-grade malignant neoplasm composed of epithelial cells and a spindle cell osteo-fibrous proliferation.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Ganglioglioma
results.definition: A well differentiated, slow growing neuroepithelial neoplasm composed of neoplastic, mature ganglion cells and neoplastic glial cells. Some gangliogliomas show anaplastic features in their glial component and are considered to be WHO grade III. Rare cases of newly diagnosed gangliogliomas with grade IV (glioblastoma) changes in the glial component have also been reported. (Adapted from WHO)
results.glossary_definition: Rare indolent tumors comprised of neoplastic glial and neuronal cells which occur primarily in children and young adults. Benign lesions tend to be associated with long survival unless the tumor degenerates into a histologically malignant form. They tend to occur in the optic nerve and white matter of the brain and spinal cord.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Cerebrovascular Disorder
results.definition: A disorder resulting from inadequate blood flow in the vessels that supply the brain. Representative examples include cerebrovascular ischemia, cerebral embolism, and cerebral infarction.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder resulting from inadequate blood flow in the arteries that supply the brain. The diagnostic criteria may include current or previous history of the following: Ischemic stroke, TIA, Noninvasive or invasive arterial imaging test demonstrating greater than or equal to 50% stenosis of any of the major extracranial or intracranial vessels to the brain; Previous cervical or cerebral artery revascularization surgery or percutaneous intervention.

results.name: Short Bowel Syndrome
results.definition: Malabsorption that results from the removal of a large segment of the small intestine or, less frequently, from the complete dysfunction of a large portion of the small intestine. Signs and symptoms include diarrhea, steatorrhea, and weigh loss.
results.glossary_definition: Malabsorption that results from the removal of a large segment of the small intestine or, less frequently, from the complete dysfunction of a large portion of the small intestine. Signs and symptoms include diarrhea, steatorrhea, and weigh loss.

results.name: Ovarian Endometrioid Adenofibroma
results.definition: A benign neoplasm of the ovary characterized by the presence of glandular structures with endometrial-type well-differentiated cells in a fibrotic stroma.

results.name: Thyroid Gland Diffuse Sclerosing Papillary Carcinoma
results.name_text: Thyroid Gland Diffuse Sclerosing Papillary Carcinoma
match: Thyroid Gland Diffuse Sclerosing Papillary Carcinoma
Thyroid Gland Diffuse Sclerosing Papillary Carcinoma
search: Thyroid Gland Diffuse Sclerosing Papillary Carcinoma
Thyroid Gland Diffuse Sclerosing Papillary Carcinoma
results.definition: A morphologic variant of papillary carcinoma of the thyroid gland that more often affects young patients and commonly metastasizing to the lungs. It is characterized by a diffuse infiltration of the thyroid gland by malignant follicular cells, squamous metaplasia, stromal fibrosis, and lymphocytic infiltration.
synonyms: Thyroid Gland Diffuse Sclerosing Papillary Carcinoma

results.name: Clear Cell Squamous Cell Skin Carcinoma
results.name_text: Clear Cell Squamous Cell Skin Carcinoma
match: Clear Cell Squamous Cell Skin Carcinoma
Clear Cell Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Skin
Clear Cell Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Skin
Clear Cell Squamous Cell Skin Carcinoma
search: Clear Cell Squamous Cell Skin Carcinoma
Clear Cell Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Skin
Clear Cell Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Skin
Clear Cell Squamous Cell Skin Carcinoma
results.definition: A squamous cell carcinoma of the skin with a prominent clear cell component.
synonyms: Clear Cell Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Skin
Clear Cell Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Skin
Clear Cell Squamous Cell Skin Carcinoma

results.name: Intraocular Lymphoma
results.definition: A lymphoma that arises within the eye. Signs and symptoms include decreased vision, uveitis, and vitreous floaters.

results.name: Scabies
results.definition: A contagious skin infection that is caused by the burrowing parasitic mite, Sarcoptes scabiei, and is characterized by intense itching and small, raised red spots in the area of the mite burrows.
results.glossary_definition: A contagious cutaneous inflammation caused by the bite of the mite SARCOPTES SCABIEI. It is characterized by pruritic papular eruptions and burrows and affects primarily the axillae, elbows, wrists, and genitalia, although it can spread to cover the entire body.

results.name: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma
match: Infiltrating Transitional Cell Carcinoma of the Urinary Bladder
Invasive Transitional Cell Carcinoma of the Urinary Bladder
search: Infiltrating Transitional Cell Carcinoma of the Urinary Bladder
Invasive Transitional Cell Carcinoma of the Urinary Bladder
results.definition: An invasive transitional cell carcinoma that arises from the urinary bladder urothelium.
synonyms: Infiltrating Transitional Cell Carcinoma of the Urinary Bladder
Invasive Transitional Cell Carcinoma of the Urinary Bladder
children: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma Sarcomatoid Variant
Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Clear Cell Variant
Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Lipid-Cell Variant
Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Lymphoma-Like Variant
Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Microcystic Variant
Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Micropapillary Variant
Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Nested Variant
Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Plasmacytoid Variant

results.name: Histoplasmosis
results.definition: A disease caused by the fungus Histoplasma capsulatum. It primarily affects the lungs but can also occur as a disseminated disease that affects additional organs. The acute respiratory disease has symptoms similar to those of a cold or flu and it usually resolves without treatment in healthy individuals. The disseminated form is generally fatal if untreated.

results.name: Atherosclerotic Cardiovascular Disease
results.definition: Cardiovascular disease resulting from atherosclerosis.

ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm
results.definition: A neuroblastic tumor characterized by the presence of neuroblastic cells, the absence of ganglion cells, and the absence of a prominent Schwannian stroma formation.
results.glossary_definition: Cancer that arises in immature nerve cells and affects mostly infants and children.
results.name: Neuroblastoma
Vitamin B6 Deficiency
results.definition: Deficiency of vitamin B6. It is usually caused by alcoholism, malabsorption, or as a side effect of medications. Signs and symptoms include stomatitis, glossitis, dermatitis, peripheral neuropathy, irritability, seizures, and anemia.

results.name: Mediastinal Neoplasm
