results.name: Portal Vein Thrombosis
results.definition: The formation of a blood clot (thrombus) in the portal vein.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by the formation of a thrombus (blood clot) in the portal vein.

results.name: Leptomeningeal Melanoma
results.definition: A melanoma that arises from leptomeningeal melanocytes.

results.name: Dermatitis
results.definition: An inflammatory process affecting the skin. Signs include red rash, itching, and blister formation. Representative examples are contact dermatitis, atopic dermatitis, and seborrheic dermatitis.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the skin.

results.name: Adenocarcinofibroma
results.definition: A carcinoma arising from the ovary. It is characterized by the presence of malignant epithelial cells in a fibrotic stroma. Histologic variants include clear cell, serous, mucinous, and endometrioid adenocarcinofibroma.

results.name: Junctional Epidermolysis Bullosa
results.definition: Epidermolysis bullosa characterized by separation of the skin through the lamina lucida resulting in blister formation. It includes lethal and non-lethal variants.

results.name: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome
results.definition: An inherited connective tissue disorder characterized by loose and fragile skin and joint hypermobility.
results.glossary_definition: A heterogeneous group of inherited collagen diseases. The most common manifestations of Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome are hyperextensible skin and joints, skin fragility and reduced wound healing capability.

results.name: Grand Mal Epilepsy
results.definition: A generalized tonic-clonic seizure.
results.glossary_definition: A generalized seizure disorder characterized by recurrent major motor seizures. The initial brief tonic phase is marked by trunk flexion followed by diffuse extension of the trunk and extremities. The clonic phase features rhythmic flexor contractions of the trunk and limbs, pupillary dilation, elevations of blood pressure and pulse, urinary incontinence, and tongue biting. This is followed by a profound state of depressed consciousness (post-ictal state) which gradually improves over minutes to hours. The disorder may be cryptogenic, familial, or symptomatic (caused by an identified disease process). (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, p329)

results.name: Thoracic Intraspinal Meningioma
match: Meningioma of Thoracic Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord
Meningioma of the Thoracic Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord
Thoracic Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord Meningioma
search: Meningioma of Thoracic Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord
Meningioma of the Thoracic Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord
Thoracic Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord Meningioma
results.definition: A meningioma that arises from the meninges of the thoracic region of the spinal cord.
synonyms: Meningioma of Thoracic Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord
Meningioma of the Thoracic Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord
Thoracic Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord Meningioma
parents: Spinal Canal And Spinal Cord Meningioma
ancestors: Spinal Canal And Spinal Cord Meningioma

results.name: Holmes-Adie Syndrome
results.definition: A rare syndrome characterized by an abnormally dilated pupil, hypoflexia, and diaphoresis. The syndrome is usually caused by a viral or bacterial infection. The abnormally dilated pupil is caused by damage to postganglionic parasympathetic fibers innervating the eye.
results.glossary_definition: A syndrome characterized by a TONIC PUPIL that occurs in combination with decreased lower extremity reflexes. The affected pupil will respond more briskly to accommodation than to light (light-near dissociation) and is supersensitive to dilute pilocarpine eye drops, which induce pupillary constriction. Pathologic features include degeneration of the ciliary ganglion and postganglionic parasympathetic fibers that innervate the pupillary constrictor muscle. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, p279)

results.name: Portal Hypertension
results.definition: Increased blood pressure in the portal venous system. It is most commonly caused by cirrhosis. Other causes include portal vein thrombosis, Budd-Chiari syndrome, and right heart failure. Complications include ascites, esophageal varices, encephalopathy, and splenomegaly.
results.glossary_definition: High blood pressure in the vein that carries blood to the liver from the stomach, small and large intestines, spleen, pancreas, and gallbladder. It is usually caused by a block in the blood flow through the liver due to cirrhosis (scarring) of the liver.

results.name: Gastric Fundus Carcinoma
match: Cancer of the Fundus of the Stomach
Carcinoma of the Fundus of the Stomach
search: Cancer of the Fundus of the Stomach
Carcinoma of the Fundus of the Stomach
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the fundus of the stomach.
synonyms: Cancer of the Fundus of the Stomach
Carcinoma of the Fundus of the Stomach

results.name: Malignant Duodenal Neoplasm
results.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm that affects the duodenum. Representative examples include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma.

results.name: Ochronosis
results.definition: A disorder characterized by bluish-black discoloration of the cartilaginous tissues due to accumulation of homogentisic acid. It is associated with alkaptonuria. Signs and symptoms include dark urine, skin pigmentation, and arthritis.

results.name: Pure Red Cell Aplasia
results.definition: A disease characterized by normocytic, normochromic anemia, low hematocrit, reticulocytopenia, and selective erythroid hypoplasia.
results.glossary_definition: Suppression of erythropoiesis with little or no abnormality of leukocyte or platelet production.

results.name: Metanephric Adenofibroma
results.definition: A benign, solitary, and partially cystic neoplasm arising from the kidney. It occurs in children and adults. Presenting symptoms include hematuria and polycythemia. It is characterized by the presence of epithelial nodules embedded in a stroma containing spindle cells.

results.name: Gallbladder Lipoma
results.definition: A benign adipose tissue neoplasm involving the gallbladder wall.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Epithelial Synovial Sarcoma
match: Epithelioid Cell Sarcoma of the Synovium
search: Epithelioid Cell Sarcoma of the Synovium
results.definition: A synovial sarcoma characterized by the presence of an epithelial cell component only. The epithelial cells are arranged in glandular or papillary structures.
synonyms: Epithelioid Cell Sarcoma of the Synovium

results.name: Poland Syndrome
results.definition: A rare developmental disorder characterized by underdevelopment or absence of the pectoralis muscle in one side of the chest, usually associated with ipsilateral cutaneous syndactyly, and ipsilateral breast and nipple hypoplasia.

results.name: Prostate Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma
match: Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma of the Prostate
search: Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma of the Prostate
results.definition: An adenoid cystic carcinoma that arises from the prostate gland.
synonyms: Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma of the Prostate

results.name: Juvenile Pilocytic Astrocytoma
results.definition: A pilocytic astrocytoma that occurs during adolescence.
results.glossary_definition: A slow-growing type of central nervous system tumor that forms from glial (supportive) tissue of the brain and spinal cord. Juvenile pilocytic astrocytoma usually occurs in children and young adults. It forms in the brain more often than the spinal cord.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Transient Tic Disorder
results.definition: A neurological disorder presenting in childhood that is characterized by motor and/or phonic tics that occur daily or nearly daily for one to twelve months and are not attributed to an identifiable cause.
results.glossary_definition: A neurological disorder presenting in childhood that is characterized by motor and/or phonic tics that occur daily or nearly daily for one to twelve months and are not attributed to an identifiable cause.

results.name: Caries
results.definition: The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.
results.glossary_definition: Demineralization and breakdown of tooth enamel due to bacterial infection.

results.name: Adrenal Cortex Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant (primary or metastatic) neoplasm affecting the adrenal cortex. (NCI05)
results.glossary_definition: A neoplasm of the adrenal cortex in which the malignancy status has not been established.

results.name: Metastatic Carcinoma in the Adrenal Medulla
results.name_text: Metastatic Carcinoma in the Adrenal Medulla
match: Metastatic Carcinoma in the Adrenal Medulla
Metastatic Carcinoma in the Adrenal Medulla
Metastatic Carcinoma to the Adrenal Medulla
search: Metastatic Carcinoma in the Adrenal Medulla
Metastatic Carcinoma in the Adrenal Medulla
Metastatic Carcinoma to the Adrenal Medulla
results.definition: A carcinoma that has spread to the adrenal medulla from an adjacent or distant anatomic site.
synonyms: Metastatic Carcinoma in the Adrenal Medulla
Metastatic Carcinoma to the Adrenal Medulla

results.name: Mulibrey Nanism
results.definition: An autosomal recessive inherited disorder caused by mutations in the TRIM37 gene. It is characterized by marked growth retardation and abnormalities in multiple organs including heart, liver, muscle, eyes, and brain.

results.name: Leukemia
results.definition: A malignant (clonal) hematologic disorder, involving hematopoietic stem cells and characterized by the presence of primitive or atypical myeloid or lymphoid cells in the bone marrow and the blood. Leukemias are classified as acute or chronic based on the degree of cellular differentiation and the predominant cell type present. Leukemia is usually associated with anemia, fever, hemorrhagic episodes, and splenomegaly. Common leukemias include acute myeloid leukemia, chronic myelogenous leukemia, acute lymphoblastic or precursor lymphoblastic leukemia, and chronic lymphocytic leukemia. Treatment is vital to patient survival; untreated, the natural course of acute leukemias is normally measured in weeks or months, while that of chronic leukemias is more often measured in months or years.
results.glossary_definition: Cancer that starts in blood-forming tissue such as the bone marrow and causes large numbers of blood cells to be produced and enter the bloodstream.
children: Atypical Chronic Myeloid Leukemia, BCR-ABL1 Negative

results.name: Hepatocellular Adenoma
results.definition: A benign epithelial neoplasm arising from the hepatocytes. Grossly, it appears as a soft, round mass which often contains areas of hemorrhage and necrosis. Morphologically, the neoplastic cells resemble normal hepatocytes and form plates separated by sinusoids. Most patients have a history of contraceptive or anabolic steroids use.
results.glossary_definition: A benign epithelial tumor of the liver.
parents: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Epithelial Neoplasm
ancestors: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Epithelial Neoplasm
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Neoplasm

results.name: Central Breast Papilloma
results.definition: A benign papillary neoplasm that arises in a large duct of the breast. It is characterized by the presence of a fibrovascular core that is lined by benign epithelial and myoepithelial proliferations. Patients usually present with nipple discharge.

results.name: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Nested Variant
results.name_text: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Nested Variant
match: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Nested Variant
Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Nested Variant
search: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Nested Variant
Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Nested Variant
synonyms: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Nested Variant

results.name: Beta-Mannosidosis
results.definition: An autosomal recessive lysosomal storage disease characterized by a deficient activity of the enzyme beta-mannosidase. It is caused by mutations in the MANBA gene. Common features of this disorder are mental retardation, developmental delays and recurrent respiratory infections.

results.name: Conventional Lipoma
results.definition: A benign well-circumscribed tumor, composed of lobules of mature adipocytes, that arises within subcutaneous tissue, deep soft tissues or on the surface of bones.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Lung Lymphoma
results.definition: A rare non-Hodgkin or Hodgkin lymphoma that arises in and is confined to the lung at the time of diagnosis.

results.name: Mitral Valve Insufficiency
results.definition: Dysfunction of the mitral valve characterized by incomplete valve closure.

results.name: Osteosclerosis
results.definition: Abnormally high bone density.

results.name: Argininosuccinic Aciduria
results.definition: A genetic inherited disorder caused by mutations in the ASL gene. It is characterized by accumulation of ammonia in the blood. It presents with lethargy in the first few days of life, accompanied by developmental delay and mental retardation.

results.name: X-Linked Ichthyosis
results.definition: The second most common form of ichthyosis. It is an X-linked inherited disorder with mild skin manifestations. The skin changes appear at birth and include keratinization and scaling.

results.name: Malignant Spermatic Cord Neoplasm
match: Malignant Neoplasm of the Spermatic Cord
Malignant Tumor of the Spermatic Cord
search: Malignant Neoplasm of the Spermatic Cord
Malignant Tumor of the Spermatic Cord
results.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm that affects the spermatic cord.
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of the Spermatic Cord
Malignant Tumor of the Spermatic Cord

results.name: Angiomatous Meningioma
results.definition: A WHO grade I meningioma characterized by the presence of small and medium sized vessels that predominate over the meningioma cells.

results.name: Cryoglobulinemia
results.definition: A condition characterized by the presence of cryoglobulins in the blood. Cryoglobulins are abnormal proteins that precipitate within the microvasculature on exposure to cold; microvasculature effects of cryoglobulinemia may result in restricted tissue blood flow, tissue hypoxia, and tissue necrosis. --2004
results.glossary_definition: A condition characterized by the presence of abnormal or abnormal quantities of cryoglobulins in the blood. They are precipitated into the microvasculature on exposure to cold and cause restricted blood flow in exposed areas.

results.name: Rectosigmoid Carcinoma
results.definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm that arises from the rectosigmoid area and invades through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa. The vast majority are adenocarcinomas. About 50% of colorectal carcinomas occur in the rectosigmoid area.

results.name: AV Block Second Degree Mobitz Type II
results.name_text: AV Block Second Degree Mobitz Type II
match: AV Block Second Degree Mobitz Type II
AV Block Second Degree Mobitz Type II
Mobitz Type II Second Degree AV Block
Second Degree Atrioventricular Block Mobitz Type II
Type II Second Degree AV Block
Type II Second Degree Atrioventricular Block
search: AV Block Second Degree Mobitz Type II
AV Block Second Degree Mobitz Type II
Mobitz Type II Second Degree AV Block
Second Degree Atrioventricular Block Mobitz Type II
Type II Second Degree AV Block
Type II Second Degree Atrioventricular Block
results.definition: A disorder characterized by an electrocardiographic finding of intermittent failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction to the ventricles, characterized by a relatively constant PR interval prior to the block of an atrial impulse. (CDISC)
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with relatively constant PR interval prior to the block of an atrial impulse. This is the result of intermittent failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the atrioventricular (AV) node to the ventricles.
synonyms: AV Block Second Degree Mobitz Type II
Mobitz Type II Second Degree AV Block
Second Degree Atrioventricular Block Mobitz Type II
Type II Second Degree AV Block
Type II Second Degree Atrioventricular Block

results.name: Infiltrating Renal Pelvis and Ureter Urothelial Carcinoma
results.name_text: Infiltrating Renal Pelvis and Ureter Urothelial Carcinoma
match: Infiltrating Renal Pelvis and Ureter Urothelial Carcinoma
Infiltrating Renal Pelvis and Ureter Transitional Cell Carcinoma
Infiltrating Renal Pelvis and Ureter Urothelial Carcinoma
search: Infiltrating Renal Pelvis and Ureter Urothelial Carcinoma
Infiltrating Renal Pelvis and Ureter Transitional Cell Carcinoma
Infiltrating Renal Pelvis and Ureter Urothelial Carcinoma
synonyms: Infiltrating Renal Pelvis and Ureter Transitional Cell Carcinoma
Infiltrating Renal Pelvis and Ureter Urothelial Carcinoma
parents: Renal Pelvis and Ureter Urothelial Carcinoma
ancestors: Renal Pelvis and Ureter Urothelial Carcinoma
children: Infiltrating Renal Pelvis Urothelial Carcinoma, Sarcomatoid Variant

results.name: Labia Minora Carcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the labia minora.

results.name: Pelvic Lipomatosis
results.definition: A neoplastic process characterized by a diffuse poorly circumscribed overgrowth of adipose tissue in the pelvic region. Clinical presentation includes complaints of back and abdominal pain, urinary frequency, perineal pain and constipation. It predominately affects black males.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Cushing Syndrome
results.definition: A syndrome caused by high levels of cortisol in the blood either due to excessive production and secretion of corticosteroids secondary to pituitary or adrenocortical neoplasms, or intake of glucocorticoid drugs. Signs and symptoms include a round face, upper body obesity, fragile and thin skin, purple stretch marks in the skin, fatigue, muscle weakness, hypertension, diabetes mellitus, hypertrichosis and amenorrhea in women, impotence in men, and osteoporosis.
results.glossary_definition: A condition in which there is too much cortisol (a hormone made by the outer layer of the adrenal gland) in the body. Cushing syndrome may be caused by taking too many steroid drugs or by certain types of tumors. Tumors that make adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) cause the adrenal gland to make too much cortisol. Symptoms of Cushing syndrome include a round face, thin arms and legs, severe fatigue and muscle weakness, high blood pressure, high blood sugar, purple or pink stretch marks on the skin, and weight gain, especially in the abdomen.

results.name: Blepharospasm
results.definition: Involuntary twitching of the eyelid.
results.glossary_definition: Involuntary twitching of the eyelid and/or eyebrow.

results.name: Gallbladder Papillary Neoplasm with an Associated Invasive Carcinoma
results.name_text: Gallbladder Papillary Neoplasm with an Associated Invasive Carcinoma
match: Gallbladder Papillary Neoplasm with an Associated Invasive Carcinoma
Gallbladder Papillary Neoplasm with an Associated Invasive Carcinoma
Intracystic Papillary Neoplasm with an Associated Invasive Carcinoma
search: Gallbladder Papillary Neoplasm with an Associated Invasive Carcinoma
Gallbladder Papillary Neoplasm with an Associated Invasive Carcinoma
Intracystic Papillary Neoplasm with an Associated Invasive Carcinoma
results.definition: An intraluminal papillary neoplasm, usually with high grade intraepithelial neoplasia, that arises from the gallbladder. It is associated with the presence of an invasive carcinoma. The carcinomatous component is usually an adenocarcinoma.
synonyms: Gallbladder Papillary Neoplasm with an Associated Invasive Carcinoma
Intracystic Papillary Neoplasm with an Associated Invasive Carcinoma

results.name: Kleptomania
results.definition: A disorder characterized by the recurrent failure to resist the impulse to steal items of little intrinsic value; the individual experiences a rising subjective sense of tension before the theft and a sense of gratification or relief during the theft.

results.name: Esophageal Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
match: Oat Cell Carcinoma of the Esophagus
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Esophagus
search: Oat Cell Carcinoma of the Esophagus
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Esophagus
results.definition: An aggressive, high-grade and poorly differentiated carcinoma with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the esophagus. It is characterized by the presence of malignant small cells.
synonyms: Oat Cell Carcinoma of the Esophagus
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Esophagus

results.name: Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia
results.definition: Diaphragmatic hernia that is present at birth.

results.name: Pulmonary Tuberculosis
results.definition: A bacterial infection that affects the lungs and is caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis. Most patients with tuberculosis do not have symptoms (latent tuberculosis) and are not contagious. When signs and symptoms occur (active tuberculosis), patients become contagious. The signs and symptoms include chronic cough with blood-tinged sputum, night sweats, fever, fatigue, and weight loss.
results.glossary_definition: Tuberculosis of the lungs.

results.name: Ovarian Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
match: High-Grade Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ovary
Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of Ovary
Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ovary
Large-Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ovary
Non-Small-Cell Type Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of Ovary
Non-Small-Cell Type Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ovary
search: High-Grade Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ovary
Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of Ovary
Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ovary
Large-Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ovary
Non-Small-Cell Type Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of Ovary
Non-Small-Cell Type Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ovary
results.oncotree_disease: High-Grade Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ovary
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the ovary and is characterized by the presence of large malignant cells exhibiting neuroendocrine differentiation. The prognosis is poor.
synonyms: Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of Ovary
Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ovary
Large-Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ovary
Non-Small-Cell Type Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of Ovary
Non-Small-Cell Type Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ovary

results.name: Tuberculous Empyema
results.definition: An empyema resulting from infection by Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
results.glossary_definition: Empyema due to MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS.

results.name: Testicular Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor
results.definition: A testicular germ cell tumor characterized by the absence of a seminomatous component. It includes embryonal carcinoma, yolk sac tumor, choriocarcinoma, teratoma, and mixed forms.
children: Malignant Testicular Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor

results.name: Mediastinal B-Cell Lymphoma, Unclassifiable, with Features Intermediate between Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma and Classical Hodgkin Lymphoma
results.name_text: Mediastinal B-Cell Lymphoma, Unclassifiable, with Features Intermediate between Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma and Classical Hodgkin Lymphoma
match: Mediastinal B-Cell Lymphoma, Unclassifiable, with Features Intermediate between Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma and Classical Hodgkin Lymphoma
Mediastinal B-Cell Lymphoma, Unclassifiable, with Features Intermediate between Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma and Classical Hodgkin Lymphoma
search: Mediastinal B-Cell Lymphoma, Unclassifiable, with Features Intermediate between Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma and Classical Hodgkin Lymphoma
Mediastinal B-Cell Lymphoma, Unclassifiable, with Features Intermediate between Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma and Classical Hodgkin Lymphoma
results.definition: A mediastinal lymphoma with molecular, morphologic, immunophenotypic, and clinical features of both mediastinal (thymic) large B-cell lymphoma and classical Hodgkin lymphoma. The identification of this group of lymphomas, along with recent gene expression profiling results (PDL2 gene expression in both mediastinal (thymic) large B-cell lymphoma tissues and Hodgkin lymphoma cell lines), further supports the hypothesis that mediastinal (thymic) large B-cell lymphomas and classical Hodgkin lymphomas are related entities.
synonyms: Mediastinal B-Cell Lymphoma, Unclassifiable, with Features Intermediate between Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma and Classical Hodgkin Lymphoma
parents: B-Cell Lymphoma, Unclassifiable, with Features Intermediate between Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma and Classical Hodgkin Lymphoma
ancestors: B-Cell Lymphoma, Unclassifiable, with Features Intermediate between Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma and Classical Hodgkin Lymphoma

results.name: Priapism
results.definition: Persistent and usually painful erection that lasts for at least four hours in the absence of physical or psychological stimulation, which can be caused by hematologic disorders, including sickle cell disease and leukemia, spinal cord injuries, and medications.
results.glossary_definition: Persistent and usually painful erection that lasts for at least four hours, in the absence of physical or psychological stimulation, which can be caused by hematologic disorders, including sickle cell disease and leukemia, spinal cord injuries, and medications.

results.name: Adenosquamous Carcinoma
match: Mixed Adenocarcinoma and Epidermoid Cell Carcinoma
Mixed Adenocarcinoma and Squamous Cell Carcinoma
search: Mixed Adenocarcinoma and Epidermoid Cell Carcinoma
Mixed Adenocarcinoma and Squamous Cell Carcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma composed of malignant glandular cells and malignant squamous cells.
results.glossary_definition: A type of cancer that contains two types of cells: squamous cells (thin, flat cells that line certain organs) and gland-like cells.
synonyms: Mixed Adenocarcinoma and Epidermoid Cell Carcinoma
Mixed Adenocarcinoma and Squamous Cell Carcinoma

results.name: Donohue Syndrome
results.definition: A rare autosomal recessive genetic disorder caused by mutations in the insulin receptor gene. Signs and symptoms include a characteristic facial appearance (protuberant and low-set ears, thick lips, and flaring nostrils), intrauterine growth retardation, insulin resistance, and enlarged genitalia.

results.name: Congenital Structural Myopathy
results.definition: A group of rare genetic muscle disorders characterized by hypotonia, muscle weakness, and delayed development of motor skills.

results.name: GM1 Gangliosidosis
results.definition: An autosomal recessive lysosomal storage disease characterized by deficiency of the enzyme acid beta-galactosidase, resulting in the accumulation of acid lipids in the nervous system. Signs and symptoms include neurologic disturbances, muscle atrophy, dystonia, eye abnormalities, and formation of angiokeratomas.

results.name: Colorectal Adenoma
results.definition: An adenoma that arises from the colon or rectum. The group of colorectal adenomas includes tubular, villous, and tubulovillous adenomas, traditional serrated adenomas, sessile serrated adenomas/polyps, and familial adenomatous polyposis.

results.name: Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome
results.definition: A rare, X-linked immunodeficiency syndrome characterized by eczema, thrombocytopenia, and recurrent pyogenic infection. It is seen exclusively in young boys. Typically, IgM levels are low and IgA and IgE levels are elevated. Lymphoreticular malignancies are common.
results.glossary_definition: An inherited immune disorder that occurs in young boys. It causes eczema (a type of skin inflammation), a decrease in the number of platelets (blood cells that help prevent bleeding), and frequent bacterial infections. People with Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome are at increased risk of developing leukemia and lymphoma.

results.name: Breast Hemangiopericytoma
results.definition: A hemangiopericytoma arising from the breast.

results.name: Restrictive Cardiomyopathy
results.definition: A type of heart disorder referring to the inability of the ventricles to fill with blood because the myocardium (heart muscle) stiffens and looses its flexibility. Causes include replacement of the myocardium with scar tissue, abnormal cellular infiltration of the myocardium, or deposition of a substance (e.g., amyloid) in the myocardium.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by an inability of the ventricles to fill with blood because the myocardium (heart muscle) stiffens and loses its flexibility.

results.name: Malignant Renal Pelvis Neoplasm
match: Malignant Neoplasm of the Renal Pelvis
Malignant Tumor of the Renal Pelvis
search: Malignant Neoplasm of the Renal Pelvis
Malignant Tumor of the Renal Pelvis
results.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm that affects the renal pelvis.
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of the Renal Pelvis
Malignant Tumor of the Renal Pelvis

results.name: Vulvar Liposarcoma
results.definition: A rare malignant adipose tissue neoplasm of the vulva.

results.name: Juvenile Type Testicular Granulosa Cell Tumor
results.name_text: Juvenile Type Testicular Granulosa Cell Tumor
match: Juvenile Type Testicular Granulosa Cell Tumor
Juvenile Type Testicular Granulosa Cell Tumor
search: Juvenile Type Testicular Granulosa Cell Tumor
Juvenile Type Testicular Granulosa Cell Tumor
results.definition: A rare sex cord-stromal tumor that arises from the testis. It is the most frequent congenital testicular neoplasm and is usually diagnosed during the perinatal period. It usually presents as an asymptomatic scrotal or abdominal mass. Morphologically it is characterized by the presence of cysts that are lined by cells resembling granulosa and theca cells.
synonyms: Juvenile Type Testicular Granulosa Cell Tumor

results.name: Fetishism
results.definition: A disorder characterized by recurrent sexual urges, fantasies, or behaviors involving the use of nonliving objects such as women's wearing apparel (the "fetish").

results.name: Frontal Sinusitis
results.definition: An acute or chronic inflammatory process affecting the mucous membrane of the frontal sinus.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the frontal sinus; in most cases the infection is caused by the bacteria STREPTOCOCCUS PNEUMONIAE and HAEMOPHILUS INFLUENZAE. This condition may be acute or chronic.

results.name: Acute Endometritis
results.definition: An acute, usually bacterial infection affecting the endometrium. It is characterized by the presence of neutrophils or microabscesses in the endometrial glands. Symptoms include fever, lower abdominal pain, and vaginal discharge.

results.name: Granular Cell Leiomyosarcoma
results.definition: An aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm. It is characterized by the presence of malignant smooth muscle cells with granular cytoplasmic changes.

results.name: Prostate Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the prostate gland. Representative examples include prostatitis, prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia, and carcinoma.

results.name: Basilar Artery Syndrome
results.definition: A syndrome which occurs as a result of the occlusion of the basilar artery. It may be caused by atherosclerosis, embolism or hemorrhage. Clinical signs include dizziness, headache, vomiting, hemiparesis or hemiplegia, dysarthria, dysphagia, blurred vision and loss of consciousness. The clinical course is variable and is dependent upon the extent of the occlusion and the location of the clot along the basilar artery which determines the resultant neurologic impairment. Prognosis is dismal in cases where a complete occlusion occurs with rapid deterioration of neurological function.

results.name: Histiocytoma
results.definition: A mesenchymal tumor composed of fibroblastic and histiocytic cells.
results.glossary_definition: A neoplasm composed of histiocytic cells, for which the malignancy status has not been established.
parents: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Acute Cholangitis
results.definition: Cholangitis that is both sudden in onset and of a relatively short duration.

results.name: Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome
results.definition: A viral respiratory infection caused by the SARS coronavirus. It is transmitted through close person-to-person contact. It is manifested with high fever, headache, dry cough and myalgias. It may progress to pneumonia and cause death.

results.name: Granulosa Cell Tumor
results.definition: A slow-growing, malignant tumor, characterized by the presence of granulosa-like cells and Call-Exner bodies, that is almost always found in the ovary. In rare cases, it has also been found in the testicle. There are two types of granulosa cell tumors that can be distinguished under the microscope: the adult and the juvenile. The testicular juvenile granulosa cell tumors are perhaps the most common congenital testicular neoplasms.
results.glossary_definition: A type of slow-growing, malignant tumor that usually affects the ovary.

results.name: Letterer-Siwe Disease
results.definition: A multifocal, multisystem form of Langerhans-cell histiocytosis. There is involvement of multiple organ systems including the bones, skin, liver, spleen, and lymph nodes. Patients are usually infants presenting with fever, hepatosplenomegaly, lymphadenopathy, bone and skin lesions, and pancytopenia.
results.glossary_definition: Acute, disseminated, rapidly progressive form of Langerhans-cell histiocytosis.

results.name: Childhood Cerebral Ependymoblastoma
results.definition: An embryonal tumor with multilayered rosettes, C19MC-altered that arises from the cerebral hemispheres and occurs in children.
parents: Embryonal Tumor with Multilayered Rosettes, C19MC-Altered
ancestors: Embryonal Tumor with Multilayered Rosettes, C19MC-Altered

results.name: Chronic Tic Disorder
results.definition: A neurological disorder presenting in childhood that is characterized by either motor or phonic tics, but not both, that occur daily or nearly daily for at least a year and are not attributed to an identifiable cause.
results.glossary_definition: A neurological disorder presenting in childhood that is characterized by either motor or phonic tics, but not both, that occur daily or nearly daily for at least a year and are not attributed to an identifiable cause.

results.name: Membranoproliferative Glomerulonephritis
results.definition: Inflammation of the glomeruli characterized by deposits at the intraglomerular mesangium, resulting in thickening of the glomerular basement membrane, activation of complement, and impaired kidney function secondary to damaged glomeruli.
results.glossary_definition: Chronic glomerulonephritis characterized histologically by proliferation of mesangial cells, increase in the mesangial matrix, and a thickening of the glomerular capillary walls. The wall thickening is sometimes said to be a result of the interposition of mesangial cytoplasm or matrix between the basement membrane and the endothelium of the capillary wall. It is often divided into types I and II, and sometimes III. Pathogenesis is not well understood, but some types are thought to involve the immune system, with the complement system, in particular, being implicated.

results.name: Benign Breast Phyllodes Tumor
match: Benign Phyllodes Tumor of the Breast
Benign Phyllodes Neoplasm of the Breast
Benign Phyllodes Tumor of the Breast
search: Benign Phyllodes Tumor of the Breast
Benign Phyllodes Neoplasm of the Breast
Benign Phyllodes Tumor of the Breast
results.oncotree_disease: Benign Phyllodes Tumor of the Breast
results.definition: A usually unilateral, benign and well circumscribed biphasic neoplasm that arises from the breast. It usually affects middle-aged women. It is characterized by the presence of a double layer of epithelial cells that are arranged in clefts, surrounded by a cellular, monomorphic spindle cell mesenchymal component. Mitoses are rare. Necrotic changes may be present in large tumors.
synonyms: Benign Phyllodes Neoplasm of the Breast
Benign Phyllodes Tumor of the Breast

results.name: Developmental Coordination Disorder
results.definition: A disorder characterized by an impairment in the development of an individual's motor coordination skills; this impairment in motor development is not due to a medical condition.
results.glossary_definition: A developmental disorder characterized by voluntary motor skill impairment.

results.name: Adult Pleomorphic Rhabdomyosarcoma
results.definition: An aggressive rhabdomyosarcoma occurring in adults. The neoplasm is characterized by the presence of bizarre round, spindle, and polygonal cells. Clinical presentation includes a rapidly enlarging painful mass usually in the lower extremities.

results.name: Breast Fibrosarcoma
results.definition: A usually aggressive malignant neoplasm arising from the breast. It is characterized by the presence of spindle-shaped fibroblasts and collagenous stroma formation in a herringbone growth pattern.

results.name: Solitary Reticulohistiocytoma
results.definition: A rare cutaneous lesion composed of eosinophilic histiocytes, which are often multinucleated. The lesions are yellow-brown papules affecting any part of the body. Patients are usually adult men. The prognosis is excellent. -- 2003

results.name: Rett Syndrome
results.definition: A progressive neurologic disorder caused by mutations in the MECP2 gene on chromosome X. It almost exclusively affects girls. It is characterized by language and learning difficulties, poor communication skills, and repetitive hand motions. Other signs and symptoms include microcephaly, scoliosis, breathing abnormalities, and sleep disturbances.

results.name: Meningioma
results.definition: A generally slow growing tumor attached to the dura mater. It is composed of neoplastic meningothelial (arachnoidal) cells. It typically occurs in adults, often women and it has a wide range of histopathological appearances. Of the various subtypes, meningothelial, fibrous and transitional meningiomas are the most common. Most meningiomas are WHO grade I tumors, and some are WHO grade II or III tumors. Most subtypes share a common clinical behavior, although some subtypes are more likely to recur and follow a more aggressive clinical course. (Adapted from WHO)
results.glossary_definition: A type of slow-growing tumor that forms in the meninges (thin layers of tissue that cover and protect the brain and spinal cord). Meningiomas usually occur in adults.
children: Spinal Canal And Spinal Cord Meningioma

results.name: Gonococcal Infection
results.definition: An infection that is caused by Gonococcus.

results.name: Immunodeficiency Syndrome
results.definition: Syndromes in which there is a deficiency or defect in the mechanisms of immunity, either cellular or humoral.
results.glossary_definition: The inability of the body to produce an immune response.

results.name: Latent Syphilis
results.definition: A stage of syphilis characterized by the serologic evidence of infection by Treponema pallidum without evidence of accompanying signs or symptoms related to the disease.

results.name: Hermansky-Pudlak Syndrome
results.definition: A group of autosomal recessive inherited disorders characterized by albinism, bleeding tendency, and lung disorders such as pulmonary fibrosis.

results.name: Pituitary Gland Infarction

results.name: Coffin-Lowry Syndrome
results.definition: An inherited syndrome caused by mutations in the RPS6KA3 gene. It is characterized by mental retardation, developmental delay, microcephaly, short stature and kyphoscoliosis.

results.name: Hyperaldosteronism

results.glossary_definition: Overproduction of aldosterone by the adrenal glands, which may lead to hypokalemia and/or hypernatremia.

results.name: Gout
results.definition: A condition characterized by painful swelling of the joints, which is caused by deposition of urate crystals.
results.glossary_definition: A condition marked by increased levels of uric acid in the blood, joints, and tissue. The buildup of uric acid in the joints and tissues causes arthritis and inflammation.

results.name: Spindle Cell Melanoma
results.definition: A melanoma characterized by the presence of malignant spindle-shaped melanocytes.

results.name: Primary Peritoneal Serous Papillary Adenocarcinoma
match: Primary Serous Papillary Carcinoma of Peritoneum
search: Primary Serous Papillary Carcinoma of Peritoneum
results.definition: A rare, serous papillary adenocarcinoma that arises from the lining of the peritoneum. It affects females. The clinical behavior and pathologic characteristics are similar to the serous papillary adenocarcinoma that arises from the ovary.
synonyms: Primary Serous Papillary Carcinoma of Peritoneum

results.name: Infective Arthritis
results.definition: The inflammation of one or more joints caused by any infectious pathogen within the joint space. Symptoms include pain, stiffness, and decreased range of motion in the affected joint.
results.glossary_definition: Infection of one or more joints.

results.name: Pulmonary Edema
results.definition: Accumulation of fluid in the lung tissues causing disturbance of the gas exchange that may lead to respiratory failure. It is caused by direct injury to the lung parenchyma or congestive heart failure. The symptoms may appear suddenly or gradually. Suddenly appearing symptoms include difficulty breathing, feeling of suffocation, and coughing associated with frothy sputum. Gradually appearing symptoms include difficulty breathing while lying in bed, shortness of breath during activity, and weight gain (in patients with congestive heart failure).
results.glossary_definition: A buildup of fluid in the alveoli (air spaces) in the lungs. This keeps oxygen from getting into the blood. Pulmonary edema is usually caused by heart problems, but it can also be caused by high blood pressure, pneumonia, certain toxins and medicines, or living at a high altitude. Symptoms include coughing, shortness of breath, and trouble exercising.

results.name: Bile Duct Mucinous Cystic Neoplasm with an Associated Invasive Carcinoma
results.name_text: Bile Duct Mucinous Cystic Neoplasm with an Associated Invasive Carcinoma

results.definition: A mucinous cystic neoplasm that arises from the intrahepatic or extrahepatic bile ducts and it is associated with an invasive carcinomatous component.
synonyms: Bile Duct Mucinous Cystic Neoplasm with an Associated Invasive Carcinoma

results.name: Lamellar Ichthyosis
results.definition: A very rare, autosomal recessive inherited skin disorder present at birth. It is characterized by the presence of a transparent membrane encasing the newborn. This membrane sheds in about two weeks after birth to reveal generalized scaling and skin erythema.

results.name: Childhood Testicular Neoplasm
results.definition: A neoplasm that arises from the testis during childhood.

results.name: Acute Atopic Conjunctivitis
results.definition: Atopic conjunctivitis that is of relatively short duration and that has a rapid onset.

results.name: Cranial Nerve Neoplasm
results.definition: Abnormal growth of the cells that comprise the cranial nerves.
results.glossary_definition: Benign and malignant neoplasms that arise from one or more of the twelve cranial nerves.

results.glossary_definition: most common cause of primary glomerular disease in Europe, Australia, and United States; lesions formed as a consequence of mesangial formations of immune deposits composed of IgA.

results.name: Refractory T-Cell Lymphoblastic Leukemia/Lymphoma

results.name: Addison's Disease

results.glossary_definition: includes hereditary erythrocyte membrane defects, enzyme deficiencies, hemoglobin abnormalities, stem cell defects (paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria), and alloimmune (Rh) disease of newborn.

results.name: Anthrax
results.definition: An infection caused by Bacillus anthracis bacteria. It may affect the lungs, gastrointestinal tract, or skin. Patients with lung infection present with fever, headaches, cough, chest pain and shortness of breath. Patients with gastrointestinal infection present with nausea, vomiting and bloody diarrhea. Patients with skin infection develop blisters and ulcers.

results.name: Scirrhous Hepatocellular Carcinoma
results.definition: An uncommon type of hepatocelluar carcinoma, morphologically characterized by significant fibrosis around the sinusoid-like spaces and atrophy of the tumor trabeculae.

Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Urinary Bladder
results.definition: A squamous cell carcinoma of the bladder arising from metaplastic epithelium. It represents less than 10% of bladder carcinomas. The exception is the Middle East along the Nile Valley, where it represents the most common form of carcinoma because of the endemic nature of schistosomiasis. Bladder squamous cell carcinoma is often associated with long-standing chronic inflammation of the bladder and usually has a poor prognosis. The diagnosis of squamous cell carcinoma of the bladder should be reserved for those tumors that are predominantly keratin forming.
synonyms: Epidermoid Carcinoma of the Urinary Bladder
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Urinary Bladder

results.name: Intracranial Aneurysm
results.definition: A congenital or acquired aneurysm within the cranium.
results.glossary_definition: Congenital or acquired abnormal outpouching of an intracranial blood vessel wall. Saccular (berry) aneurysms are the most common variant, and tend to form at arterial branch points near the base of the brain. Rupture results in SUBARACHNOID HEMORRHAGE or INTRACRANIAL HEMORRHAGES. Giant aneurysms (>2.5 cm in diameter) may compress adjacent structures, including the OCULOMOTOR NERVE (see also OCULOMOTOR NERVE DISEASES). (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, p841)

results.name: Fibroosseous Pseudotumor of the Digits
results.definition: A non-neoplastic soft tissue disorder characterized by the localized formation of reactive fibrous and bone tissues. It usually occurs in the subcutaneous tissue of the proximal phalanx. Less frequently, it involves the toe. It presents with swelling and pain of the affected area. The prognosis is excellent. However, incomplete excision may lead to the re-growth of the lesion.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Verruca Plantaris
results.definition: A wart in the plantar surface of the foot. It is caused by human papillomavirus.

results.name: Intravascular Nodular Fasciitis
results.definition: A rare self-limiting, rapidly growing, non-encapsulated benign neoplasm that arises from the vessels. It is characterized by the presence of plump spindle-shaped fibroblasts, multinucleated osteoclast-like giant cells, chronic inflammatory infiltrate, red blood cell extravasation, and high mitotic activity.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Marfan Syndrome
results.definition: A genetic syndrome inherited as an autosomal dominant trait. It is caused by mutations in the FBN1 gene. It is characterized by tall stature, elongated extremities, mitral valve prolapse, aortic dilatation, aortic dissection, and subluxation of the lens.
results.glossary_definition: An autosomal-dominant genetic syndrome caused by mutations in the FBN1 gene. It is characterized by tall stature, elongated extremities, pectus excavatum, mitral valve prolapse, aortic dilatation, aortic dissection, and subluxation of the lens.

results.name: Coronary Atherosclerosis
results.definition: Atherosclerosis of the coronary vasculature.

results.name: Pineal Region Choriocarcinoma
parents: Malignant Pineal Area Germ Cell Neoplasm
ancestors: Malignant Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor

Malignant Extragonadal Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor
Malignant Pineal Area Germ Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Peroxisomal Disorder
results.definition: A group of congenital disorders of lipid metabolism, caused by loss of the normal peroxisomes. Signs and symptoms include developmental delays, mental retardation, facial abnormalities, hepatomegaly, and hypotonia.

results.name: Bizarre Leiomyoma
results.definition: A morphologic variant of leiomyoma characterized by the presence of pleomorphic muscle cells with bizarre hyperchromatic nuclei and eosinophilic cytoplasm.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Melanotic Neuroectodermal Tumor
results.definition: A rare neoplasm usually occurring in infants. It is characterized by the presence of a mixture of melanin-containing epithelial cells and smaller neuroblast-like cells. It may involve the skull and facial bones, or the epididymis. It usually has a benign clinical course.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Dermatosis Papulosa Nigra
results.definition: A benign skin condition commonly seen in dark-skinned individuals that is characterized by multiple small hyperpigmented papular lesions resembling seborrheic keratosis on the face and upper body.

results.name: Kidney Sarcoma
children: Clear Cell Sarcoma of the Kidney

results.name: Sclerosing Pneumocytoma
results.definition: A benign tumor that arises from the lung. It is characterized by the presence of sclerotic, papillary, solid, and hemorrhagic patterns and hyperplastic type II pneumocytes. Cholesterol clefts, hemosiderin deposition, chronic inflammation, and calcifications may be present. In the majority of cases, it is a solitary and peripheral tumor. Patients are usually asymptomatic.

results.name: Prosopagnosia
results.definition: Impaired ability to recognize other human faces in the absence of a vision disorder. It may be a congenital disorder or the result of brain injury.

results.name: Plantar Fibromatosis
results.definition: A superficial fibromatosis arising from soft tissue of the plantar regions. It is characterized by the presence of spindle-shaped fibroblasts, hypercellularity, and an infiltrative growth pattern.

results.name: Nasal Cavity Carcinoma
results.definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm arising in the nasal cavity.
parents: Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Carcinoma
ancestors: Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Carcinoma
Paranasal Sinus and Nasal Cavity Cancer

results.name: Malaria
results.definition: A protozoan infection caused by the genus Plasmodium. There are four species of Plasmodium that can infect humans: Plasmodium falciparum, vivax, ovale, and malariae. It is transmitted to humans by infected mosquitoes. Signs and symptoms include paroxysmal high fever, sweating, chills, and anemia.
results.glossary_definition: Plasmodium parasite infection, characterized by fever, flu-like symptoms, anemia, and jaundice, that may be transmitted through infected mosquito bites, blood transfusion, organ transplant, contaminated needles or syringes, or before or during birth.

results.name: Ovarian Low Grade Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma
results.name_text: Ovarian Low Grade Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma
match: Ovarian Low Grade Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma
search: Ovarian Low Grade Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma
results.definition: A category of rare neoplasms that arise from the ovary. It includes low grade endometrioid stromal sarcoma and undifferentiated sarcoma.

results.name: Pulmonary Alveolar Proteinosis
results.definition: A rare lung disorder characterized by the filling of the pulmonary alveoli with proteinaceous material which stains positive with periodic acid-Schiff stain. It may be idiopathic or secondary due to hematologic malignancies or the inhalation of mineral dusts. Signs and symptoms include dyspnea, cough and low grade fever.

results.name: Intestinal Volvulus
results.definition: Twisting of a loop of bowel that results in intestinal obstruction.

results.name: Thoracic Aortic Aneurysm
results.definition: An aneurysm formed in the wall of the proximal portion of the descending aorta proceeding from the arch of the aorta.
results.glossary_definition: An aneurysm in the proximal portion of the descending aorta proceeding from the arch of the aorta and giving rise to the bronchial, esophageal, pericardiac, and mediastinal branches.

results.name: Pituitary Gland Apoplexy
results.definition: A rare, potentially life-threatening disorder caused by acute ischemic infarction or hemorrhage in the pituitary gland. It is most often associated with the presence of a pituitary gland adenoma. Signs and symptoms include headache, vomiting, visual disturbances, and endocrine dysfunction.
results.glossary_definition: Sudden hemorrhage or ischemic necrosis involving the pituitary gland which may be associated with acute visual loss, severe headache, meningeal signs, cranial nerve palsies, panhypopituitarism, and rarely COMA. The most common cause is hemorrhage (INTRACRANIAL HEMORRHAGES) related to a pituitary ADENOMA (see also PITUITARY NEOPLASMS). Ischemia; MENINGITIS; INTRACRANIAL HYPERTENSION; and other disorders may be associated with this condition.

match: Germinoma of Adult Central Nervous System
Germinoma of the Adult Central Nervous System
search: Germinoma of Adult Central Nervous System
Germinoma of the Adult Central Nervous System

Germinoma of the Adult Central Nervous System

Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor

results.name: Adult Dermatomyositis
results.definition: Dermatomyositis in an adult.

results.name: Pituitary Gland Hypoplasia
results.definition: Incomplete development of the pituitary gland.

results.name: Alopecia
results.definition: Hair loss usually from the scalp. It may result in bald spots or spread to the entire scalp or the entire epidermis. It may be androgenetic or caused by chemotherapeutic agents, compulsive hair pulling, autoimmune disorders or congenital conditions.
results.glossary_definition: The lack or loss of hair from areas of the body where hair is usually found. Alopecia can be a side effect of some cancer treatments.

results.name: Squamous Cell Neoplasm
results.definition: A neoplasm that is composed of squamous epithelial cells. Squamous cell carcinoma is a representative example.

results.name: Alper Syndrome
results.definition: A rare genetic syndrome with an autosomal recessive pattern of inheritance. It is caused by a mutation in the gene for the mitochondrial DNA polymerase POLG. Clinical signs are usually not present at birth but develop within the first two years of life and include hypoglycemia from underlying liver dysfunction, failure to thrive, spasticity, myoclonus and seizures. The clinical course follows a progression of neurologic disability and hepatic failure. The prognosis is poor with survival outside the first decade unlikely.
results.glossary_definition: A neurodegenerative disorder with autosomal recessive inheritance that presents in childhood and is characterized by spasticity, seizures, dementia, and liver disease.

results.name: Lymphopenia
results.definition: An abnormally small number of lymphocytes in the circulating blood.
results.glossary_definition: A condition in which there is a lower-than-normal number of lymphocytes (a type of white blood cell) in the blood.

results.name: Uterine Corpus Leiomyosarcoma
match: Leiomyosarcoma of the Body of Uterus
search: Leiomyosarcoma of the Body of Uterus
results.definition: An aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, arising from the uterine corpus. It is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic spindle cells.
synonyms: Leiomyosarcoma of the Body of Uterus

results.name: Olfactory Groove Meningioma
results.definition: A meningioma that affects the olfactory sulcus.

results.name: Rectal Squamous Cell Carcinoma
match: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Rectum
search: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Rectum
results.definition: A very rare rectal carcinoma characterized by the presence of a malignant squamous cell infiltrate.
synonyms: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Rectum

results.name: Granulomatous Hepatitis
results.definition: Hepatitis that is characterized by the presence of granulomas.

results.name: Senile Cataract
results.definition: An age-related, anatomical abnormality that is caused by thickening of the lens of the eye.

results.name: von Willebrand Disease
results.definition: Hereditary or acquired coagulation disorder characterized by a qualitative or quantitative deficiency of the von Willebrand factor. The latter plays an important role in platelet adhesion. Signs and symptoms include bruises, nose bleeding, gum bleeding following a dental procedure, heavy menstrual bleeding, and gastrointestinal bleeding.

results.name: Osteitis Fibrosa Cystica
results.definition: A disorder that is characterized by bone cysts and fractures, resulting from hyperparathyroidism.
results.glossary_definition: A fibrous degeneration, cyst formation, and the presence of fibrous nodules in bone, usually due to HYPERPARATHYROIDISM.

results.name: Colon Leiomyoma
results.definition: A well-circumscribed benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising from the colon. It is characterized by the presence of spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, interlacing fascicles, and a whorled pattern.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Lymphoma-Like Variant
results.name_text: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Lymphoma-Like Variant

search: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Lymphoma-Like Variant
Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Lymphoma-Like Variant
synonyms: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Lymphoma-Like Variant

results.name: Olivopontocerebellar Atrophy
results.definition: A group of sporadic and inherited neurodegenerative disorders affecting the cerebellum, pons, and inferior olives.

results.name: Gilbert Syndrome
results.definition: An autosomal recessive inherited disorder characterized by unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia, resulting in harmless intermittent jaundice.

results.name: Childhood Brain Stem Astrocytoma
results.definition: An astrocytoma that arises from the brain stem and occurs during childhood.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Vaginal Adenoma
results.definition: A glandular epithelial neoplasm that arises from the vagina and shows intestinal differentiation.

results.name: Multicentric Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
results.definition: A papillary carcinoma arising from the thyroid gland from multiple foci.

results.name: Secondary Hyperparathyroidism
results.definition: Overproduction of parathyroid hormone in response to influence external to the parathyroid glands.
results.glossary_definition: Overproduction of parathyroid hormone in response to influence external to the parathyroid glands.

results.name: Landau-Kleffner Syndrome
results.definition: A rare childhood syndrome characterized by the progressive or sudden inability to understand and use spoken language (aphasia) and paroxysmal electrical brain waves. Patients develop epileptic seizures and behavioral changes.

An adenocarcinoma arising from the uterine body cavity. This is the most frequent malignant tumor affecting the uterine body, and is linked to estrogen therapy. Most patients present with uterine bleeding and are over age 40 at the time of diagnosis. The prognosis depends on the stage of the tumor, the depth of the uterine wall invasion, and the histologic subtype. Endometrioid adenocarcinoma is the most frequently seen morphologic variant of endometrial adenocarcinoma.
results.glossary_definition: A malignant glandular neoplasm of the uterine lining.
results.name: Endometrial Adenocarcinoma
Depression
results.definition: A melancholy feeling of sadness and despair.
results.glossary_definition: A mental condition marked by ongoing feelings of sadness, despair, loss of energy, and difficulty dealing with normal daily life. Other symptoms of depression include feelings of worthlessness and hopelessness, loss of pleasure in activities, changes in eating or sleeping habits, and thoughts of death or suicide. Depression can affect anyone, and can be successfully treated. Depression affects 15-25% of cancer patients.

results.name: Spinal Cord Lymphoma
results.definition: A non-Hodgkin or Hodgkin lymphoma that arises in the spinal cord as a primary lesion.

results.name: Cervical Non-Keratinizing Squamous Cell Carcinoma
results.definition: A variant of cervical squamous cell carcinoma characterized by the presence of polygonal squamous cells. Intercellular bridges and cytoplasmic keratinization may be present, but keratin pearls are absent.

results.name: Protein Energy Malnutrition
results.definition: A nutritional deficit that is caused by inadequate protein or calorie intake.
results.glossary_definition: The lack of sufficient energy or protein to meet the body's metabolic demands, as a result of either an inadequate dietary intake of protein, intake of poor quality dietary protein, increased demands due to disease, or increased nutrient losses.

results.name: Solid Papillary Breast Carcinoma
match: Solid Papillary Carcinoma of the Breast
Solid Papillary Carcinoma of the Breast
search: Solid Papillary Carcinoma of the Breast
Solid Papillary Carcinoma of the Breast
results.oncotree_disease: Solid Papillary Carcinoma of the Breast
results.definition: A well circumscribed, low grade neoplasm that arises from the breast. It is characterized by the presence of sheets of malignant epithelial cells that are supported by fibrovascular structures. When there is an invasive component present, it is usually a mucinous carcinoma.
synonyms: Solid Papillary Carcinoma of the Breast

results.name: Dental Pulp Disorder
results.definition: A disorder that affects the dental pulp tissue. Examples include inflammation, calcification, and dental pulp exposure.

results.name: Adenomyoma
results.definition: A benign neoplasm characterized by the presence of a glandular and a mesenchymal (fibromyomatous) component. It occurs in the uterine corpus and the cervix. A variant of adenomyoma associated with glandular architectural complexity is called atypical polypoid adenomyoma. Simple polypectomy is usually curative. Atypical polypoid adenomyoma may recur following polypectomy.
results.glossary_definition: A benign neoplasm characterized by the presence of a glandular and a mesenchymal component.

results.name: Leukostasis
results.definition: A disorder involving the aberrant infiltration and aggregation of leukocytes into the vasculature of the body. Leukostasis is typically detected in the brain and lungs of persons with leukemia. It requires substantial ablative modalities to both reduce the number of cells present and to ensure dispersion of the aggregates.

results.name: Acoustic Schwannoma
results.definition: A type of benign brain tumor that begins in the Schwann cells, which produce the myelin that protects the acoustic nerve - the nerve of hearing.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Melancholic Depression
results.definition: A subtype of depression characterized by the inability to find pleasure in positive things combined with physical agitation, insomnia, or decreased appetite.
